story:
FUNDED ON KICKSTARTER!

 

Blind Wizard Brawl is a "phygital" hybrid game, meaning it uses both physical and digitalcomponents for gameplay. It is primarily a tabletop game which has you and your competing wizard friends sit down and challenge each other for victory in the Brawling Arena!

Each player will also be using a (free!) app which generates private characters, stats and abilities to be used during play.  

What's in the box?

 The game includes three decks, Wave Blaze and Growth. Each deck has four different art variations, and 3x copies of each of these. There are 12 cards in each deck.
The game also includes three art transition cards and an instructions leaflet.

There are only three primary card types in the game: Wave, Growth and Blaze. However, each type of card has a variety of artwork, all of which can be placed next to each other in any way you like to create endless dynamic panoramas out of your cards.

The App is available on Android, iOS and on browser via our website. The First Edition version is currently available, which functionally works for the game, but will not have updated sound effects, artwork or features such as the Privacy Screen and casting sounds.

The App does not require a constant internet connection to run, even on the website. Once you have it, it's there. Updates will be announced every so often if any bugs need fixed, or balancing issues; that's right, should any problems occur, we can fix them for free and in real time! It will also be used to update the app with the newest versions so you can get all your Wizard Codes!

As well as generating your stats and abilities and wizard portrait, the app will also create a wizard name, randomly arranged from three different name sections (prefix, proper noun and suffix) which results in thousands of possible combinations of different names. 
Can you step into the shoes of the Wizard you have now become?

The app is kept simple and clean for you to see everything you need to know at a glance, and most aspect are randomly generated independently of each other, keeping each game unique and exciting! You can change strategies, play with different builds and bluff your opponents, because they will never know which Wizard you are today!

Your Wizard needs to remain private, but if you'd like to keep your phone or device on the table, or rest it down without your foes slyly spying on your stats? Well the handy privacy screen can be summoned with one magical swipe of your finger, and dismissed as quickly!

 Inside the app, you will be able to enter Wizard Codes which unlock specific Wizards certain name parts and unique abilities. Once these codes have been entered, you unlock them for use in your app forever! These codes will be available through various backer rewards and, later on, online events and such. Most Codes will just be digital, but certain codes will come on a Wizard Card with the Wizards name, art and ability for you to own as well.

 The game can be played by 2-4(+) players, and takes roughly 10-20 minutes to play depending on number of players and experience. 

Download a .PNG of the instructions leaflet here!

Each player will need access to their own app, but only one deck of cards is required.

Full instructional GIFs are available from our website!

Click above for full review!

Click above for full review!

 

 "This game's fantastic!" - The Kwarenteen 

 

"I love this game. Every time we finish this game, I've been ready to play again" - HiveState

 

"It's quick for if you're on breaks at work, just chilling with your friends or wanna bust out a quick, easy card game" - Board Game Barrage

 

 "You can play with anybody, anywhere!" - Unfiltered Gamer

 

 

 

£10 - Blind Wizard Brawler:

  • 1 copy of the game, with our love!
  • Our gratification, credits in the app and a Wizard promo codes

£40 - Brawler of the Arena: 

  • A custom Blind Wizard Brawl playmat of your choice!
  • Name a wizard to go in the random generation pool for all players (subject to approval)
  • 1 copy of the game, with our love!
  • Our gratification, credits in the app and a Wizard promo codes

The Playmats
(Please note that the following thumbnails are are not the final artwork that will appear on the playmats you pledge for. The designs will be fundamentally the same, but will feel more finished and appealing)

story:
The Inventor/Founder

Hi! I'm Rob; Founder of Dynamic Dimenzions and inventor of GRIDLOCX and CLICK! I reside in Newport News, VA, and work as an IT Security Manager. I faithfully and honorably served 20 years in the U.S. Army and U.S. Navy. I retired from the Navy, as a highly-decorated Sailor, June 2001. During my last two tours, I discovered my creative talents in writing and inventing. To date, I've created three patents and 300+ innovative, mixed genre patent concepts and numerous mixed genres of novel concepts. I am presenting (2) board games for this crowdfunding to help expedite pushing them through the hurdles associated with upcoming full production runs.

 

 

 

 

 

Above and beyond 

 Your contribution enables the launch of the board games and supports the funding goal that reduces cost, to make it more affordable at the introductory inception. Most of all, your contributions will enable the creation of more products that will eventually help those affected by the pandemic should they sign up for the COVID Campaign which is aimed at helping those financially crashed by creating legitimate, small-scale businesses they can run from the comfort of their home.  

NOTE: Not included; my new Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) “VIRA Shield 2000” (VS2000)/Patent pending #63,024,837; submitted to the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) on 05/14/2020. Plans are to launch the VS-2000 in January 2021.

Goal

My goal is to help 100k people become millionaires and another million generate a recurring income! More in-depth info  on my website: www.STITCHUZ.com

Business Support

 Dynamic Dimenzions (STITCHUZ parent) launches mid-December. Due to COVID, I am launching my contingency plan, which assists those unemployed in starting their own legitimate business. Your support alone, kickstarts the boardgames; which ignites a self-sustaining business platform and mega job creator! I've already launched a strong marketing campaign on STITCHUZ.com, under “COVID Campaign.”   As I push more new, innovative products to the market, I am able to share more cost savings to those affected by the pandemic and enable them to put food on the table, pay bills, and still have enough money to restock their next order. This is nothing more than simply sharing, by drastically lowering my profit margin others can profit as well in these trying times. 

  Dynamic Dimenzions is a product creator that pushes recurring new products; starting with GRID-LOCX and CLICK! So, when you support this campaign, you are not just supporting a small project and founder but up to millions who can benefit from selling these and future products.

What We Need & What You Get

  We need to raise $420,000USDs for GRID-LOCX and CLICK! GRID-LOCX and CLICK! are not your standard flat board games; they have expanded layer decking (with GRID-LOCX), and moving components (with CLICK!) increases costs to manufacture. Due to the manufacturer's loss of time and wages, when setting up a small production run; this production effort becomes more costly. The cost listed below is for both games and is based on a 9.6K production runs per game.

NEW GRID-LOCX

GRID-LOCX and Components

A taste of the high-level rules: First; decide on the play level (long or short). If you have a hot head in the game, they can opt to play the extended version while others play the short version. This alone adds more excitement, and you really don’t know how the game will end, but that’s the excitement! Next, in a round-robin fashion, each player rolls the regular dice. The person with the highest number goes first.  The game is driven by plucking from the deck, following the instruction on the cards, and advancing around the board. There’s also: "PICK’em & GO!" And "Hold-em!" These are additional ways to play; in strategic or stealth mode, but not so fast; because as you advance, an opponent can land on your chip and put you in a holding pattern (onboard) until you draw a REGRID card that allows you to go back to the farthest start point.  This game demands your attention because if you are not alert you could easily lose!

There are 3 ways to win: (1) Card or dice your way off the board, (2) Collect all of one player's move pieces and, (3) attaining seven Wild Cards

Next, I’ll introduce you to the playing cards: 

The card on the left is the face cards duplicated on one side of all the cards and slightly resembles the games, box cover.

This card is used to exit the game. When drawn, you can begin moving your piece from the board, even if you are in the middle of the game.

When drawn, this card allows you to use the spinner to determine your next action on the board.

When drawn, this card allows you to use the spinner two times to determine your next action on the board. It also allows you to miss a turn should you spin a not so rewarding readout on the dial.

When drawn, this card allows you to move one of your pieces from your opponent's holding area and put your piece back in play by placing it in the farthest start area.

This card, when drawn, is used to advance (8) spaces around the board. When drawn, you move your piece forward, (8) spaces.

When drawn, this card directs you to roll the dice the number of times conveyed by the (X). 

When drawn, this card directs you to roll the dice several times as conveyed and multiply the number of moves identified by the (X). 

This card, when drawn, cause you to lose a turn and pass to an opponent. It also allows them an opportunity to get ahead because they have the opportunity to roll twice.

This card, when drawn, allows you to snatch a player wild card. Should you collect 7 Wild cards such as the next card during the game, you instantly become the winner!

Retain (7) of these and instantly win!

This card, when drawn, causes you to move backward on the game board.

When drawn, this card causes you to lose a turn, and the game continues from the person the card is passed to, and the game continues in a round-robin fashion.

When drawn, this card allows you to roll the special dice, which will allow you to either advance around the board or move your furthermost piece back to start.

When drawn as stated, this card causes you to lose a turn and move to the next player in the round-robin.

When drawn, this card allows you to snatch two pieces from various opponents, holding areas, and hold them in your holding area. Collect all of one opponent's pieces, and you instantly win the game.

Players and Ages

 

Grid-Locx

Minimum age is 5+ years old

You can have:

 2 Players

3-4 Players

5-6 Players

Players decide at the start of the game if they want to team up against other players (2 against 1 or other equations) or team up against other teams.

NEW: CLICK!

A taste of the high-level rules: First; decide on the play type (center or outbound). This adds more excitement, and you really don’t know how the game will end! Next, in a round-robin fashion, each player rolls the dice. The person with the highest number goes first. The game is driven by plucking from the deck, following the instruction on the cards, and advancing around the board but not so fast; because as you advance, the player can land on your move piece and block your move piece from advancing around the board. There are times when a skillful player may lock you in until the game is almost over, so you have to be skillful and tactful in placing your moving pieces and covering down on them as you advance around the board. The card or dice will determine how many clicks to the right; you spin the board to align your outer circle colors with the center colors. With Click! You also have the option of playing the game with the player holding cards to strategically plot to win, but not so fast because the middle platform is constantly spinning, so you have to have a very watchful eye as the clicks come and go! Like GRID-LOCX, the game is designed so that new players can join in at any time during the game.

*** NOTE: Cards are still under design

Players and Ages

 

CLICK!

Minimum age is 6+ years old

You can have:

 2 Players

3-4 Players

 

5-6 Players

7-8 Players

 

Collectively

 

GRID-LOCX and CLICK! are amazing board games. They possess advanced designs and hold endless tactical and skillful possibilities that test the player's creativity and their strong desire to win! With both games, you can play for fun or become even more skillful when playing the games with cards in hand because it gives you an even more strategic advantage in plotting your way to victory! 

Roughly, funds will be used in the following capacity:

$8,000.00/Mold

$288,000.00/Full production run 9.6K each boardgame (to include Packaging, Assembly, Final Prototyping)

$4,000/Marketing campaign

$4,000/Advertising campaign

$4,000/Product marketing sampling

$800/Design Graphics Unlimited - No royalty design

$2,000/Product final tabletop testing

$8,000/Perk Incidentals (Product/Shipping/handling, editing, publishing, and printing)

$12,000/Bulk overseas shipping and local distribution (depending on shipment size)

$3,000/Multilingual instruction translation

$TBD/Crowd Fees

Sufficient Funding

With the right funding, we will push both GRID-LOCX and CLICK! to the forefront of tabletop gaming and make them household brands. Once on store-shelves, it is important to us that GRID-LOCX and CLICK! remains affordable and within reach for the majority of low to mid-level family budgets. The best way to achieve this is to use full-scale manufacturing to make the parts. However, the tooling necessary for full-scale manufacturing is a labor-intensive and costly process, requiring a huge upfront investment. Here is the best part... You can help get GRID-LOCX and CLICK! get through the hurdles of manufacturing and be one of the first to get your very own GRID-LOCX or/and CLICK! simply by contributing! Imagine your family members' faces when you come home with one of these games and surprise them!

Perks

Please take a look at some of the many cool rewards we have for my backers! I want my work in your hands and homes, so every pledge of $3 or more is all it takes! If you're compelled to contribute more, we've created some entertaining pledge experiences for your enjoyment. Our perks are copywritten, so outside of this campaign, you can only get them from our website.

Overfunding
 

Should we exceed our goal, we'll stretch our creativity toward more production runs to support our COVID Campaign and continue to lower costs for the COVID businesses we support during the pandemic, so we can sustain as a mega job creator! The products listed become a part of the product line and products that we share. Your contributions help us reach our goal of being able to brand GRID-LOCX" and CLICK! and sustain others that are less fortunate.

  I am currently wrapping up a new novel "The Mirror in the Mirror," a horror/inspirational and SCI-FI novel in which "GRID-LOCX" and CLICK! are played and part of the plot.

  Also, additional funds will be used to ensure that everyone who contributes $150+ receives an autographed soft copy of "The Mirror in the Mirror" and its printed cover on (1) postcard, (1) wallet-size card, and (1) bookmarker. 

  The Impact

  Your contribution has a significant impact on the launch of the games because it allows us to lower production costs. And most of all, it helps those signed up for the COVID campaign by offering more products for their new businesses.  

  Dynamic Dimenzions is a global enterprise launch so the success of these games ignites a global outreach. The success of this project will one day contribute to the economic growth of the U.S. on a major scale and globally on a smaller scale. As the inventor of GRID-LOCX, I am ecstatic about the issuance of the patent in October of 2020 as well as the pending patent for CLICK which should be released soon.

Risks & Challenges

There is low to no risk for this project. The unforeseen risks are unpredictable taxes and unpredictable overseas shipping costs associated with bulk shipping.  With 25 plus years in the civil sector as a contractor and functioning in program and project management, I don't foresee any challenges that can't be easily and expeditiously mitigated with focus. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are one of the over 16 million or more people out of a job; we understand that you may not be able to contribute, but if you have access to the internet you can help spread the word about the Indigogo campaign and even more so; the COVID campaign for those eager to get back on their feet. Thanks in advance for any way that you can help push this campaign forward and make some noise about GRID-LOCX and CLICK!, by using your Indiegogo share tools! Thanks for your time. Take care and stay safe!

SHIPPING:

To provide the best GRID-LOCX and CLICK! Backer experience, we offer a great discount on shipping and handling for backers in the U.S. We continue to work through global shipping hubs worldwide to offer all of our backers' customs, friendly shipping without any additional VAT/duties costs. The shipping fee will be charged as you place your pledge, based on the package's actual costs. We will collect the delivery information at the end of the campaign and ship your rewards from our warehouse once production is completed, and the products have been shipped to us. The shipping fee is sorted into roughly (3) zones:

Zone A ($10 USD): USA, France, United Kingdom, Japan, China, Macau, and Hong Kong.

Zone B ($10): Europe: Germany, Republic of Ireland, Belgium, Luxembourg, The Netherlands, Italy, Spain, Portugal, Switzerland, Austria, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Hungary, Latvia, Lithuania, Poland, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Sweden, Czech Republic, Canada, and Australia.

Zone C ($10-15): Rest of the world.

We cannot guarantee delivery to PO Box. 

All bulk customs fees will be billed to me; no extra payment should be apart from the pledge you make. Bear in mind that these are just estimates and that costs may be based on weight increases due to your final pledge selection.

We are proud to be able to offer you a three-year warranty on any defective parts. The returns of parts will be handled through our website. You must submit a copy of the paperwork received with your perks shipment for validation. When sending the product, please send a SASE big enough to ship the product without damage.  

RULE BOOK

We are still researching the cost to have the instructions translated into various languages, but for now, we will say that the rulebook for the game will be available in English, Spanish, Chinese, and French! You will be able to access other language rule books we have translated in pdf after the campaign ends.

Like these products on:

Website: www.stitchuz.com

Facebook: STITCHUZ Business page

ECO FRIENDLY

As an environmental contributor, during the pre-production process, the plan is to ensure we use environmentally friendly parts but keep in mind that it may not be feasible to make the game 100% environmentally friendly due to the complexity of the game. In any case, there is a commitment to continual environmental safety. Where we see that we can “Go Green” will assess that avenue. Our focus is on creating a safe and healthy environment for our products and our users.

GLOBAL PROJECTIONS

 

To gain a stronghold in the market, we will project GRID-LOCX and CLICK! to the world in a total retail, network, and wholesale setting. We quickly expand across the globe through various external website campaigns into a bigger market segment in record-breaking time. Our networking strategy enables the transition of GRID-LOCX and CLICK! into higher, more respectable market shares when networking on a global stage, when translating the instructions into various languages. This allows GRID-LOCX and CLICK's a major push in the Continental United States (CONUS) and outside the Continental United States (OCONUS).

EXPENSES BY THE NUMBERS

To date; $50,000 has been exhausted in GRID-LOCX and CLICK! from personal checking, personal savings, business checking, business savings, Roth, and 401K. No business debt or equity has been established. Funding has been used for: market sampling, research, and development, business researches, product sampling, invention prototyping, product testing, business planning, novel editing, self-publishing, printing, framing.

Bottom line: We are 100% committed to the GRID-LOCX and CLICK! campaign. Please help spread the word about the GRID-LOCX and CLICK! campaign! Your generosity and enthusiasm in sharing our link with friends, family, groups, forums, and websites, and telling everyone you meet who has an interest in board games, in general, will make a huge difference. We need each person who may be interested in pledging to know about this campaign in plenty of time so they can join in too, and we can make our ambitious GRID-LOCX and CLICK! campaign a big success!

The BIGGER PICTURE!

Please remember that by pledging to this campaign, you are directly helping to support the creation of jobs for those financially crushed by the pandemic because GRID-LOCX and CLICK! will eventually be sold by people who are financially affected as they join our COVID Relief Campaign that we are running on our website. Based on the success of the Indiegogo campaign and COVID campaign, we believe we will be able to meet and exceed all goals in record time. 

Thanks so much for your support!
story_txt:
The Inventor/Founder
Hi! I'm Rob; Founder of Dynamic Dimenzions and inventor of GRIDLOCX and CLICK! I reside in Newport News, VA, and work as an IT Security Manager. I faithfully and honorably served 20 years in the U.S. Army and U.S. Navy. I retired from the Navy, as a highly-decorated Sailor, June 2001. During my last two tours, I discovered my creative talents in writing and inventing. To date, I've created three patents and 300+ innovative, mixed genre patent concepts and numerous mixed genres of novel concepts. I am presenting (2) board games for this crowdfunding to help expedite pushing them through the hurdles associated with upcoming full production runs.

 
 
 
 
 
Above and beyond 
 Your contribution enables the launch of the board games and supports the funding goal that reduces cost, to make it more affordable at the introductory inception. Most of all, your contributions will enable the creation of more products that will eventually help those affected by the pandemic should they sign up for the COVID Campaign which is aimed at helping those financially crashed by creating legitimate, small-scale businesses they can run from the comfort of their home.  
NOTE: Not included; my new Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) “VIRA Shield 2000” (VS2000)/Patent pending #63,024,837; submitted to the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) on 05/14/2020. Plans are to launch the VS-2000 in January 2021.
Goal
My goal is to help 100k people become millionaires and another million generate a recurring income! More in-depth info  on my website: www.STITCHUZ.com
Business Support
 Dynamic Dimenzions (STITCHUZ parent) launches mid-December. Due to COVID, I am launching my contingency plan, which assists those unemployed in starting their own legitimate business. Your support alone, kickstarts the boardgames; which ignites a self-sustaining business platform and mega job creator! I've already launched a strong marketing campaign on STITCHUZ.com, under “COVID Campaign.”   As I push more new, innovative products to the market, I am able to share more cost savings to those affected by the pandemic and enable them to put food on the table, pay bills, and still have enough money to restock their next order. This is nothing more than simply sharing, by drastically lowering my profit margin others can profit as well in these trying times. 
  Dynamic Dimenzions is a product creator that pushes recurring new products; starting with GRID-LOCX and CLICK! So, when you support this campaign, you are not just supporting a small project and founder but up to millions who can benefit from selling these and future products.

What We Need & What You Get
  We need to raise $420,000USDs for GRID-LOCX and CLICK! GRID-LOCX and CLICK! are not your standard flat board games; they have expanded layer decking (with GRID-LOCX), and moving components (with CLICK!) increases costs to manufacture. Due to the manufacturer's loss of time and wages, when setting up a small production run; this production effort becomes more costly. The cost listed below is for both games and is based on a 9.6K production runs per game.
NEW GRID-LOCX

GRID-LOCX and Components


A taste of the high-level rules: First; decide on the play level (long or short). If you have a hot head in the game, they can opt to play the extended version while others play the short version. This alone adds more excitement, and you really don’t know how the game will end, but that’s the excitement! Next, in a round-robin fashion, each player rolls the regular dice. The person with the highest number goes first.  The game is driven by plucking from the deck, following the instruction on the cards, and advancing around the board. There’s also: "PICK’em & GO!" And "Hold-em!" These are additional ways to play; in strategic or stealth mode, but not so fast; because as you advance, an opponent can land on your chip and put you in a holding pattern (onboard) until you draw a REGRID card that allows you to go back to the farthest start point.  This game demands your attention because if you are not alert you could easily lose!
There are 3 ways to win: (1) Card or dice your way off the board, (2) Collect all of one player's move pieces and, (3) attaining seven Wild Cards
Next, I’ll introduce you to the playing cards: 
The card on the left is the face cards duplicated on one side of all the cards and slightly resembles the games, box cover.

This card is used to exit the game. When drawn, you can begin moving your piece from the board, even if you are in the middle of the game.

When drawn, this card allows you to use the spinner to determine your next action on the board.

When drawn, this card allows you to use the spinner two times to determine your next action on the board. It also allows you to miss a turn should you spin a not so rewarding readout on the dial.

When drawn, this card allows you to move one of your pieces from your opponent's holding area and put your piece back in play by placing it in the farthest start area. 

This card, when drawn, is used to advance (8) spaces around the board. When drawn, you move your piece forward, (8) spaces.

When drawn, this card directs you to roll the dice the number of times conveyed by the (X).  

When drawn, this card directs you to roll the dice several times as conveyed and multiply the number of moves identified by the (X).  

This card, when drawn, cause you to lose a turn and pass to an opponent. It also allows them an opportunity to get ahead because they have the opportunity to roll twice.

This card, when drawn, allows you to snatch a player wild card. Should you collect 7 Wild cards such as the next card during the game, you instantly become the winner!

Retain (7) of these and instantly win! 

This card, when drawn, causes you to move backward on the game board. 

When drawn, this card causes you to lose a turn, and the game continues from the person the card is passed to, and the game continues in a round-robin fashion. 

When drawn, this card allows you to roll the special dice, which will allow you to either advance around the board or move your furthermost piece back to start. 

When drawn as stated, this card causes you to lose a turn and move to the next player in the round-robin.

When drawn, this card allows you to snatch two pieces from various opponents, holding areas, and hold them in your holding area. Collect all of one opponent's pieces, and you instantly win the game.
Players and Ages
 
Grid-Locx
Minimum age is 5+ years old
You can have:
 2 Players

3-4 Players

5-6 Players

Players decide at the start of the game if they want to team up against other players (2 against 1 or other equations) or team up against other teams.
NEW: CLICK!



A taste of the high-level rules: First; decide on the play type (center or outbound). This adds more excitement, and you really don’t know how the game will end! Next, in a round-robin fashion, each player rolls the dice. The person with the highest number goes first. The game is driven by plucking from the deck, following the instruction on the cards, and advancing around the board but not so fast; because as you advance, the player can land on your move piece and block your move piece from advancing around the board. There are times when a skillful player may lock you in until the game is almost over, so you have to be skillful and tactful in placing your moving pieces and covering down on them as you advance around the board. The card or dice will determine how many clicks to the right; you spin the board to align your outer circle colors with the center colors. With Click! You also have the option of playing the game with the player holding cards to strategically plot to win, but not so fast because the middle platform is constantly spinning, so you have to have a very watchful eye as the clicks come and go! Like GRID-LOCX, the game is designed so that new players can join in at any time during the game.
*** NOTE: Cards are still under design

CLICK!
Minimum age is 6+ years old
You can have:
 2 Players

3-4 Players
 
5-6 Players

7-8 Players

story:
​

 

Setup: Match a Solar Board with a Planet dial & deck. Draw 5 cards:

 

Each turn play cards from your hand = your starting dial position. If a card or a skill changes it, you must play that many cards next turn.

Resolve left corner effects upon playing. You may also use a planetary skill once per turn:

 

Orbitals are placed to protect your planet and can be activated each turn, Actions are played and discarded, and Leaders are played and may be activated once per turn:

In the end of your turn, draw cards to refill your hand to 5.

 

Click to see a short 2 player game of APS

 

Click to see a short 2 player game of APS

☼ Rules

  • APS Rule Book *

* Will be updated soon with the latest improvements and artwork.

 

☼ The Kwarenteen Reviews: A Place in the Sun

“The dynamic between all that is awesome! It doesn’t really feel like any other card game I’ve played.”

“It’s very fresh and very unique. I definitely recommend checking it out!”

☼ Gamerati (The Curators)

Listen from 17:22.

"It's unlike any other card game I've ever played. My favorite card game, hands down, is Android Netrunner. And A Place in the Sun is a pretty close second because of the dynamic between that wheel and your cards. And that is only for Humans. The other three races - they all play totally different (...)"

☼ BGG Playtester's review by Sarge

"A Place in the Sun has evolved into a great game owing to it's easy to grasp mechanisms and familiar format and supported by well thought-out innovations to the genre that elaborate, rather than complicate."

"If you like games with a small footprint and a light feel but that pack a lot of good decisions and replayability, I think this could appeal to you."

 

☼ Rules & Playthrough videos

► How to Play video (17 min.)

Note: The cards and components shown in the video are an early pre-Kickstarter version.

 

☼ Creative team introduction video

In 2015, we produced a game we crowdfunded: Bright Future. 

In 2017, we crowdfunded A Place in the Sun.

Since 2009 we are organizing in Bulgaria the famous annual Stalker LARP.

 

With any pledge type, you will receive for free everything already added as bonus or unlocked in the Kickstarter campaign.

You can also add to your pledge any sum and pick the following add-ons after the campaign via our pledge manager. See the Gallery for more images (especially the post cards! they are lovely!).

 

The games are being shipped from within Europe.

Shipping cost is flat and will stay the same, regardless of how many Stretch Goals will be unlocked and how many Add-Ons are added to your pledge:

  • EU and USA: €9 / $10
  • World: €12 / $14
  • Bulgaria: €0
We will keep in touch via updates with all steps of the process of game production, shipping and any interesting events. 

You will see we are caring and friendly :) 
Welcome aboard and find your own Place in the Sun!

 

Visit our BGG page and give us a ♥ to help us unlock more content!

 

• A Place in the Sun has already been funded on Kickstarter. We will be printing and sending copies to all backers in the first 3 months of 2018.

• This is our second game, after Bright Future. It was crowdfunded in 2015 and delivered on time to all backers. Under our supervision, our Print Shop partner has printed two editions of Bright Future (in English and in Polish) and several other game projects. We have been working with them for 8+ years printing books, and for 2+ years printing board games.

• We have produced 10 pilot copies of A Place in the Sun. Cutting matrix & dies have been molded and used, all designs have already been made and tested. This way we can calibrate the final copy to perfection.

• The game design and artwork is almost 100% final. We are still tinkering with some illustrations and designs in order to make it perfect.

• The game has been play tested hundreds of times and has proven to be well balanced & fun!

 

Last but not least: enjoy a preview of some of the beautiful artwork & design of A Place in the Sun!

You can click on each image and take a closer look at our art and some of the cards.

And A Place in the Sun is a pretty close second because of the dynamic between that wheel and your cards. And that is only for Humans. The other three races - they all play totally different (...)"
☼ BGG Playtester's review by Sarge
"A Place in the Sun has evolved into a great game owing to it's easy to grasp mechanisms and familiar format and supported by well thought-out innovations to the genre that elaborate, rather than complicate."
"If you like games with a small footprint and a light feel but that pack a lot of good decisions and replayability, I think this could appeal to you." ☼ Rules & Playthrough videos
► How to Play video (17 min.)
Note: The cards and components shown in the video are an early pre-Kickstarter version. ☼ Creative team introduction video
In 2015, we produced a game we crowdfunded: Bright Future. 
In 2017, we crowdfunded A Place in the Sun.
Since 2009 we are organizing in Bulgaria the famous annual Stalker LARP.
 

With any pledge type, you will receive for free everything already added as bonus or unlocked in the Kickstarter campaign.
You can also add to your pledge any sum and pick the following add-ons after the campaign via our pledge manager. See the Gallery for more images (especially the post cards! they are lovely!).

 


The games are being shipped from within Europe.
Shipping cost is flat and will stay the same, regardless of how many Stretch Goals will be unlocked and how many Add-Ons are added to your pledge:

EU and USA: €9 / $10

World: €12 / $14

Bulgaria: €0

We will keep in touch via updates with all steps of the process of game production, shipping and any interesting events. You will see we are caring and friendly :) Welcome aboard and find your own Place in the Sun! 
Visit our BGG page and give us a ♥ to help us unlock more content!
 


• A Place in the Sun has already been funded on Kickstarter. We will be printing and sending copies to all backers in the first 3 months of 2018.
• This is our second game, after Bright Future. It was crowdfunded in 2015 and delivered on time to all backers. Under our supervision, our Print Shop partner has printed two editions of Bright Future (in English and in Polish) and several other game projects. We have been working with them for 8+ years printing books, and for 2+ years printing board games.
• We have produced 10 pilot copies of A Place in the Sun. Cutting matrix & dies have been molded and used, all designs have already been made and tested. This way we can calibrate the final copy to perfection.
• The game design and artwork is almost 100% final. We are still tinkering with some illustrations and designs in order to make it perfect.
• The game has been play tested hundreds of times and has proven to be well balanced & fun!
 


Last but not least: enjoy a preview of some of the beautiful artwork & design of A Place in the Sun!
You can click on each image and take a closer look at our art and some of the cards.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My alias is Joozey, also known as RPGPapercrafts. I'm a paper engineer, artist and developer, as well as a dungeon master and an author of D&D adventures and supplements.

I started this campaign to help fund the production and assembly process of pop-up maps for tabletop role-play games. Technology has reached a point where custom made pop-up books can be produced again without intense labor, and I want to take advantage of that for the tabletop community. But printing, cutting and assembling still is not cheap! So I need your help to make pop-up maps a reality.

Your contribution would help me immensely in my quest. You're not just funding this map, but help show that pop-up maps can be a feasible product. You help me keep going on this path!

 

What We Need & What You Get

The goal I need to reach is 1500 euro. Roughly half of this budget will be spend to printing, cutting and creasing all the parts of the map. The other half covers the cost (my time) into assembling all the maps, sending them to you, designing new maps, writing updates, and more.

So what do you get out of this? Well, that depends on the tiers you choose! I've set up a variety of tiers with additional options. Buy one or more maps in digital blueprint, a do-it-yourself box, or fully assembled! Plus, you can choose for summer, autumn and winter editions of the map. 

 

The Impact

If this campaign succeeds, we will have pop-up scenery available on the market. These landscapes are relatively cheap, add another level to your table games, super easy to store, and brings that unique feeling of paper-based role-play games.

For the past six months I've publicized my research and work on social media. The love and likes I received there prompted me to continue my work and take it to the next level: a professional product on the market. Your support is very important in keeping me going. As long as you say yes, I will continue!

 

Bumps on the road

There will be some challenges on the road, but I have overcome any challenge that I encountered, and I am confident I will tackle the last bumps too. I have produced a fully functional working prototype that allowed me to find a printing press able to produce what I need. From there, we can technically take off!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to support me financially, there's many other ways you can help! Sharing this campaign and my work goes a very long way, and your love and comments on my work is the fuel that keeps me moving forward. Spread the word and likes!

story:
The Empire is falling! Your opportunity to rise to power is now or never. But do you have what it takes to rule an empire and enter history? You will need to excel at diplomacy, perform negotiations, and show merciless cunning when necessary. Forge new regimes, lead your allies into battle to claim the throne and increase your reputation. But watch out! Your own lieutenants are also power thirsty and may just as well be your enemies!

Makiavelia is a 4 to 10 player card game of power, diplomatic rivalry, and statesmanship.

How the Game works

Your goal: to accumulate the most reputation by the end of the game.

Collect as many reputation tokens as possible.

At the end of each round, the Emperor, (the player who holds the crown) earns 5 reputation tokens. The Emperor may also decide to share some of his reputation with his Lieutenants. So always stay on the winning side!

Team up by forming regimes.

Together with a team you stand a better chance to claim the crown. Become the leader by holding the power tokens of your Lieutenants. But in the harsh world of Makiavelia, you cannot trust anyone, and alliances are never forever. So watch your back!

Play your cards wisely.

You will have powerful cards at your disposal. Use them strategically to ascend to power. With a deck of 14 strategies,16 buildings, 33 influences and 44 armies, possibilities are endless! At any time a card could turn the game to your advantage, and the crown could just be within your reach.

Lead historical battles

With 6 different army units at your command, and with the support of your Lieutenants, lead your army into historical battles. Make use of 7 slick strategies to take your rivals by surprise and grasp the crown from their hands!

Find out more about the rules of Makiavelia on the Makiavelia Tutorial Series.

 

 
Alternatively you can take a look at this PDF rule-book.
 

Trial and Errors: 4 years of designing and testing

Makiavelia is the result of 4 years of work and is the result of many iteration. In fact the current version of the game is number 16.2 (16 version, second edition). The game has been tested from 4 players up to 10 players, with board game fans and people who never played board games before. These play-testers provided every time good feedback so as to improve the game and I'm hoping to receive more feedback in the future once the game is published to improve potential future editions and / or expansions.

Here are pics of play-testers trying version 16.1:

Players discussing strategy and planning card combos (prototype testing).

A battle is taking place and strategies are played out (prototype testing).

The sand timer is moving to the 3rd round and players built their buildings. The cemetery us dribbling with mischievous influence cards (prototype testing).

Players are recruiting their armies for a first battle (prototype testing).

Once all armies are out, battle can ensue! (prototype testing).

What People Say

Here are reviews from people who played the game (slightly edited grammatically):

Chatchanis said: "Makiavelia is a good combination of strategy, teamwork, betrayal, and game-play. It has a good player number and duration, which suits party game for casual player or those who play board games regularly like myself. I'm looking forward to the final edition of the game."

Jade said: "This game is great fun! Besides tactics, the design of this beautiful card game really catches the eye and the design is always aesthetically pleasing. It's a diplomatic game, with many different ways to play out your strategies. And you can discover the hidden personality of the players throughout the game also."

Iris said: "I’m not a big fan of board games normally, but even for beginners like myself, Makiavelia is very gripping, unconventional, unpredictable, fun and yet challenging. You need team work, strategic mind and wittiness. One of the positive aspects of this game is it’s for all age groups starting from early teens to pensioners. Different players will respond differently to the game, but all will have fun! I highly recommend it if you want to forget reality without using a gadget and play games among other people and practice your interpersonal skills!"

What You Get

Game Contents: 1 Map • 10 Character cards • 16 Building Cards • 33 Army Cards • 43 Influence Cards • 16 Strategy Cards • 35 Reputation tokens • 24 Wound tokens • 10 Power Tokens • 1 Sand Timer.

Box Size (approximate): 7.25” x 5.25” x 1.75”

Box Weight (approximate): 700 g

What We Need

Makiavelia is the culmination of 4 years of work, from first concept, to designing and testing. I spent the last few months perfecting the game’s rules and feedback to improve the game, leading to the very first tangible copy of Makiavelia. Today, I decided to go a step further and bring the game to more people as a final product, hoping more people can enjoy the game as much as me and my friends did.

In order to do so, however, I’ll need your help. The minimum required quantity is 1,000 copies, and before fully investing in the production, I want to ensure enough people are committed to buying Makiavelia. If together we can raise 6,000 USD (about 170 copies of the game sold), then I can complete the investment and proceed to launching the full production of Makiavelia.

After the sum is collected, the production will take about a month to finalize. I decided to work with a factory near home, in Bangkok, to work closely with the printer and ensure the product meets the quality standards I am aiming for. This ought to be a quality product too, as my wish is to deliver to you the best version of Makiavelia.

The next step will be to contact distributors and share the Makiavelia goodness with as many people as possible. Should we exceed the target significantly, then I will increase the production to issue Makiavelia in other languages.

Hopefully, this project goes beyond Makiavelia: depending on the initial success of this funding, it could mean more adventures: as designer and producer, I have more projects in the pipeline and we could grow my publishing company “Othergames” to bring more fun and exciting games to your tabletop.

Pre-order

With Indiegogo, you get the opportunity to pre-order Makiavelia. I will send you the box immediately after manufacturing is complete, which means it should be with you by November.

You may pre-order a single box set, which comes with a desktop wallpaper set, of which the download link will be sent to your email address.

If you're a shop, organisation or if you wish to make a collective order for you and some friends, you may pre-order a 5 box set or a 10 box set, in which case you will receive them free of shipping costs, saving up to an estimated 28%.

In either cases, your contribution will be printed in the rule-book among the list of co-founders of Makiavelia.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't contribute to this project. Maybe you're not that into tabletop games. That's okay.

However, maybe some of your friends, family or community members are! So here's what you can do to help:

  • Send a tip! among perks, you have the option to donate 1 USD to support the project or a 3 USD with Makiavelia wallpaper set as a gift.
  • Share on social media, such as Facebook, the Makiavelia funding campaign, if your contacts learn about this, you may help reach the target.
  • Share with your community, for instance your local game shop, workplace or school. There’s a special offers of 5 and 10 boxes available.

About the Author

Hi! My name is Benjamin and I’m the developer and designer of Makiavelia. Since my teenage years I was never content with simply playing board games, but always wanted to make my own modified versions. It always remained a hobby, until 4 years ago, when the idea of making Makiavelia became an obsession.

Why did I want to make Makiavelia? Well it’s a combo of various game mechanics and themes I love, but with some unique elements that I was missing in every other games. First I wanted a backstabber’s game, but not one where the winning player is sure to win. In Makiavelia, victory is never assured and the odds could turn around at any time. Second I wanted to have a card-combination strategy game which can be played in many ways, but that isn’t too difficult to play and where players do not need to buy an endless amount of collectible cards. Finally, I wanted a social game, where people get time to be together and collaborate or betray one another, but all in good fun.

If Makiavelia is well received, the I will continue producing. I have few games in draft and I’m already working with some Hollywood production companies to make more versions of Makiavelia, using your favorite movie and series. I let you guess which ;)

Risks and challenges

4 years of work on Makiavelia have led to perfecting the game through testing and feedback.

The primary goal and associated risk, is to ensure there are enough committed buyers to proceed to production. The project is first and foremost to bring Makiavela to life.

The second risk lies with delivery. Although I am confident about the manufacturer being able to deliver a quality product on time, there’s always a chance of delay. I’d hate have backers waiting.

The third risk concerns distribution, since the minimum production is 1000 boxes, it makes only sense to try to share Makiavelia through board game distributors. There’s a risk this process may last longer than expected and that Makiavelia doesn’t make it on time of Xmas in local board game shops.

However, the sooner we find backers to support Makiavelia, the lower will be all these risks

story:
What is Shadow?

When people hear the word 'shadow' they typically think of darkness.  However, shadows are only possible with the presence of light.  We see this same paradox all throughout our physical world; positive and negative things working together to result in something magnificent.  It is the nature of our universe.

Shadow is a trick-taking card game for 2-8 players. It will have various themes to appeal to the diversity in our world.  The first theme developed is called 'Shadow: Harvest'.  It is modeled after the four seasons and gathering crops (points).  A second theme, currently under development, is called 'Shadow: Elements' that uses the four basic elements (Earth, Wind, Air, and Fire) which may appeal more to a different audience. Regardless of the theme, the rules and game-play are identical.

Your support will help cover the costs to produce and market this game for everyone. It can be your part in bringing back 'family time'.

Some of my fondest memories are playing card games with my friends and family.  It is a very inexpensive form of entertainment that delivers hours of fun for everyone.  There are always good laughs and it brings people closer together.

I want to help bring back face-to-face interaction, so I decided to develop a card game.  I spent many hours trying to figure out what elements of card games I enjoy the most, then worked them into a game I call 'Shadow'.

I would also love feedback from supporters after they have had a chance to play Shadow.  My goal is to make the game as good as it can be; something people love to do together.  Wouldn't it be great to get more people spending time with each other around a table?

story:
Short Summary

Round The Country is a multi-player indoor and outdoor board game inspired by creative ways of learning and having fun at the same time.  The game highlights a country's geographical map with states and iconic things and places in the country. The quest of the players to navigate from the starting point, across the map, pass through unexpected obstacles, take a few advantages, and reaches the finish line first. The game offers multidimensional experiences ranging from geographical education, suspense, tactics, logical moves, and so much excitement. Each experience develops the brain and keeps the mind highly enlightened.

Our achieved goal is to create interactive, fun, adventurous, and educational content in a single board game. Yay! we did it. 

We will continue creating more boards in this game collection to contain many countries and all the continents. They will all be tailored to the same amount of excitement, fun, and learning for all age groups. 
Though all the boards will have the same concept of the country's map and city activities, each will create a very unique learning pattern, rules, and iconic playing objects and so much more. Please subscribe so we can reach you when these boards are available in the market. 

We are passionate about this game because we see the advantage of it bonding families and building friendships through interaction, learning, and discovering new things that we all love.

About The Game

Round The Country is designed to create fun and learning for players. The game board has the map of the United States of America, and other countries for other board designs and quest paths from the starting point to finish. Players navigate across the states through the paths by rolling the dice. Along the path, the players will face setbacks, suspenseful activities, questions, and intellectual responses from drawn playing cards.

More boards will be added to the collection by August 2021 with different countries, each with its unique rules, activities, and learning.  

Each gameboard comprises a glossy finished surface, TWO dice, TWENTY poker-sized playing cards, FOUR playing objects (we are converting these objects to country's iconic figures), and a playing manual. 

The board is a .078inch thick paper board, 24inches long x 18inches wide, and when folded, it is 12inches x 9inches, the size of a notebook.   

HOW TO PLAY THE GAME

The game is so easy to play but requires deep thinking, collaboration, and good decision-making to win the opponent(s). Two or more players can play it at the same time.

There are 64 landing positions between the start and the finish points on the board. Each position is given a color-coded circle number on the board starting from 1 to 64.

There are FIVE color-coded circles along the traveling paths on the board. Players are required to start at home location 1. 

The Educative Attributes: One of the first things players would learn playing this game is the ease of identifying the states and their respective capital. Because it is fun to play, players will easily and quickly learn about great locations in the country, learn about key activities in major cities, and the game cards are packed with interactive activities to engage the players in dialoguing and exchanging thoughts for a victory. Parents will find teaching their children very easy and fun. They can teach their children about any country by simply playing the game continuously.  Do not miss out on the updated boards and boards with other country's maps.  This game also has some elements of math, history, geography, and other interesting facts about countries.   

The Fun Side: Now, let's get down to the grand scheme of things. This is the part we are excited to share with you. This game will have you so excited from the start, it is full of suspense, as you think you are heading to the finish line, you might be in for a big setback. You will never know what is coming your way, lol!  

There are FIVE (5) categories of cards on the board, each can quickly change your path to victory. Each time a player lands on a circle, depending on the color of the circle, the player draws a card of the same color with the circle he or she landed on. The player has to follow the instructions on the card as stated.  

The Green Cards cards are mile credits a player would earn for doing the right things similar to everyday commute in the real world. Green cards can give you the advantage of reaching the finish line faster, but there is no guarantee. 

The Red Cards could slow you down or divert players in their race to the finish line. Players will need to respond logically and tactically to veer around the country. Perfect answers are not the only prerequisite for points, but the more accurate and logical a player's answers are, the higher the chances to earn more points that will advance the farther. It is up to the players to make the call how close answers. Every answer and point can be challenged reasonably. But certainly, the wrong answer has a consequence. So players must engage and dialogue well enough with each other throughout the playtime. Players do not have to be too quick to give answers but have to be confident of their responses. The players should note that some instructions will require looking up explanations in books and asking someone else. This game could take the players to research histories, geographic materials, and other academic information.  

 

The Gray Cards are game instructions to exempt players or minimize the impacts due to other harsh instructions. The player with the gray card can only hold it for a certain period of time and can use it anytime within the frame of time he or she possess the card.  

There is a secret pathway but you have to work so hard to earn it. This will not be shared here because it is a secret you have to discover by yourself when you play the game. The trick changes for every game, so it remains a secret. 

The Brown Cards are generally setbacks, and players cannot avoid all of them. You have to hold your breath until you have moved past the brown positions. 

Yellow Cards are a consequential assessment of players as the game progresses.  

We are overexcited about how the combination of the cards creates an integrated mental and emotional excitement and fun, finesse, suspense, and so much unknown expectations throughout the playtime.  

 

Children's Board

We are advancing a special board designed for children. The children's board will create additional learning and even more fun-filled experiences. Children will be able to learn about many countries, animals common to countries, places, basic histories, tourisms and many more. By means of fun, they will learn many things about the world. The edition also has some nicely designed playing objects that are breathtaking.  

 

MORE WORK TO BE DONE WITH YOUR CONTRIBUTION

  1. Add many countries and all the continents to our board collection: 
  2. Advance Children Edition of the gameboard to increase home and school learning
  3. Create iconic playing miniature objects that are unique to countries
  4. Develop Round The Country game in the Android and iOS apps
  5. Additional board finishing: Our current boards and object are nicely done, but we want to add plastic and wooden boards for users' choices. 

 

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

We believe the reward of good work is more work, and the reward of your support is a PRIME board set. For this reason, we have prepared a special package that you will receive at your doorpost by October 1, 2021. And if you want it posted to you by Thanksgiving or Christmas day as a gift to families or friends, simply give us your date and the address, and we will do the rest. This is the best gift for Thanksgiving and Christmas holidays.

Please Press the BACK IT button, and contribute as much as you can, and we will send you a set of the game board. We will provide you with the list of countries that their boards will be available in the market by August 30, 2021. 

 

 

Risks & Challenges 

We locked in a good production cost with a manufacturer and we want to meet the milestone by July 19, 2021. So we have limited time to award the contract. We are counting on your supports to make this a huge success.

Please do not hesitate to drop your concerns about this game at roundcountry@gmail.com

Other Ways You Can Help

Press the BACK IT button, and contribute with an amount you can, and we will send you a set of the game board. We will provide you with the country list we have in our collection by July 1, 2021. 
Please do not forget to share the Indiegogo link of this project with people who can support us. We look forward to seeing your name on our list of contributors and supporters. Let's do this together!  

Thank you very much for being here!

 

- The Team That Worked On Creating This Idea - 

  • Tin Law 
  • Chiz
  • Glory U.  
  • Amy 
  • Ify  
  • Ejike 
  • Game experts
story_txt:
Short Summary
Round The Country is a multi-player indoor and outdoor board game inspired by creative ways of learning and having fun at the same time.  The game highlights a country's geographical map with states and iconic things and places in the country. The quest of the players to navigate from the starting point, across the map, pass through unexpected obstacles, take a few advantages, and reaches the finish line first. The game offers multidimensional experiences ranging from geographical education, suspense, tactics, logical moves, and so much excitement. Each experience develops the brain and keeps the mind highly enlightened.
Our achieved goal is to create interactive, fun, adventurous, and educational content in a single board game. Yay! we did it. 
We will continue creating more boards in this game collection to contain many countries and all the continents. They will all be tailored to the same amount of excitement, fun, and learning for all age groups. Though all the boards will have the same concept of the country's map and city activities, each will create a very unique learning pattern, rules, and iconic playing objects and so much more. Please subscribe so we can reach you when these boards are available in the market. 
We are passionate about this game because we see the advantage of it bonding families and building friendships through interaction, learning, and discovering new things that we all love.
About The Game
Round The Country is designed to create fun and learning for players. The game board has the map of the United States of America, and other countries for other board designs and quest paths from the starting point to finish. Players navigate across the states through the paths by rolling the dice. Along the path, the players will face setbacks, suspenseful activities, questions, and intellectual responses from drawn playing cards.
More boards will be added to the collection by August 2021 with different countries, each with its unique rules, activities, and learning.  
Each gameboard comprises a glossy finished surface, TWO dice, TWENTY poker-sized playing cards, FOUR playing objects (we are converting these objects to country's iconic figures), and a playing manual. 
The board is a .078inch thick paper board, 24inches long x 18inches wide, and when folded, it is 12inches x 9inches, the size of a notebook.   


HOW TO PLAY THE GAME
The game is so easy to play but requires deep thinking, collaboration, and good decision-making to win the opponent(s). Two or more players can play it at the same time.
There are 64 landing positions between the start and the finish points on the board. Each position is given a color-coded circle number on the board starting from 1 to 64.
There are FIVE color-coded circles along the traveling paths on the board. Players are required to start at home location 1. 
The Educative Attributes: One of the first things players would learn playing this game is the ease of identifying the states and their respective capital. Because it is fun to play, players will easily and quickly learn about great locations in the country, learn about key activities in major cities, and the game cards are packed with interactive activities to engage the players in dialoguing and exchanging thoughts for a victory. Parents will find teaching their children very easy and fun. They can teach their children about any country by simply playing the game continuously.  Do not miss out on the updated boards and boards with other country's maps.  This game also has some elements of math, history, geography, and other interesting facts about countries.

The players should note that some instructions will require looking up explanations in books and asking someone else. This game could take the players to research histories, geographic materials, and other academic information.

story:
Taking notes or keeping track of your game is a tricky issue. Campaign Journal helps documenting your game so it is neat, tidy and easy for you to look for pieces of information later.

 

 

Campaign Journal is a faux-leather cover binding, filled with booklets specially designed to help you document your games, whether you’re a GM or a player.

 

We have two editions for the product: GM Edition and Player Edition.

 

The GM Edition contains booklets for documenting your:

  • Setting: for writing about the history of your setting, pantheon and cosmology, creating a world map, describing your regions, organizations and explaining the technology present in your setting.
  • Campaign: for documenting your plot, the background of your campaign, where it’s placed in the world, who the player characters are, the regions and locations where the story takes place, recurring NPCs, enemies, important organizations and rewards.
  • Adventure: has space for writing the dates of your adventure, the background or context, the goals, quests, locations, events, encounters and rewards. Finally you can document your encounters with XP, difficulty, participants, description, rewards and a squared grid to draw where the encounter takes place.
  • NPCs: you can describe your created characters with a portrait, residence, appearance and equipment, stats, occupation and history, mannerism, talent, abilities, useful info, interactions with others, ideal, bond, and flaw or secret.
  • Locations: lets you define a big settlement, with its appearance, government, defense and recurring NPCs; and several places within that settlement, with their placement, appearance, notable NPCs, hooks and a squared grid to draw the layout of the place.
  • Dungeon: is perfect for creating your dungeon, describing its placement, major enemies, minor enemies, NPCs, background of the dungeon, a squared grid to draw the layout of the dungeon and space to describe what the different rooms in it contain.

 

The Player Edition has the following booklets:

  • People: for describing the different NPCs and PCs you encounter, with their residence, description and miscellaneous information.
  • Places: here you can write about the places you go, their placement within the settlement or the world, the NPCs there, and miscellaneous information.
  • Campaign Notes: is the booklet you will use most during play, with space to write the date of the session, to-do, important things to remember, rewards you got in the session, additional notes, and brief space to write about people you meet, places you go.

 

Each and every one of these booklets can be removed from the cover binding, rearranged, replaced, etc, so you can use the same cover for different games changing your set of booklets, or add more booklets if you need them (for example, if you have a lot of NPCs and need another booklet).

 

 

  • Has different pockets for storing your game props or tools, like maps, initiative cards, spell cards, printed stat blocks, letters for the players, etc.
  • System-agnostic, so it can be used for any tabletop RPG game, to take your notes or prepare your campaign.
  • Stylish design, resembling an antique book.
  • Comfortable to store all the material you need for your game.
  • Easy to fill in and for taking orderly notes.
  • Reusable, you can use the cover for different games just changing the set of booklets.
  • High quality paper of 106 gsm weight; it doesn't ghost or bleed with most pens.

 

What does 'system-agnostic' mean? It means it can be used with any Tabletop RPG game. We have identified the common features in several games, and Campaign Journal's content is designed to help you prepare, decument and play your favorite game in a way that's easier for you.

All Tabletop RPGs have settings, people, locations -every setting has a universe -or universes that has stories and people living in it.

 

We have special prizes for you if you decide to pledge to our campaign. Here is the list of rewards according to each tier:

 

 

Campaign Journal is created by Francita and Pablo, under the brand Brynlis by francita. We are a couple of designers from Chile, very passionate about tabletop RPGs, so we decided to put our skills to design products for us players, to make our games more interesting.

 

  • Twitter
  • Facebook
  • Behance

 

  • Twitter
  • Facebook
  • Website

 

We are making our calculations with a total of 60 contributors to reach our $5500 goal. The amount of money we are asking will be used in two main things: producing the products for our Indiegogo contributors and setting up our online store to keep selling our product. For the online store we want to set up the website, pay domain and hosting, and produce stock of products to sell. The following graph shows how we will spend the money we make in the campaign, according to our calculations.

 

​If we get more money than we are expecting, that will help us have more stock for our online store and of course produce for our extra contributors.

As for the risks, these are the main concerns we have:

  • Delivery time: we are from Chile, so shipping from here will take a bit of time, supposedly 15-20 days, but delays may happen.
  • Shipping service: delivery does not depend on us, but on the service we are employing to ship our product to you. Again, inconveniences may occur, and we’ll try to do our best to reduce these problems as best as our capacity allows us.
  • Much more contributors than expected: we are making our calculations with a certain amount of contributors, and if we get much more than expected, then production will be a little delayed because of the added production quantity we’ll have to make. If this happens though we’ll have enough money to hire help for production, and accelerate the process with the buy of machinery.
  • Universality: Campaign Journal's design doesn't rely on specific system mechanics so it can be used for any tabletop RPG game, although it has been mostly tested with Fantasy RPGs. We will have a playtest period just after finishing the campaign, so you will be able to give us your feedback and we will surely know if it works for any game as it is or if we will need to design new booklets to make it work.

 

 

 

Contribute to make this project a reality by sharing our campaign with your friends and people who might be interested in it, and also following us on our social media:

 

  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Twitch
  • Youtube
  • Instagram

story:
THE IDEA

The idea for such a deck started when I started using simplistic decks. But they always had a problem, they couldn't be or weren't marked. So i set out to create a deck that would be simple, MARKED, as well as handle like butter. Magicians know how powerful and useful gaffs like Double  backers and duplicate cards are, so thats what aspire to deliver.

ALSO, they look absolutely breathtaking in motion, due to the boxes, as you see in the trailer, making them perfect for cardistry!

  • Simplistic back design best for performing magic, cardistry, as well as Card games.
  • Luxury stock and gaffs makes it perfect for Performers.
  • Square design looks great in cardistry
  • FULLY MARKED
  • Pre-stacked in mnemonica order 
  • Limited edition 1 of 1000 decks, no reprints ever.

An idea as such can only be funded with YOUR help. Every dollar helps. Support this project and help Supreme playing cards come to life.

What We Need & What You Get

Heres a little breakdown for where your contribution will be going.

  • The production price for the decks is about 4000$ Plus there is Handling fees, Plate fees, as well as Packaging and storage fee, and very little profit for me.
  • All this equates to around 4500$ for printing the decks. Thus the goal is $5000, the extra 500$ being shipping charges compensation.
  • If we don't complete the funding goal within the 45 day period, no one will be charged.

THE BACKS

 

The backs were made with the performer in mind. Simplistic yet they scream elegance from the first glance. The boxes and the supreme text blend to somehow look great in motion and cardistry.

 

 

THE FACES​

 

The faces are standard, however there is luscious metallic ink throughout the number cards, as well as the court cards. All the indices have been coloured black, for a uniform yet casual feel to the deck. 

 

THE COURT CARDS

 

     SPADES

          DIAMONDS

      HEARTS

THE MARKING SYSTEM

YES! The deck is marked! Such a simplistic deck, coupled with a marking system, is a first of its kind. Exploring hundreds of different possibilities, i have finally designed a perfect marking system, Uncatchable to even MAGICIANS, yet easily readable from a hands distance. It is marked in TWO places, so no matter what side you look from, you can easily read the marks. It is not a reading system, but a marking system. Even ONE deck comes with a full length download explaining the marking system as well as teaching numerous tricks using it.

 

THE HANDLING

 

The deck is printed by Hanson Chien Production , on their highest quality stock available. This is the Luxury stock, which is a crushed stock, used in the immensely famous Blue Chicken Nugget playing cards, Oddyssey Playing cards, SCYTHECARDS,  and now the Black Supremes.

 

LIMITED EDITION  BLOOD RED 

 

1 OF 10 EVER PRINTED. EVER. Printed by Cartamundi in Belgium, each  BLOOD RED SUPREME deck is coated with the legendary B9 true linen finish, and comes with the same gaffs, downloads, and bonuses like the Black Supremes.

GET IT NOW FOR ONLY 20$. You're almost certain to find it on Ebay for twice the price, if the campaign is successful.

 

The GAFFS and additional bonuses

Each deck comes with 3 special gaff cards. A double backer, a DUPLICATE CARD, as well as a blank card. Plus, a FREE, 30 minute download, teaching numerous tricks with these gaffs, has been included with the purchase of even 1 DECK. 

PLUS, every purchase of more than 3 decks, comes bundled with both the downloads, (Marking system+gaff system) as well as TWO bestselling effects, TRANSCEND and NUMERO, both worth $15, sold on Penguin Magic, for absolutely free.
 

 

Sleight52 video download:

 

 Sleight52 is a collection of effects featuring Pravar Jain, Henry Wallace, and Alex Alejandro. We go through the decks amazing marking system, and teach more than 10 complete effects using the gaff cards included in the deck, as well as countless tips. It retails for 15$, but now you can get it for free with every purchase of Supreme Playing Cards.

 

Transcend by Area52 and Numero by Area52

 

Transcend is a mobile effect, created by Me, Pravar Jain. Numero is a groundbreaking acaan routine, created by Me and Henry Wallace, which refused to leave the Penguin Magic Top Charts for weeks on end. Both retail for 9$ on Penguin Magic. Get both complimentary with every purchase of 6 or more Supreme Playing card decks.

 

HOW TO USE PAYPAL TO BUY THEM:

 

To use Paypal as a method, paypal the money to this email:  sacredaces52@gmail.com

OR:     lolprae@gmail.com

and make sure to write or email what reward do you want, or how many decks you want. Thanks!

 

SHIPPING COSTS:

*International 

1 deck - $7 / 2 decks - $8 / 3 decks - $12$ / 4 decks - $14 / 5 decks - $15 /  6 decks - $17 /

 7 decks - $18 / 8 decks - $19  / 9 decks - $20 / 10 decks - $21 / 11 decks - $22 / 12 decks - $24 

/ 24 decks - $42

*Taiwan

1-6 decks - $5

6-12 decks - $7

12-72 decks - $10

144 decks - $45

 

ADD-ONS

(For example if you want to buy 7 decks, choose the 6 decks option and add 12$ to your pledge)

1 DECK: 12$

UNCUT SHEET: 20$

LIMITED EDITION RED DECK (1 OF 10 EVER PRINTED): 20$

 

STRETCH GOALS

 

SPECIAL THANKS

A big thank you to Hanson Chien, for helping me along the design process. Infinite hugs to my buddy Henry Wallace, for allowing me to giveaway our co-creation, NUMERO, to the SuperBackers.

NOTE-

*We are in no way related to the company Supreme New York, and we do NOT intend to pretend to be them, or intend to infringe their rights.*
