Luxury stock and gaffs makes it perfect for Performers.
Square design looks great in cardistry
FULLY MARKED
Pre-stacked in mnemonica order 
Limited edition 1 of 1000 decks, no reprints ever.

An idea as such can only be funded with YOUR help. Every dollar helps. Support this project and help Supreme playing cards come to life.

What We Need & What You Get
Heres a little breakdown for where your contribution will be going.

The production price for the decks is about 4000$ Plus there is Handling fees, Plate fees, as well as Packaging and storage fee, and very little profit for me.
All this equates to around 4500$ for printing the decks. Thus the goal is $5000, the extra 500$ being shipping charges compensation.
If we don't complete the funding goal within the 45 day period, no one will be charged.


THE BACKS

 
The backs were made with the performer in mind. Simplistic yet they scream elegance from the first glance. The boxes and the supreme text blend to somehow look great in motion and cardistry.
 
 
THE FACES​



 
The faces are standard, however there is luscious metallic ink throughout the number cards, as well as the court cards. All the indices have been coloured black, for a uniform yet casual feel to the deck. 
 
THE COURT CARDS
 

     SPADES

          DIAMONDS

      HEARTS
THE MARKING SYSTEM

YES! The deck is marked! Such a simplistic deck, coupled with a marking system, is a first of its kind. Exploring hundreds of different possibilities, i have finally designed a perfect marking system, Uncatchable to even MAGICIANS, yet easily readable from a hands distance. It is marked in TWO places, so no matter what side you look from, you can easily read the marks. It is not a reading system, but a marking system. Even ONE deck comes with a full length download explaining the marking system as well as teaching numerous tricks using it.
 
THE HANDLING
 

The deck is printed by Hanson Chien Production , on their highest quality stock available. This is the Luxury stock, which is a crushed stock, used in the immensely famous Blue Chicken Nugget playing cards, Oddyssey Playing cards, SCYTHECARDS,  and now the Black Supremes.

 
LIMITED EDITION  BLOOD RED 

 
1 OF 10 EVER PRINTED. EVER. Printed by Cartamundi in Belgium, each  BLOOD RED SUPREME deck is coated with the legendary B9 true linen finish, and comes with the same gaffs, downloads, and bonuses like the Black Supremes.
GET IT NOW FOR ONLY 20$. You're almost certain to find it on Ebay for twice the price, if the campaign is successful.

 
The GAFFS and additional bonuses
Each deck comes with 3 special gaff cards. A double backer, a DUPLICATE CARD, as well as a blank card. Plus, a FREE, 30 minute download, teaching numerous tricks with these gaffs, has been included with the purchase of even 1 DECK. 
PLUS, every purchase of more than 3 decks, comes bundled with both the downloads, (Marking system+gaff system) as well as TWO bestselling effects, TRANSCEND and NUMERO, both worth $15, sold on Penguin Magic, for absolutely free. 
 
Sleight52 video download:
 
 Sleight52 is a collection of effects featuring Pravar Jain, Henry Wallace, and Alex Alejandro. We go through the decks amazing marking system, and teach more than 10 complete effects using the gaff cards included in the deck, as well as countless tips. It retails for 15$, but now you can get it for free with every purchase of Supreme Playing Cards.
 
Transcend by Area52 and Numero by Area52
 

Transcend is a mobile effect, created by Me, Pravar Jain. Numero is a groundbreaking acaan routine, created by Me and Henry Wallace, which refused to leave the Penguin Magic Top Charts for weeks on end. Both retail for 9$ on Penguin Magic. Get both complimentary with every purchase of 6 or more Supreme Playing card decks.

 
HOW TO USE PAYPAL TO BUY THEM:
 
To use Paypal as a method, paypal the money to this email:  sacredaces52@gmail.com
OR:     lolprae@gmail.com
and make sure to write or email what reward do you want, or how many decks you want. Thanks!
 
SHIPPING COSTS:
*International 
1 deck - $7 / 2 decks - $8 / 3 decks - $12$ / 4 decks - $14 / 5 decks - $15 /  6 decks - $17 /
 7 decks - $18 / 8 decks - $19  / 9 decks - $20 / 10 decks - $21 / 11 decks - $22 / 12 decks - $24 
/ 24 decks - $42
*Taiwan
1-6 decks - $5
6-12 decks - $7
12-72 decks - $10
144 decks - $45
 
ADD-ONS
(For example if you want to buy 7 decks, choose the 6 decks option and add 12$ to your pledge)
1 DECK: 12$
UNCUT SHEET: 20$
LIMITED EDITION RED DECK (1 OF 10 EVER PRINTED): 20$
 
STRETCH GOALS

 
SPECIAL THANKS
A big thank you to Hanson Chien, for helping me along the design process. Infinite hugs to my buddy Henry Wallace, for allowing me to giveaway our co-creation, NUMERO, to the SuperBackers.
NOTE-
*We are in no way related to the company Supreme New York, and we do NOT intend to pretend to be them, or intend to infringe their rights.*

story:
The Rare & Magnificent Creatures Tarot was born from love & reverence for nature. 

I wanted to create a tarot deck that would draw on the beauty & majesty of nature while celebrating the many incredible species with which we share the earth. 

 

Sadly, so many of these beautiful animals are under threat from human activity. There are 41,415 species on the ICUN Red List, with 16,306 classed as endangered and facing extinction. 

The Rare & Magnificent Creatures Tarot features 78 of these incredible animals, printed on FSC certified cardstock & using renewable energy.  Available in the Luna & Sunseeker editions, the artwork is imprinted in luminous gold foil across artisan cardstock. 

 Combining my love of nature & tarot, the deck features shimmering artwork of each species in luminous gold. Each creature corresponds to the traditional Rider Waite deck symbolising the meaning of the card.

I wanted to create a tarot that would raise awareness for the creatures that call our planet home and strengthen a connection to the natural world. 

I created the Rare & Magnificient Creatures Tarot to raise awareness about the varied, unique and diverse animals that call our planet home. I hope you enjoy reading, intuiting and divining with the deck as much as I have enjoyed creating it.

The Deck

 Printed on FSC certified, 320 GSM card stock both the Luna & Sunseeker edition feature shining gold foil artwork across symbolic representations of each species.  The cards measure 2.75 x 4.75 in the standard tarot sizing. 

 

 The Luna Edition 

Inspired by love and connection to the moon, the Luna edition of the deck channels this energy into your readings. Featuring luminous gold artwork on artisan quality black card, this edition helps connect your intuition to the cosmos through carrying the energy of the night. 

 

The Sunseeker Edition 

Created to channel the energy of the sun & day into readings, the Sunseeker edition features 78 cards in luminous white with gold foil artwork. Carrying the joy and brilliance of day, this edition of the deck works across conscious energies to bring light and radiance to the deck. 

The Box 

 Each deck will be housed in a rigid two-piece box with gold foil artwork in matching black or white for each edition of the deck. 

The Guide 

A tarot sized 2.75 x 4.75 78 page guide will be included with all decks covering the symbolism of each card & meaning.

A tarot sized guide will be included with all decks.

The Add Ons 

Mirroring the connection with the natural world & speaking to the synchronicity of all things, each version of the deck comes with its own set of add ons including organic cotton tote bags, sustainable cotton tarot pouches & enamel pins. 

Unlocked Goal - Matte Gold Edges

At 30K AUD funding, we unlocked matte gold edges for all decks.

The Major Arcana 

The Major Arcana mirrors the traditional Rider Waite tarot and features 22 cards with celestial symbolism accompanying each creature. 

The Minor Arcana 

The Suit of Stars (Pentacles) 

 

The Suit of Cups 

 

The Suit of Wands 

 

The Suit of Swords 

About Me

My name is Daisy and I am a writer, artist and lifelong adorer of nature and animals. I have worked in not for profits and sustainability for several years and have a strong commitment to ecological conservation, equality and justice. I've rescued many animals from possums to kittens to my beautiful rescue dogs & want to dedicate my life to conservation, art and writing.

 

Timelines

The deck will be produced with 100% recyclable FSC certified papers and environmentally safe inks.  I have chosen an artisan producer of tarot cards, Ludocards, due to their strong ecological commitments, high quality and use of renewable energy to produce the deck. 

Production is on track for delivery by September 2021. 

 

Carbon Neutral Postage via Sendle 

Zone 1 - New Zealand (10-20 working days)

Zone 2 - North America, Western Europe, Asia and the Pacific (21-28 working days)

Zone 3 - Rest of the world (25-30 working days)

 

Packaging

All packaging has been selected with sustainability as the top priority, including compostable mailers, labels and 100% recyclable protection for the deck in transit. Rare Creatures Co is part of the noissue Eco Packaging Alliance as part of our commitment to using sustainable packaging in all products.

 

What's Next

 I have started the design for the Rare Creatures Compendium - a full hard copy guide to the deck with information about each species featured, different tarot spreads and the symbolism & meaning of the deck in detail. I hope to launch this project later this year as our next campaign.

story:
Who we are

My name is Denys and together with my friends I have been dealing with social services for many years. We have successfully organized various social projects aiming at the improvement of youth position in our society, implementing non-formal education and inspiring the rise of social values in lives of young people. 

My friends and I have created a very cool game which kills two birds with one stone. To be more exact, you will definitely have fun playing and it will also give you a chance to check up on friends, old mates or acquaintances who you have lost touch with. 

You will need to call a person from your contacts who will be able to give a correct answer in order to play or even win the game.

About the game

Do you know which of your friends, acquaintances or just random people from your contact list is keen on music, geography, sports, films and cartoons or other areas of life?

Are you ready to compete with your friends and prove that your contacts are the best?

If ‘yes’, then this game is what you need!

If you usually play with your closest friends and yet you miss those who are far away this is your solution. The need to unite friends is exactly what inspired us to create “The Contacts: call or lose”. We tried it and it turned out to be much more fun than we expected! 

This game can be played at parties, at home with family, at school, while traveling outside the city or anywhere else. Just make sure you take your phone and the game cards.

We bet you will have fun!

 

There are 500 questions from completely different areas of our life in “The Contacts: call or lose”.  For example, ‘Which Italian city is built on water?’ or ‘Which movie characters speak Banana language?'

It doesn't really matter whether you know the answer or not ( you will actually see the answer when you take a card ha-ha). You just need to choose the right person to call and ask. 

 

This game is designed for a group of 2-6 players (it can be more, but in this case, the game will take more time ).

The rules of the game are very simple.

There are 5 deck of cards on the table in front of you with cards of different colors and different difficulty levels (green - first level, yellow - second, purple - third, red - fourth, black - fifth level).

You pull cards with questions of the appropriate level when it is your turn. Decide which contact can help you. Call him or her. You have 60 seconds to get the right answer.

 

The player who gets 5 correct answers first, based on the results of completed circles, becomes the winner.

 

We are sure that if you play once you will not go to the party unless there is this game ha-ha)

Support us and we will make sure that your event are always fun!


We are on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/thecontacts.game and Facebook https://www.facebook.com/The-Contacts-call-or-l...

What We Need & What You Get

At this point we have prepared pre-release version of the game and tested it in focus groups.

We need required funding in order to improve design of game cards and  to start mass release of this game for non governmental organizations and schools .
It will also enable us to send printed versions of the game to our backers.

You have a chance to get a really thrilling game no later than March, 2020 if you send us any amount of money not less than €25.

We are highly  responsible and, thus, we are still obliged to send the game unless we get less money than expected.

The Impact

We think that this game is:

  • an amazing opportunity to call your old friends and make sure you  keep in touch even after the game is over
  •  an opportunity to keep your brain fit
  • refresh school knowledge and boost your awareness level

Risks & Challenges

Where are we at?
Currently:

  • we have created 500 questions, completed the design of cards, printed test sets which have been played by focus groups;
  • dealing with game design improvement;
  • negotiating about game mass production;
  • working at  “The Contacts: Alco edition” and “The Contacts: Sex edition” with focus groups.

If our team manages to gain our goal capital, we are planning to print and send the game to everybody who has backed corresponding amount not later than March 2020.

We are for open and honest communication with our backers. So feel free to contact us and ask if you have any questions. We are also glad to read your reviews or opinions!

story:
We are already funded on Kickstarter and finalising designs for production process.

 

In this fast-paced, engaging game, players take on the role of conspiracy theorists and compete against each other to explain their theories about the world around them. 

With over 200 cards in the game the possibilities for new random stories is virtually endless, an ideal party game for players who like comedy and story-telling.

We are looking to gain further support in this game to make sure as many people as possible have the chance to get a copy of It's Just A Theory when it is produced and enjoy playing the game as much as we and our play testers have done.

Download the alpha print and play file and rules to try it yourself from our website

Players work against each other to create a conspiracy theory, using ‘'Fact'’ cards that contain concepts or objects which can be used to form conspiracy theories. In a round, one player is the lead conspiracy theorist who will begin a theory using one of their ''Conspiracy'' cards. The lead conspiracy theorist then uses their pool of "Fact" cards to move the story in certain directions with the aim of allowing them to finish their theory by playing a ''Propaganda'' card. The more “Fact” cards they play in a chain the more points they score.

How to Interrupt

There are several interruption mechanisms available in It's Just A Theory

1) If the current Lead Conspiracy Theorist mentions the contents of another player's card, either as part of their theory or in response to a question (player's may question the Lead Conspiracy Theorist at any point), they may take over the theory.

2) If a player believes they have a better theory or explanation to the current ''Fact'' or ''Propaganda'' card. Other players may then vote to allow the challenger to take over the theory or not.

3) Playing a ''Greater Conspiracy'' card. If the theme of the most recent ''Fact'' card matches a green Conspiracy card with the ''Greater Conspiracy'' watermark in a player's hand, they may play this card immediately to take control of the theory. Doing this the player can now restart the theory from this ''Greater Conspiracy'' card.

How to Win

The winner of a round is the player who plays their Propaganda card ending the theory. Points are scored by finishing theories with more points awarded for every card in the finishing players uninterrupted chain. 

The winner is the conspiracy theorist who has the most points at the end of the game. So don your tinfoil hat, open your third eye, ensure your subcutaneous xenoestrogen injection unit is charged and prepare to discover truths you did not know about the world, and remember:

It's Just A Theory!

Unique Conspiracy Crafting Card Game

It's Just A Theory is a unique spin on the story telling mechanic using outlandish ideas based on real 'conspiracy theories'.

We enjoy story telling card games and RPGs. It’s Just A Theory uses features we love from such games like Once Upon A Time to provide a new, fresh, easier to play, version of the story telling concept. It’s Just A Theory couples the story telling mechanic with a voting system, which creates a fun, dynamic party game that can easily lead to hilarious conversations and debates. We feel this system of voting coupled with interrupts and debates allows for the game to be played by a wide range of people, from seasoned story tellers, to people interested in the concept of conspiracy theories. 

To summarise; It’s Just A Theory is unique as it combines collaborative story telling with voting, which means you have to convince others of your conspiracy theories, as well as yourself.  You're guaranteed to have hours of fun playing this game.

Easy to Learn, Quick to Play

It's Just a Theory can be played within minutes of opening the box. We've designed the core rules to be as simple as possible whilst retaining an interesting and challenging depth to the game. The rules allow for players of all skill levels to quickly learn and play the game, whilst also challenging veteran players to develop new strategies. (i.e. knowing what card a player may be alluding to in their challenge and providing alternate explanations to retain play).

Initial print exclusive Content

As our first group of loyal backers, you will be entitled to a unique set of rewards with your game. 

Play Tested Extensively

The game has been play tested for over a year by the designers and friends and blind play testers over 200 times. But don't take our word for it, check the comments or even download the Beta copy.

 Replayable

The game has a vast number of cards that can be used in a multitude of combinations, meaning that you can pick it up and have a fun game each time you play it, with new and exciting theories told every time. Even after multiple plays, knowing what cards are in the deck, just adds to another level of strategy to the game. 

Box Summary  

1 two part box made of 157gsm paper stock and 800gsm Grey board. 

1 rulebook at 128gsm. 

206 cards at 300gsm card stock.

 

We are a small independent games company based in the United Kingdom with a desire to create fun, unique and entertaining games. We founded early 2016 by a few friends with a passion for board gaming. This is our first game which we hope you enjoy playing as much as we do

 

How It Started

It's Just A Theory started by accident, in an attempt at procrastination whilst one of the creators was writing their thesis. He quickly he needed help and enlisted long-time friends to aid in development of the game concept.  

After a few weeks the basic idea for It's Just A Theory was formed and an initial deck (on pen and paper) was developed. The developers were eager to gain other views and naturally headed to the local pub with friends, to do some serious play testing. The best part of this session was that one of the play testers genuinely thought this was a Print and Play game that already existed saying ''But this seems like a proper game.'' From this it was decided to Kickstart the game to share it as widely as possible with other board game enthusiasts.

The development of this game has been a great learning curve for us and allowed us to engage with so many great people, all enthusiastic about boardgames and development. We really love It's Just A Theory and really enjoy story-telling card games. One of the key pieces of inspiration for this game has been the amount of fun we've had playing Once Upon A Time and we'd really like to share the great concept of story-telling games to others with a fresh update.

Let's take a moment to introduce the team

Jamie V

J is a human male defiantly born on the planet earth currently studying for a PhD in Physics, in the hopes of one day fixing his space... I mean earth ship. When not shining lasers at things he enjoys typical earth activities like walking in forests and eating subsistence.

Favourite games: Avalon, Love letter,  It's Just a Theory , El Grande, New World: A Carcassonne Game

Joe S

Joe  is a human male with no discernible lizard based characteristics who got a PhD in physics on Earth to learn more about human technology. In his free time he likes to i̶n̶c̶r̶e̶a̶s̶e̶ ̶h̶i̶s̶ ̶c̶o̶r̶e̶ ̶b̶o̶d̶y̶ ̶t̶e̶m̶p̶e̶r̶a̶t̶u̶r̶e̶ play games, to the point now where he thinks he can make one. 

Favourite games: It’s Just A Theory, Hanabi, Pandemic, D&D, Galaxy Truckers, Space Cadets, Firefly Boardgame, Roll for it, Settlers of Catan, Ticket to Ride

 

George W

Unit G30RG3 was constructed in late 2073 and through a series of scientific experiments has landed in the current year to study where Earth went wrong. Due to an error with machine learning algorithms and the rise of IBM's Watson, G30RG3 Winstone has become the mandroid he now is.

Favourite games: It's Just A Theory, Eldritch Horror

 

Joey Walters

Joey Walters is our artist. She has been so great working with us giving us ideas and somehow managing to turn the ramblings of 3 physics students into great artwork! We are so grateful for all she has done, and I really encourage you to take a look at her showreel for other projects she's been invovled with.

                                 www.joeycwalters.com

 

 

Risks and challenges

We have spent nearly 2 years play-testing and designing of the game itself.

In terms of risk associated with the project, we freely admit we are new to game development and it has been a steep learning curve.

Fortunately the boardgame design community is very friendly and open and have provided useful feedback and help with how to minimise the risk and deliver a high quality game to you.

We see the risk in this game as minimal, and the most significant of these being delays in time associated with when production will start. This is because we are designing over 200 unique cards. Whilst we have the concepts for well over 200 cards ready, as seen on our alpha deck, we need to finalise the art work for the 200 cards. 
We have already made ~50 of these cards which we have been putting around our social media platforms to gain feedback to optimise. But we admit there is a risk in delays in the process of conceptualizing and getting our artist to design every card to a high standard that we like and would be proud to put out to you. 
Of course during the campaign we will still work on this and keep you updated as to the state of card design.

In conclusion, we will provide you with a high quality product and hope you enjoy playing It's Just A Theory as much as we have designing it.

In this fast-paced, engaging game, players take on the role of conspiracy theorists and compete against each other to explain their theories about the world around them. 
With over 200 cards in the game the possibilities for new random stories is virtually endless, an ideal party game for players who like comedy and story-telling.
We are looking to gain further support in this game to make sure as many people as possible have the chance to get a copy of It's Just A Theory when it is produced and enjoy playing the game as much as we and our play testers have done.


Download the alpha print and play file and rules to try it yourself from our website
Players work against each other to create a conspiracy theory, using ‘'Fact'’ cards that contain concepts or objects which can be used to form conspiracy theories. In a round, one player is the lead conspiracy theorist who will begin a theory using one of their ''Conspiracy'' cards. The lead conspiracy theorist then uses their pool of "Fact" cards to move the story in certain directions with the aim of allowing them to finish their theory by playing a ''Propaganda'' card. The more “Fact” cards they play in a chain the more points they score.
How to Interrupt
There are several interruption mechanisms available in It's Just A Theory
1) If the current Lead Conspiracy Theorist mentions the contents of another player's card, either as part of their theory or in response to a question (player's may question the Lead Conspiracy Theorist at any point), they may take over the theory.
2) If a player believes they have a better theory or explanation to the current ''Fact'' or ''Propaganda'' card. Other players may then vote to allow the challenger to take over the theory or not.
3) Playing a ''Greater Conspiracy'' card. If the theme of the most recent ''Fact'' card matches a green Conspiracy card with the ''Greater Conspiracy'' watermark in a player's hand, they may play this card immediately to take control of the theory. Doing this the player can now restart the theory from this ''Greater Conspiracy'' card.
How to Win
The winner of a round is the player who plays their Propaganda card ending the theory. Points are scored by finishing theories with more points awarded for every card in the finishing players uninterrupted chain. 
The winner is the conspiracy theorist who has the most points at the end of the game. So don your tinfoil hat, open your third eye, ensure your subcutaneous xenoestrogen injection unit is charged and prepare to discover truths you did not know about the world, and remember:
It's Just A Theory!

Unique Conspiracy Crafting Card Game
It's Just A Theory is a unique spin on the story telling mechanic using outlandish ideas based on real 'conspiracy theories'.
We enjoy story telling card games and RPGs. It’s Just A Theory uses features we love from such games like Once Upon A Time to provide a new, fresh, easier to play, version of the story telling concept. It’s Just A Theory couples the story telling mechanic with a voting system, which creates a fun, dynamic party game that can easily lead to hilarious conversations and debates. We feel this system of voting coupled with interrupts and debates allows for the game to be played by a wide range of people, from seasoned story tellers, to people interested in the concept of conspiracy theories. 
To summarise; It’s Just A Theory is unique as it combines collaborative story telling with voting, which means you have to convince others of your conspiracy theories, as well as yourself.  You're guaranteed to have hours of fun playing this game.
Easy to Learn, Quick to Play
It's Just a Theory can be played within minutes of opening the box. We've designed the core rules to be as simple as possible whilst retaining an interesting and challenging depth to the game. The rules allow for players of all skill levels to quickly learn and play the game, whilst also challenging veteran players to develop new strategies. (i.e. knowing what card a player may be alluding to in their challenge and providing alternate explanations to retain play).
Initial print exclusive Content
As our first group of loyal backers, you will be entitled to a unique set of rewards with your game. 
Play Tested Extensively
The game has been play tested for over a year by the designers and friends and blind play testers over 200 times. But don't take our word for it, check the comments or even download the Beta copy.
 Replayable
The game has a vast number of cards that can be used in a multitude of combinations, meaning that you can pick it up and have a fun game each time you play it, with new and exciting theories told every time. Even after multiple plays, knowing what cards are in the deck, just adds to another level of strategy to the game. 
Box Summary  
1 two part box made of 157gsm paper stock and 800gsm Grey board. 
1 rulebook at 128gsm. 
206 cards at 300gsm card stock.
 

We are a small independent games company based in the United Kingdom with a desire to create fun, unique and entertaining games. We founded early 2016 by a few friends with a passion for board gaming. This is our first game which we hope you enjoy playing as much as we do
 
How It Started
It's Just A Theory started by accident, in an attempt at procrastination whilst one of the creators was writing their thesis. He quickly he needed help and enlisted long-time friends to aid in development of the game concept.  
After a few weeks the basic idea for It's Just A Theory was formed and an initial deck (on pen and paper) was developed. The developers were eager to gain other views and naturally headed to the local pub with friends, to do some serious play testing. The best part of this session was that one of the play testers genuinely thought this was a Print and Play game that already existed saying ''But this seems like a proper game.'' From this it was decided to Kickstart the game to share it as widely as possible with other board game enthusiasts.
The development of this game has been a great learning curve for us and allowed us to engage with so many great people, all enthusiastic about boardgames and development. We really love It's Just A Theory and really enjoy story-telling card games. One of the key pieces of inspiration for this game has been the amount of fun we've had playing Once Upon A Time and we'd really like to share the great concept of story-telling games to others with a fresh update.
Let's take a moment to introduce the team
Jamie V

J is a human male defiantly born on the planet earth currently studying for a PhD in Physics, in the hopes of one day fixing his space... I mean earth ship. When not shining lasers at things he enjoys typical earth activities like walking in forests and eating subsistence.
Favourite games: Avalon, Love letter,  It's Just a Theory , El Grande, New World: A Carcassonne Game
Joe S

Joe  is a human male with no discernible lizard based characteristics who got a PhD in physics on Earth to learn more about human technology. In his free time he likes to i̶n̶c̶r̶e̶a̶s̶e̶ ̶h̶i̶s̶ ̶c̶o̶r̶e̶ ̶b̶o̶d̶y̶ ̶t̶e̶m̶p̶e̶r̶a̶t̶u̶r̶e̶ play games, to the point now where he thinks he can make one. 
Favourite games: It’s Just A Theory, Hanabi, Pandemic, D&D, Galaxy Truckers, Space Cadets, Firefly Boardgame, Roll for it, Settlers of Catan, Ticket to Ride
 
George W

Unit G30RG3 was constructed in late 2073 and through a series of scientific experiments has landed in the current year to study where Earth went wrong. Due to an error with machine learning algorithms and the rise of IBM's Watson, G30RG3 Winstone has become the mandroid he now is.
Favourite games: It's Just A Theory, Eldritch Horror
 
Joey Walters
Joey Walters is our artist. She has been so great working with us giving us ideas and somehow managing to turn the ramblings of 3 physics students into great artwork! We are so grateful for all she has done, and I really encourage you to take a look at her showreel for other projects she's been invovled with.
                                 www.joeycwalters.com
 
 
Risks and challenges
We have spent nearly 2 years play-testing and designing of the game itself.
In terms of risk associated with the project, we freely admit we are new to game development and it has been a steep learning curve.
Fortunately the boardgame design community is very friendly and open and have provided useful feedback and help with how to minimise the risk and deliver a high quality game to you.
We see the risk in this game as minimal, and the most significant of these being delays in time associated with when production will start. This is because we are designing over 200 unique cards. Whilst we have the concepts for well over 200 cards ready, as seen on our alpha deck, we need to finalise the art work for the 200 cards. We have already made ~50 of these cards which we have been putting around our social media platforms to gain feedback to optimise. But we admit there is a risk in delays in the process of conceptualizing and getting our artist to design every card to a high standard that we like and would be proud to put out to you. Of course during the campaign we will still work on this and keep you updated as to the state of card design.
In conclusion, we will provide you with a high quality product and hope you enjoy playing It's Just A Theory as much as we have designing it.

story:
We've passed 20%! Help us get funded so millions of people can enjoy this game!

 

New early bird perk available! The original early bird special plus 3 custom cards at just $17. Hurry, only 5 available. 

 

Game of Choice - A Party Game (17+)

Game of choice is a party game that will keep you and your friends entertained for hours upon end. Here's the run-down:

  • Each player is dealt 9 scenario cards. For example, "Funnel a fifth of Orloff wearing assless chaps."
  • Each player anonymously hands the dealer a scenario card. 
  • The dealer chooses which scenario card he/she would rather do, and the player who handed that card to the dealer wins a point. The first player to reach seven points lives happily ever after (A.K.A. wins the game).

How It Works (In Detail)

Step 1:

Each player is dealt nine cards (three awesome, three awful and three neutral). 

Awesome Cards..

Neutral Cards...

Step 2:

The dealer rolls an obnoxiously large die to set the category. Just like the scenario cards, the category can be awesome, awful or neutral.

Step 3:

Each player anonymously hands the dealer a card of their choosing based on the category rolled. (hint: the strategy of the game is to accurately guess which card your dealer will choose, so if Mike hates crusty couch pizza, DON'T give him crusty couch pizza!)

Final Step!

The dealer assesses his/her cards then reads all of them out loud. After some thought, the dealer states which scenario he would rather do and awards a point to the player who handed him/her that card. The first player to seven points lives happily ever after (A.K.A. wins the game)!

Our Story

About two years ago Sierra and I (a.k.a the team) randomly stopped what we were doing, sat down and decided we were going to come up with a slam dunk (awesome) idea. After about an hour of thinking really, really hard, Game of Choice was born. 

Tyler & Sierra

 

Why Game of Choice? There are so many new inventions that don't really make much of a difference in the world, and so few inventions that do the simple job of making people laugh. The days of sitting down with our friends and family to play hilarious card games seem to be dwindling down, but we think its about time to reignite that flame. 

How long did it take us? 510 hilarious scenario cards aren't something you think of overnight. In fact, it took us about two years to have each card finished (keep in mind, our standard for awesome and awful cards was pretty high). Once the game was finished, we sat down and decided that the best way to raise the money we needed (and get the word out) was to launch an Indiegogo campaign.

The original prototype (& My Dog Twix)

 

Our Goal

In order to bring our game into the world, we need your help. We've set our campaign goal at $10,000, which will help us pay for Game of Choice's product development and website, as well as allow us to ship your rewards for pledging. After extensive research, we know that in order to make this vision become a reality, our campaign goal is a bare minimum requirement. That's why we decided to launch this project. Keep in mind, if we don't reach our campaign goal, we don't get to keep anything (and you'll get your money back). In other words, our goal is all or nothing! Here's what you get for pledging:

 

How You Can Help

  • Back our project - every contribution counts, and we greatly appreciate any pledge you send our way!
  • Spread the word - the more people who hear about us, the better chances we have of making Game of Choice a reality. So, spread the word!
  • Offer your support - shoot us an email and let us know how you can help! 

Risks & Challenges

Over the last couple years, we've been in communication with a handful of game manufacturers in order to find the perfect company to develop Game of Choice. While our post-campaign game plan is pretty rock-solid, there's still the chance that something gets delayed and your game is delivered a few weeks past our November 1 delivery date; however, we think the chances of this happening are pretty slim, and if it does happen, we will keep you updated every step of the way.

story:
WELCOME TO GRIDIRON POWERRUN

 

We love games. We love the game. What better combination to bring you this awesome , new, unique game that brings awesome game play and great-looking pieces together! Play by yourself, or play with a friend - its a game thats perfect for any football fan's rec room or tailgate party.

WHATS IN THE BOX

  • 1 plastic mould table 
    • dimensions: 28" long, 20" wide, stands at 7"
    • rubber finishes on grip handles

  • 3 plastic mould pieces each team:
    • 1 runner      - the piece that can score touchdowns

    • 2 blockers - pieces that can drop the opposition runner

 

LOOK AND FEEL OF GP

Gridiron PowerRun (GP) is a table game much like Foosball but for American Football except in GP you control free-moving pieces on the table. Because of the GP table's rounded bottom, you do this by simply tilting the table around and the pieces move, its really that simple to maneuver. 

 

 

The pieces are rigged with a propulsion mech that allows them to move forward and turn when the table is tilted. Just hold the handles and tilt the table, and make the pieces 'run' around the field. Its very intuitive gameplay.

Propulsion mechanism

Some of the design features GP has:

  • Simple yet instantly recognisable table
  • round knob at the bottom for tilting gameplay
  • unique tilting gameplay. Just tilt the table to move the pieces
  • pieces move and turn on table and turn just like real players running and turning on a field

 

THE GAMEPLAY OF GP 

There are two sides: offense and defense.  Each side has a total of 3 pieces: 1 runner and 2 blockers. 

 

To play a game:

  • Place the pieces on the table at the appropriate yard line, and the objective is simple: get your runner to the end zone first before any opposition pieces.  
  • Avoid any of your pieces being tackled - that is a down, play switches at the yard line
  • Avoid any of the defense pieces reaching your end zone first
    • in this case it is a down and play switches at 50yard line
  • GP has many options to play. You can play:
    • 1 vs 1 - the easiest . Just two pieces on the table. This is best for practicing to play GP.
    • 2 vs 2 - this is medium level difficulty. Typically a down/touchdown lasts a couple of minutes.
    • 3 vs 3 - hard difficulty level. 
    • You also have options to change the ball size for each piece, a heavier ball being faster but more difficult to control.
    • You have the option to change platform size for the blockers (the platform is the ring that the ball is in, and the piece stands on). This allows you to have greater flexibility with the blockers in terms of using heavier balls.

GAME VIDEOS

[this is a random play. There are many losing plays here]

 

[this is a winning play. Note the offense piece (red in this case) gets to the end zone before any of the defense pieces]

 

[this is a losing play. Note how the defense piece (white) gets to the endzone first before any of the offense pieces (red). That is considered a down and play switches]

 

THE TEAM

The team is mainly comprised of two brothers each bringing a unique element to the team:

Tom Chad- The founder and developer of the game and gameplay, and design. Tom is a qualified software developer and graphic designer with over 6 years of development and design, including diverse industries such as mobile telecoms and banks.

Tap Chad - Our finance person and and qualified CA and auditor. Makes sure we keep in line with good financial practices and will manage whatever funding we get. 

 

WHAT WE NEED

We arrived at a total cost of $15,000 and here is a breakdown:

RISKS & CHALLENGES

First and foremost we as a team DO NOT want this campaign to be one of those where you wait two years and get 100 emails before you receive your rewards. We want to deliver as promised in our manifesto.  Thats why we got an auditor on the team - to keep us accountable.

GP is a relatively simple game to put together (it took about 15 minutes to put it together from scratch when we did it manually). So we know we will have a handle on the production and its easy to check the quality of each item since they are few pieces to check (7 in total - a table and 6 pieces) We do not want any return for faulty equipment if possible also.

With this in mind we decided to keep the rewards tier as simple as possible. This is because we want to fulfill our rewards as soon as possible, and get GP out there.

It will be our first shot at productionizing the process, so we are both anxious and hopeful. Our chosen producer has a good track record of productionizing toys so that does make us feel very confident.

The rewards tiers will include the international shipping charge, only for tiers that need shipping. This model was best so that we could make sure that we have covered all bases in terms of fulfilling our rewards.

 

THANK YOU!

For taking the time to read our campaign. We are trying to establish ourselves as a leader in the sports games industry and we believe this is a step in the right direction.

story:
Cryptocurrency Themed Playing Cards & Poker Chips

For cryptocurrency enthusiasts like myself, I have created casino-quality cryptocurrency themed playing cards and poker chips! Scroll down to see their high-quality specifications.

(Playing cards and poker chips can be purchased separately or together as perks available on this Indiegogo campaign) Get ready for some Texas HODL poker!

The more support and backing that we receive, the more we can produce as the cost per unit goes down significantly if we produce in large quantities.  So brighten up your next party, poker night or social gathering with our cryptocurrency themed playing cards and poker chips!

You can also help support this campaign by sharing it with your friends, family or anyone that is a cryptocurrency enthusiast!

Playing card specifications

  • 54 card deck (52 playing cards + 2 jokers) of playing cards in standard poker-size of 2.5'' x 3.5'' (63.5mm x 89mm)
  • Premium 310gsm casino quality cardstock plastic coated (linen finish), origin of material from France
  • Featuring Bitcoin, Ethereum, Litecoin, Dash, Bitcoin Cash, Cardano, Stellar, NEO, Tron, NEM, Monero, IOTA, Status and Dogecoin
  • UV coated (glossy) tuck box for storing and protecting your playing cards

Poker chip specifications

  • Size: 40mm diameter, 3mm thickness
  • Weight: 13.5g (per chip)
  • Material: Made from clay composite, matt PP with lamination finish
  • Chips come in a premium gunmetal aluminum poker chip case for safe storage
  • Set of 500 chips includes:
    • 50 Bitcoin chips (Orange)
    • 100 Ethereum chips (Yellow)
    • 150 Litecoin chips (Red)
    • 200 IOTA chips (White)

Why back this project?

Supporting this project will:

  • Help us mass produce these cryptocurrency themed playing cards and poker chips
  • Enable us to cover the cost to launch and sell on Amazon at a later date
  • Enable you to purchase our products now as perks for your support! (listed on this page)
  • Make you the envy of your poker crew for having the coolest cards and chips available

Referral contest

As a way to both get the word out about the project and thank the people who do so, there will be a referral contest running throughout the campaign.

The 3 people who bring in the most money to the project through their referral links will get the following:

  • 1st place will get 2 decks of cryptocurrency themed playing cards & a set of 500 poker chips
  • 2nd place will get 2 decks of cryptocurrency themed playing cards
  • 3rd place will get 1 deck of cryptocurrency themed playing cards

To count as a referrer, you must promote the campaign with Indiegogo’s share tools (located at the top of the page) while logged into your Indiegogo account. This is important because otherwise, your unique ID won’t be attached to any resulting contributions or visits.

Example

When Funder A is logged into their account and uses Indiegogo’s share tools to send a tweet, for example, the link in the tweet includes Funder A’s unique ID. Then, when Funder B reads the tweet and clicks through the link to contribute, Funder A is recognized as helping bring in the amount contributed by Funder B.

Other notes

The playing cards and poker chips do not hold or have any monetary cryptocurrency value. Our playing cards and poker chips are just for use in playing card games such as poker. They are not actual cryptocurrency and are not to be used as monetary instruments or vehicles.

The cryptocurrency logos featured in these playing cards and poker chips are being used in accordance with their respective creative commons licenses.

200 IOTA chips (White)


Why back this project?Supporting this project will:
Help us mass produce these cryptocurrency themed playing cards and poker chips
Enable us to cover the cost to launch and sell on Amazon at a later date
Enable you to purchase our products now as perks for your support! (listed on this page)
Make you the envy of your poker crew for having the coolest cards and chips available
Referral contestAs a way to both get the word out about the project and thank the people who do so, there will be a referral contest running throughout the campaign.The 3 people who bring in the most money to the project through their referral links will get the following:

1st place will get 2 decks of cryptocurrency themed playing cards & a set of 500 poker chips

2nd place will get 2 decks of cryptocurrency themed playing cards

3rd place will get 1 deck of cryptocurrency themed playing cards
To count as a referrer, you must promote the campaign with Indiegogo’s share tools (located at the top of the page) while logged into your Indiegogo account. This is important because otherwise, your unique ID won’t be attached to any resulting contributions or visits.ExampleWhen Funder A is logged into their account and uses Indiegogo’s share tools to send a tweet, for example, the link in the tweet includes Funder A’s unique ID. Then, when Funder B reads the tweet and clicks through the link to contribute, Funder A is recognized as helping bring in the amount contributed by Funder B.Other notesThe playing cards and poker chips do not hold or have any monetary cryptocurrency value. Our playing cards and poker chips are just for use in playing card games such as poker. They are not actual cryptocurrency and are not to be used as monetary instruments or vehicles.The cryptocurrency logos featured in these playing cards and poker chips are being used in accordance with their respective creative commons licenses.

story:
Short Summary

We are Jacob and Kirra Sundese, a board game developing team and loving young parents of a beautiful 2-year-old boy! Dungeon Dash is a new and exciting board game that quite literally puts the "F" in "Fun". We have tested this game with friends and strangers as close as down the street and as far away as Nigeria and it has never failed to deliver a good time. It is the first of many games we have to offer in our new board game company, Knee Slapper Games. Our games stand out from others because we don't recycle last years' new board game with a "twist". Every game and Dungeon Dash especially offers a whole new and fresh experience. 

The board game industry has a huge responsibility of delivering games to the people that bring friends and family together to create memories especially during times of hardship. We feel they have been slacking and the latest games are less than half of what they could be, letting everyone down. We are here to pick up the slack and deliver guaranteed fun to your table. 

Dungeon Dash is just a sneak peek of what we have to offer, we range from effortless fun to exciting adventure games that regardless of the length of time, they will have you glued to the edge of your seat the entire time. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $10,000 to accomplish our goal of purchasing enough inventory to kickstart our company and direct to consumer advertising to get this game to every table! 

Perks!

  • $5 - "Thank you" shout out
  • $5 - Show you agree the world needs to smile more
  • $10 - Digital autographed poster (printable) (=
  • $15 - Print & Play Download
  • $25 - Donation
  • $50 - Donation
  • $30 - Pre-order Dungeon Dash
  • $100 - Joining our affiliate program

If we don't reach our goal we will still use all the money to purchase inventory to sell and help fund more games till we can afford to buy the games at our targeted low price to be able to maximize profits. Regardless we won't stop till Dungeon Dash is on everyone's table!

​The Impact

What we want Dungeon Dash and Knee Slapper Games to bring to the world is to change the way people look at board games. Some too many people don't appreciate board games because there are very few that are the right kind of fun. We want people to undoubtedly want to play our games because of the undeniable fun. 

We are a board game company that is for the people, a company that means what they say and produces nothing but board games you didn't know you needed.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest risk is honestly to not reach our goal because the process will take much longer. The best way to overcome this hurdle would be to: 

  • Start a print and play contest
    • contestants will purchase and print Dungeon Dash, submit a video of them and friends playing on a printable version to enter to win $200 every month.

Our biggest challenge is proving to everyone that they should buy Dungeon Dash and that it is different from other games. We will overcome this by:

  • Direct to consumer social media advertising

Other Ways You Can Help

Money isn't the only way you can help! Tell your friends, family, neighbors, strangers, and your pets all about us! The more people that know the better we will do and the faster the game will be in your hands!

Thank you for your contribution!

story:
Created By Ruth Modoh

Artwork by Stephenie Zagorski, Michael Wachter, and Giovanni De Benedetto

If the last 18 months have taught us anything, it’s that we need, want, and value human connections like never before. 

Being around people and socializing is something we as a society have taken for granted. But then, with the onset of a global pandemic, social distancing, and never-ending lockdowns, everything changed. The pandemic not only affected our confidence, but it had a devastating effect on our mental health.

I wanted to address this dilemma before the world faced a global pandemic of mental illness. I aim to provide people with their very own personal psychotherapist, mentor, or counselor, a practical tool for people to keep close and use whenever needed.

Emotional Collidescope, The Introspection Deck of cards, is a holistic resource to help support, nurture, and improve mental wellbeing. By harnessing the power of human connections, I hope to foster a safe space to express feelings, thoughts, and emotions.

I drew inspiration for the original concept from Sigmund Freud’s Three Levels of Mind: conscious, preconscious, and subconscious. His theory formed the basis of my in-depth set of questions. 

The intentions of these cards are a starting point to take a deep dive into understanding self-awareness, emotional intelligence, and compassionate listening. With 90 cards of introspective questions and Klecksography accompanying the deck, this experience allows individuals to immerse themselves in therapeutic artwork to enhance their emotional interpretations. 

"A good question is non-judgemental and

opens space for exploration"

With Klecksography accompanying the deck, it allows individuals to immerse themselves in therapeutic artwork to enhance their emotional interpretations. 

** CARD DIMENSIONS: 4.75" x 2.75" | 120mm x 70mm | Same dimensions as Tarot cards**

As you progress through each card at your own leisure, tackling each question with as much or as little detail as you can muster. 

Remember, it's all about addressing issues at a time that's appropriate for you; there's no pressure or risk.

The following is a set of questions you can expect to pull out of the deck:

1. What was your earliest memory as a child, a happy memory?

2. What is the bravest thing you have done for yourself?

3. What does respect look like?

4. Would your younger self be proud of the person you have become today?

5. What is the first thought that comes to your mind when you hear about mental health?

 

 

FIRST 30 DECKS | "GO-GO RELEASE" $45 

UNLIMITED | EMOTIONAL COLLIDESCOPE $50

WHOLESALE | 10 x EC DECKS $350

PERK ADD ON | Digital Deck "Print & Play" $5

*no artwork to be featured on Digital Deck*

Emotional Collidescope, Introspection Deck is just the beginning of my journey towards building better mental health for individuals. 

I'm excited to have you on board and contributing to this life-changing project. 

Thank you for taking the time to read my campaign story and for your kind pledges today. 

Also, feel free to share this page with your followers on social media to help bring this introspective deck to life.

*Social media platforms to stay connected to upcoming news and progress

Facebook Group | Instagram

Risks & Challenges

As for the timeline, I have looked at shipping and handling from a pragmatic point of view + with the consideration that there are many elements outside my direct control, and if there are printing delays or global shipping delays that could impact the timeline, hence why I have noted the estimated delivery for late February/March 2022 (*if stretch goals are unlocked for express shipping then delivery is predicted for late January 2022) All of the artwork, card designs, box designs, and double sided poster is complete and ready for production. 

Sustainable Distribution

I plan on using recyclable packing materials wherever possible.

Decks to be fulfilled from Canada and Australia (small batch sent to Australia, where my family will complete fulfillment | EU backers to be fulfilled from Australia)

Something else

I have decided that the printout of a small booklet does not align with the ethos of being eco-friendly (as I worry it would be a one-time use). Therefore, I've created a 9-fold pamphlet with dual purposes (side 1) to provide guidelines of the deck, bio for each conscious creator associated with this project, and some additional information (side 2) featured images.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that we are experiencing unprecedented times, and if financial contributions aren't possible at this time, I would love if you could:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you from the Emotional Collidescope project team! We appreciate all of your time, pledges, and patience!

Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!

Thank you from the Emotional Collidescope project team! We appreciate all of your time, pledges, and patience!

story:
This is very simple. You can buy 1,2 or 3 sets of minis. Each one in a bigger discount than the other.

The sets will be colored so each mini will come in its own color. The color is the same one as on the card it represents.

Also, there is one (and only one) vintage 1963 gas mask. I spent way too much time to obtain one that looks as new as possible. I just dare the winner of the perk to wear it during a full game.

Upon reaching the base goal a few things will happen:

  1. Production of the minis will start
  2. A new plan will kick into gear to produce minis for the game most popular expansions, "On the brink" and "In the lab". A time frame for this is 3-6 months. Progress updates will be sent on a monthly basis.

Upon reaching 26K in funding a knitted velvet bag will be added to all perk buyers. Buyers who buy 2 or 3 sets will get 2 and 3 bags...

Upon reaching 36.5K I will design and produce the 4 Virus tokens. Black, Blue, Red, and Yellow. Each one will get this batch for free added to his minis set.

To be able to get the minis to as many players as possible shipping is flat 11$ worldwide. For the love of the game :)

 

What are the dimensions of the minis?

the minis are 40mm tall and have a base of about 10-15mm.

What is the color of the minis?

Each mini will come in its own color. The color is the same one as on the card it represents.

When will the minis ship?

The minis are expected to ship in Jan 2019. I'll make every effort to make even earlier.

Are these made by a 3D printer?

No, No, NO! These will be produced professionally in the mold like real minis are produced.

Can I buy the game and expansions too?

Yes, but not here. This campaign is only for the mins. I do recommend buying the base game since it is the best game ever?

This looks great how can I help?

Simple, spread the work on Twitter, Facebook or a blog. Buy a perk or speak to your friends about it. Leave a thank you note or a comment. Feedback is also great. Anything will be appreciated.

Anything can happen but I've been planning this for a long time to minimize the risks.
From my day job, I know how to plan, produce and ship products all over the world.
Still, this is my first campaign and delays might occur.

I am new in the mins and plastics production but after 2 not so good manufacturers from which I obtained samples, I'm confident I have found the right one.

Last, the most beloved mini (The Scientist) has a molecule in her hand. I have taken great pains to make this one not as fragile as it looks but the risk is always there.

Almost forgot. The world might end tomorrow with a horrible Pandemic, but I'm sure we'll do everything we can to prevent it.

Pandemic logo, Pandemic boardgame and box covers and graphics belong to Z-Man Games.
I and this Indigogo campaign have no affiliation with Z-Man games.

Some images are by "Nicolas Raymond" taken from jooinn.com.

Many thanks to Einat Rolnik who helped me with a lot of graphical aspects of this campaign.

Last thanks to my family for putting up with my ideas, frustration and happiness.

story:
Wealthy Roman Villas 3D Printable STL Files

This project is compatible with and great to be used for RPG terrain wargaming for your tabletop games or for dioramas and scenes or anything you wish!

This is a Pay What You Want campaign. You can get the Wealthy Roman Villas STL files for as little as $1 for personal use and $15 to unlock the bonus pieces also for commercial use. For your pledge level, you can pay $1 and obtain these Fantasy House STL files in their entirety. If you are feeling generous you can put in what you think this house is worth but there is no pressure to increase your pledge amount either way. Thank you for taking a look at my Kickstarter!

 

Pay what you want - As low as $3 - Reasons

This is our first Scenery Kickstarter and we want to start strong! These buildings STL have more than $3 work on them. Why only $3 you ask? Well, we want to reach more customers by making something with a very low barrier to entry. This allows people who are interested in 3D printing easy access to a great 3D printable file. If you are feeling generous you may Pay What You Want if you think this file is worth more than only $3, but there is certainly no pressure to do so either way.

What You Get

3D Printable Roman Villa - Marcus Fluvio Villa

 

3D Printable Roman Villa - Pijus Maximus Villa

Who we are

For the first time, we are launching a 3D Printable Scenery! We are collaborating with the artists at 3DMinisky and releasing his creations under our brand. We are honored to be the Studio that will launch these models but to do it,  we need your help!

Help us bring these 3D Printable Roman Villas to your home and let get you started in the real estate market. 

Architectural View? 

We have it. 

Here are all the angles that you can imagin. These are the 3D Printable Roman Villas

story:
Players each choose a champion card to represent them in the game. There are 8 champions to choose from, each with their own unique abilities, to give them an advantage in the game.

Choose from 8 unique champions

Players then take turns drawing from a central deck, which represents the Dragonvault - a dangerous, subterranean lair, filled with priceless treasures and magical items. But beware, if a dragon catches you, it will attack, unless you bribe it with some of your wealth. 

This magical Djinn will grant you a wish, if you are lucky enough to find him

The Dragonvault is also littered with deadly traps, powerful encounters, and cunning mercenaries that will attack or steal from your opponents, for a price. When the deck runs out, any who are left standing, then compare their treasure. The player with the most treasure wins! But beware, some of you will not make it to the end of the game. The Dragonvault is a dangerous place, and your opponents will attempt to hinder you at every turn. 

Mercenaries, such as Expert Thief and Hired Muscle, will attack or steal from your opponents

Games last about twenty minutes, and the game itself is very easy to learn! Whether you are an experienced tabletop card game player, or a newcomer to the genre, we are confident that you and your friends will have a blast with Dragonvault! This game balances both random chance and skill, so you never know what to expect during each game! Best of luck, adventurer...

A quote from one of our initial playtesters

The funds we receive through this campaign, will go directly toward hiring our talented artist to illustrate each individual card, as well as toward publishing costs, so we can bring Dragonvault to a game store near you!

story:
Summary

With over 20 years in the field, and finding more time this past year to center and focus my attention to long-time dreams, I was able to create this fun and welcoming Tarot deck.

I have been the sole operator of my own online metaphysical business for the last three years. Since crafting shows and many events were canceled over this past year, it had a lot more time to focus on the things that I really wanted to share. I enjoy tarot the most out of my practice and business so I wanted to create a deck that would be great for all levels of readers. It has images friendly enough for very young readers, and is based off of the familiar Rider Waite Smith deck that will familiar to practiced readers. 

Being able to publish this deck will certainly help to direct the future of by business and how I hope to do much more in the way of teaching, writing and creating for my field. 

What I Need & What You Get

Let's break this down:

  • I am asking for $13,500 to have this deck printed. I have chosen a wonderful American company to print my deck and booklet.
  • This is a 78 card complete Tarot deck with guidebook. The cards are a "standard tarot size" at 2.78" x 4.78". They are made of high quality paper and laminated for protection and durability. They will have a satin gloss finish allowing for an easy shuffle and keeping the integrity of the cards. It is held in a custom 2 part box with ISBN and a bar code for those wishing to purchase wholesale.  
  • The more you are able to support the more perks you get. I realize that Tarot decks are a very personal thing, so if you wish to support without receiving a deck, I am happy to give you a recorded reading once funding is met. The perks from there only increase with stickers, decks, and matching journals. 
  • This is an all or nothing campaign, so any amount to help reach my goal will be forever appreciated. 

Risks & Challenges

At the moment, the only challenges I face are timing and Covid-19. Thankfully we look to be headed in the right direction there, and the printing for my project once set into motion should only take about 6 weeks. But once it is started I will be ordering all supplies at once to stream line the shipping process. I am fortunate enough to be able to devote my time to this project.

So to overcome the any challenges faced with timing and shipping, my years of creating, organizing, and delivering online orders will be a true asset. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand and respect that Tarot is not for everyone, and I recognize that not everyone is able to support financially. That's perfectly okay, and I still appreciate any small amount of support you can give me, even if its just sharing this campaign with people who may be interested. If there is anything that I have learned as a small business owner it is that word of mouth and the support of sharing my products is the best support I could ever have. 

 A Few More of My Favorite Cards
story_txt:
Summary
With over 20 years in the field, and finding more time this past year to center and focus my attention to long-time dreams, I was able to create this fun and welcoming Tarot deck.
I have been the sole operator of my own online metaphysical business for the last three years. Since crafting shows and many events were canceled over this past year, it had a lot more time to focus on the things that I really wanted to share. I enjoy tarot the most out of my practice and business so I wanted to create a deck that would be great for all levels of readers. It has images friendly enough for very young readers, and is based off of the familiar Rider Waite Smith deck that will familiar to practiced readers. 
Being able to publish this deck will certainly help to direct the future of by business and how I hope to do much more in the way of teaching, writing and creating for my field. 


What I Need & What You Get
Let's break this down:

I am asking for $13,500 to have this deck printed. I have chosen a wonderful American company to print my deck and booklet.
This is a 78 card complete Tarot deck with guidebook. The cards are a "standard tarot size" at 2.78" x 4.78". They are made of high quality paper and laminated for protection and durability. They will have a satin gloss finish allowing for an easy shuffle and keeping the integrity of the cards. It is held in a custom 2 part box with ISBN and a bar code for those wishing to purchase wholesale.  
The more you are able to support the more perks you get. I realize that Tarot decks are a very personal thing, so if you wish to support without receiving a deck, I am happy to give you a recorded reading once funding is met. The perks from there only increase with stickers, decks, and matching journals. 
This is an all or nothing campaign, so any amount to help reach my goal will be forever appreciated. 


Risks & Challenges
At the moment, the only challenges I face are timing and Covid-19. Thankfully we look to be headed in the right direction there, and the printing for my project once set into motion should only take about 6 weeks. But once it is started I will be ordering all supplies at once to stream line the shipping process. I am fortunate enough to be able to devote my time to this project.
So to overcome the any challenges faced with timing and shipping, my years of creating, organizing, and delivering online orders will be a true asset. 

Other Ways You Can Help
I understand and respect that Tarot is not for everyone, and I recognize that not everyone is able to support financially. That's perfectly okay, and I still appreciate any small amount of support you can give me, even if its just sharing this campaign with people who may be interested. If there is anything that I have learned as a small business owner it is that word of mouth and the support of sharing my products is the best support I could ever have. 
 A Few More of My Favorite Cards

story:
Curious Crimes

We post it. You solve it. 

It's time to dust off your hat and play detective! Id like me you are obsessed true-crime, unsolved murders, and binge-watch documentaries on Netflix, then this game is for you. 

Curious Crimes is the ultimate murder mystery where you play detective and follow the trail of clues to find the killer. 

We deliver murder mysteries to your door. But unlike traditional murder mysteries, there is no minimum number of players. Play solo, (if you dare) or play as a crime-fighting group, like the avengers or teenage mutant ninja turtles. 

You will receive a brief about the crime you are trying to solve, whether that's a high stakes burglary, kidnap or murder! Read your mission document carefully, there will be hidden clues within it that will help you narrow down suspects, and find your first location. 

In each pack will be a number of location cards, within each will be a clue, as well as a puzzle which you need to solve in order to work out the next location. The puzzles could be a receipt for a nightclub, a ticket stub from the train station or a postcard from the victim's last vacation. It will be up to you to play detective and solve the crime! 

You will need to keep your mind sharp, your wits focused, as one wrong answer will lead you down the wrong path.


 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are looking for funding to launch our debut case, The Case of the Last Birthday. Our product will be completely 100% recyclable, we never use plastic. We are eco-conscious and therefore will only work with factories that share the same moral code. 
  • We will release a new case every three months, starting with The Case of The Bloody Footprint, The Case of the New Age Ripper and The Case of the Serial Strangler.
  • All of our cases are UNIQUE, we right ALL of the puzzles and conundrums in house. 
  • In the case that we do not hit our target, We have a number of pre-orders that will be fulfilled, therefore any funding will go to fulfilling the orders. 
  • Estimated to be released and posted mid-December 2020. 

Massive Thank you

Thank you for checking out our project, we cannot wait to launch the Curious Crimes series, we have many many more crimes we want to share and for you to solve.

The Team

Creator - My name is Hayley Harper. I'm a writer, entrepreneur and a natural storyteller, and I have always had a love for human psychology. The ultimate question, are murders born or raised? The Curious Crimes game was created out of frustration, I was booked to go onto my very first escape room, for which I was overly excited. A day of puzzle-solving, playing Sherlock. And then the pandemic happened. We went into national lockdown. Escape room cancelled, my heart, broken. So I looked online for something similar, and the choices were, either an expensive 6 part crime that would cost almost $180 to complete or something online where you worked your way around. I couldn't find what I was looking for. So I decided to make my own. I posted it to friends and family and they LOVED it! And so Curious Crimes was born. 

Melvyn Goodinson - Graphic Designer and all-round creative wizz. Over 10 years experience working with global companies, recently self employed. Melv discovered his passion for design at an early age, I think he was born with a 2b pencil in his hand. Bringing Melvyn on board was the best decision, he has created something wonderful. 

The Impact

  • With people on lockdown around the UK, this is the perfect addition to any weekend night. The does not contain any graphic images, foul language or anything that would upset a child, we make all of our games fun for the whole family. 
  • We are already making great sales on our website, pre-order for our first case, The Case of The Last Birthday is picking up fast!
  • This entire project came about because we were booked to go to an escape room (I was very excited) and then we went into another national lockdown, the escape room was cancelled. So I decided to write my own and sent it to friends and family, and they loved it.

Risks & Challenges

We have spoken with factories, and they have assured us that the preparation we have taken, we are likely to hit those key milestones. 

 I will communicate any such issues if they arise, along the way. This process should be really straight forward. That said, we are in the unexplored territory with Covid-19, which has already created both production and shipping delays, so we do ask for understanding if necessary.

All Donations Matter:

Any support will be more than appreciated. If you can't pledge, please don't worry, you can show your support by sharing our campaign link to your friends and family.

You are helping a small business spread its little wings and fly! So for that, we are beyond grateful!

We are already making great sales on our website, pre-order for our first case, The Case of The Last Birthday is picking up fast!
This entire project came about because we were booked to go to an escape room (I was very excited) and then we went into another national lockdown, the escape room was cancelled. So I decided to write my own and sent it to friends and family, and they loved it.


Risks & Challenges
We have spoken with factories, and they have assured us that the preparation we have taken, we are likely to hit those key milestones. 
 I will communicate any such issues if they arise, along the way. This process should be really straight forward. That said, we are in the unexplored territory with Covid-19, which has already created both production and shipping delays, so we do ask for understanding if necessary.

All Donations Matter:
Any support will be more than appreciated. If you can't pledge, please don't worry, you can show your support by sharing our campaign link to your friends and family.
You are helping a small business spread its little wings and fly! So for that, we are beyond grateful!

story:
Basics.

  • Suitable for everyone
  • 2-5 Players
  • Takes less than a minute to learn
  • 15-20 minutes to play

 

How to play.

Each player is dealt a total of 5 cards. 3 capsule cards + 2 action cards or vice versa. (Player's choice)

On each turn, you draw 2 cards and can only make 3 moves. There are 3 types of moves

 

PLACE CAPSULE CARDSSWITCH CAPSULE CARDSUSE ACTION CARDS

 

You cannot end your turn with more than 5 cards in hand. You may discard action cards or reshuffle capsule cards back into the draw pile. (Doesn't count as a move.) 

Be the first to collect all 5 capsules of the same color to win the game ! That's it !

Capsule Cards.

There are four kinds of capsule cards. Eight capsules per color. 

Action Cards. 

There are 12 kinds of action cards to make the game more interesting. We'll be revealing more action cards throughout the campaign.

 

What's in the box

32 Capsule Cards | 40 Action Cards | 1 Rule Book

Shipping and timeline.

US Backers: All rewards will ship at standard flat rate $12 USD depending on your pledge level. These are the standard and most reasonable prices available!

International: The biggest challenge we face is making our products (which are generally created in small print runs) available to international backers. We are currently only able to offer standard rates to international backers at $15 USD. We hope to expand the availability of our products to customers worldwide at more affordable rates in the future.

So when will you get your stuff? If all goes smoothly we hope to deliver Gachamo at the end of December 2019. Below is a general breakdown of events and how they will unfold:

July- Indiegogo begins!

September- Campaign Ends, order is placed with our manufacturer in China.

October- We work with our manufacturer to finalize project specifications.

November- Product is shipped and delivered to fullfilment center in Kuala Lumpur.

December- Rewards ship out to all backers!

Risk and Challenges.

This is our first card game on Indiegogo. We are diligent with our email responses and work very hard to deliver our product on time. We will do whatever it takes to not disappoint our backers. That said, there are always risks. Gachamo will be our first game manufactured in China. Because of this there is always a possibility that the overseas shipping could be delayed. Rest easy knowing that we will keep all our backers up-to-date with the status of the project every step of the way.

Special Thanks.

We are fortunate to have a super supportive circle of friends and family who believe in our venture. This little corner of our Indiegogo is dedicated solely to these great folks! We thank you!

Maryanne | Steven | Cheryl | Steve | Yongwei | Karl | Jean  | Bee 

Other ways you can help.

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help us spread the word out and make some noise about our new game.
  • Support us mentally, give us some virtual love. 

 

Thank you for backing our project.
