story_txt:
The 5e Player Screen was born of necessity.

As a new player, DM and a Neurodivergent player - I struggle to remember all the finer details of the game, and from both sides of the DM screen it makes life easier if everyone can see the rules quickly and easily - no flipping through a bulky Player Handbook!
 
Too much time on remembering rules?

Problem solved!

I found that due to inexperience of new players, and things like Object Permanence issues, Short Term Memory loss and concentration problems that can come with Neurodiversities - Cheat Sheets got forgotten, or lost among the chaos of the gaming table, and went unused - leaving "Can I do this, How does this work, Oh man am I dead?" to be common utterances at the table.
And so, the Player Screen was born.
For this first version of the Player Screen I went with the most important and universally relevant information regardless of Race or Class.
Krystina Arielle reviews the 5E Player Screen prototype!


Looking at the prototype of the #dnd 5E screen by @ShaunSunday_Art now crowdfunding on indiegogo https://www.indie https://t.co/C6P2hEJ4iO— Krystina Arielle ? (@KrystinaArielle) October 30, 2019

story:
Beset at sea! Curse-infected pirates strike at the characters, seeking blood and valuables on the waves. Can the beleaguered adventurers repel the attack and root out the source of demonic piracy in these waters?

Curse of Blood Lagoon features:

  • Sailing, broadsides, and boarding parties!
  • Cursed pirates!
  • Several hooks that can bring player characters to the adventure
  • “The Isle of the Sea God’s Lament”, to which any island in The Lost Lands (or in your campaign) can play host
  • Zombie pirates!
  • A variety of monsters and a curse to avoid!
  • Rum!
  • Refugees to rescue!
  • Crazy fruit!

Casey W. Christofferson has written a fantastic new island-adventure set in the seas of the Lost Lands. Recommended for 4-6 characters of levels 4-5, Curse of Blood Lagoon brings swashbuckling, cannon fire(!), infectious pirates, undead, and a chance to reverse a curse to your gaming table.

The Project 

Necromancer Games projects on Indiegogo are simple, focused, and short.

  • Short in duration (2-3 weeks)
  • Fast delivery of PDF once funding is completed
  • Limited to a single title
  • Have options priced between $5-$30
  • Stretch goals and project bonuses (if any) affect the principle reward only (usually both the PDF and the softcover).
  • Are the only guaranteed method to get the premium* print copy (NOTE: the softcover versions  in this printing will not be sold on our website: see FAQ for explanation).
  • Have a simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit

*Premium means heavyweight glossy interior pages enhancing the art and color elements. The  thick, glossy cardstock brings out the vibrant color of the cover illustration. These are the nicest softcover books we have ever sold and we only print a title this way once.

Any reprint would use print on demand service that, although nice, do not approach the quality of our INDIEGOGO funded books.

Why the Tiny Print Run?

Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.

This has resulted in Kickstarter's with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive to buy for customers like you because they are very expensive to make for publishers like us.

Why not use Kickstarter?

We will still be using Kickstarter, frequently, for our large-scale projects, but we hear the request for less expensive options for our products all the time, especially smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions.

Product enhancements tied to project success 

During the funding period for Blood Lagoon and after the funding goal is met we will  improve the delivered product based on additional sales. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases, the better the final product will be for everybody.

Examples of improvements made to earlier products:

  • Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure. 
  • The previous Indiegogo project added 2 interior art pieces and 3 extra creature illustrations for its appendix.
  • Downloadable Options designed for popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Christmas! and In Vino Gigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 
  • High-resolution files of illustrations to share with players at the table.

Project Delivery

PDF Perks

We will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing Indiegogo perk PDF items. The PDF files are distributed directly into your Frog God Games Library through our web store. You will need to have a customer account at www.froggodgames.com  to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access by you to your reward. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this at help@lessergnome.com.

After the project ends a second coupon is provided allowing supporters' digital rewards to be included in their DriveThruRPG.com PDF library.

Softcover Perks

Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 

 

Overseas Shipping

For the last several months, as those of you who follow us on Discord know, we have been grappling with the issue of high costs on shipping to locations outside the USA. We have decided that the most cost-effective way for our overseas customers to get books is by printing the books in print-on-demand format. This does not affect the USA, where we will continue ordinary printing and shipping.

The print-on-demand books international customers will be receiving are high quality, but please be aware that they are different from the premium-quality books we are advertising for sale in the USA.

We have tremendous love and respect for our international customers, and this is the most workable way we have been able to find to keep you supplied with books with reliable delivery times at a reasonable price.

story:
This adventure is designed for a group of 4-6 characters of levels 5-7 playing the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. While functional as a standalone module, this adventure is designed to be the first adventure in a series exploring the workings and reasons of a deity of the Lost Lands referred to as the Nameless One and her most faithful servant, “the Walking Stick Man” as they try to recover ancient words of power and stir forces lost and forgotten.
This adventure starts in the settlement of Chesmire, though can be moved around with little difficulty and placed in any campaign world with only minor changes, namely the addition or use of an ancient lost or near lost pantheon. The reason for the placement in this area is easy access to the adventure “Sorcerer’s Citadel” from Quests of Doom, which should be played following the events of the second adventure in this series as a return to the feelings of normalcy while still maintaining references to the ancient pantheon on which these adventures are focused via the statue of Mocham.

Adventure Summary

Long ago, the neolithic pantheon was the primary pantheon and Dagon was not yet a demon lord. This was a time of great power, when gods still spoke the Language Eternal freely and rewrote reality as they saw fit. Dagon had many coastal temples, such as this one, that over the millennia have sank beneath the surface taking their priesthood with them. As Dagon fell, so did the priests that still venerated him in these sunken temples. Those devout enough received blessings on sacred relics within the temples to adapt them to their new home. The blessing to do such at this temple was twofold as Dagon bestowed upon the Eye of Dagon, a 5,000 gp diamond that was kept on display in this temple, the ability for them to survive underwater and upon the temple walls itself he granted the power to SUSTAIN. The temple has been found a few times over the years, most notably by a Xill seeking a safe nest and a Xorn who arrived drawn to and seeking to devour the Eye of Dagon, but it has remained untouched by human hands since Dagon, and the temple, fell.
A few weeks ago, a shopkeeper named Tryn was expanding her underground storerooms on the edge of town and broke into this ancient temple beneath the town. The laborers she hired vanished with screams as the passage opened, leaving Tryn to report the incident to Elder l Sabratha who sent for adventurers from Port Manden and placed militia to prevent anyone or anything from entering or leaving the business.
After arriving in town, the characters are intercepted by an older man who appears blind with a walking stick before they get to Elder Sabratha. He requests they retrieve an ancient tablet from the dungeon that they are headed to and offers some odd items in return. Elder Sabratha arranges payment with the characters for clearing and securing the area but does not know the walking stick man if asked.
Inside the tunnels, warnings are scrawled on the walls despite no one entering. As the characters plunge farther in, they face off against aberrations and find objects unseen for centuries that are being activated in ways unused by modern society. Upon returning to the surface, the walking stick man is waiting in the house for them to retrieve the tablet and make good on his offers. The guards do not recall anyone entering other than the party if asked. Elder Sabratha is ready with payment in town and offers the party to stay the night with her to recover before setting out again. In the morning, Tryn offers a 10% discount on all items in her shop for the next week to the characters, if nothing was stolen from her of course.

Stretch Goals

We've exceeded my wildest expectations and are able to do more! While I'm not gonna add content to the book I will add content to your package!

$600 - Custom 4 inch by 1 inch Michael Mars Sticker added to each physical package

$750 - Custom 3 inch square Michael Mars Sticker added to each physical package

Who Am I?

Hi, I'm Michael "Mars" Russell. You may know me as the Pathfinder 1e guy over at Frog God Games and Necromancer Games. I have been doing the conversion of their IndiGoGo projects, contributed to their Book of Alchemy, as well as working on other books published by them. I've also worked with Koryo Hall of Adventure and Explore Dungeons in the past. With the recent opening of the Lost Lands Open License from Frog Gog Games, I have decided to release some personal projects that I have been thinking about for years.

What We Need & What You Get

The pdf for this is all laid out and ready to go, that means the content is written already and I can send out the pdf as soon as I get the funds from IGG. What this is funding is a limited print run through Mixam at a quality I can be proud to say I produced.

Any future printings of this would be print on demand, so not nearly as nice.

Risks & Challenges

There is not a lot that can go wrong with you getting the product at this point as everything is already written and laid out, but there can be shipping delays between Mixam and myself, as well as from me to you though I will do my best to mitigate these.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to support me otherwise, I have a patreon that gives free pdfs of my releases and grants access to my development channel on my Discord server. My patreon is https://www.patreon.com/michaelmars

Hi, I'm Michael "Mars" Russell. You may know me as the Pathfinder 1e guy over at Frog God Games and Necromancer Games. I have been doing the conversion of their IndiGoGo projects, contributed to their Book of Alchemy, as well as working on other books published by them. I've also worked with Koryo Hall of Adventure and Explore Dungeons in the past. With the recent opening of the Lost Lands Open License from Frog Gog Games, I have decided to release some personal projects that I have been thinking about for years.

What We Need & What You Get
The pdf for this is all laid out and ready to go, that means the content is written already and I can send out the pdf as soon as I get the funds from IGG. What this is funding is a limited print run through Mixam at a quality I can be proud to say I produced.
Any future printings of this would be print on demand, so not nearly as nice.


Risks & ChallengesThere is not a lot that can go wrong with you getting the product at this point as everything is already written and laid out, but there can be shipping delays between Mixam and myself, as well as from me to you though I will do my best to mitigate these.
Other Ways You Can HelpIf you want to support me otherwise, I have a patreon that gives free pdfs of my releases and grants access to my development channel on my Discord server. My patreon is https://www.patreon.com/michaelmars

story:
A newly discovered spell allows wizards to liberate their familiars as a reward for all their hard work over the years. These tiny beasts with magical spirits are now able to adventure side-by-side with the other races, equally! This book contains everything you need to play D&D as a former familiar.

All the familiar species are included and balanced for exciting gameplay. Fourteen animal races from the Find Familiar spell are available to you and each has three distinct sub-races. That is 42 animals you can choose from!

 Your familiar can choose from 6 classes, each of which leans heavily upon one of the six abilities. Within each class are three sub-classes. These draw from the three aspects of every familiar: their physical form, their arcane past, and their spirit type (Celestial, Fey, or Fiend). The book also contains rule options for those who want to play existing classes.

 Wizards rely on their familiars in different ways. UnFamiliar offers 13 distinctly different backgrounds to reflect your past experience. As part of the balancing with the standard races, each background includes a new cantrip you can cast. This cantrip was not only helpful for your previous life as a familiar but will be useful for adventuring, too.

Familiars have one of three spirit types: Celestial, Fey, or Fiend. Your spirit provides additional thematic flavor to your character and also gives you abilities that help balance the UnFamiliar races with the standard races.

Several new feats are available to UnFamiliar characters which reflect their animal nature. A few races even gain a feat at first level to compensate for lacking other traits. Albino, Potent Poison, and Nervous Anticipation are just a few of the feats that will make your character even more unique!

Through the spell that liberates a familiar, it gains the ability to speak. This may be shocking to some folks you come across, but when you see an animal walk up to you wearing clothes, hearing them talk isn't exactly mind blowing. However, people will definitely be curious about you!

Every reward level includes the complete set of UnFamiliar character token markers for use in Roll20 and Fantasy Grounds. Easy to use and integrate into your games.

.

Extras:

Traveling Encounters: Volume 1 is a 5-star rated book full of creative low-level encounters. Each encounter contains unexpected twists and utilizes skill proficiencies that often get ignored. Each encounter is adjustable for parties from 1st to 5th level. Add-ons available in hardcover and pdf.

Call to Adventure contains over 30 new character backgrounds for D&D complete with unique personality traits, new background-related spells, and useful background features. Add-ons available in hardcover and pdf.

Shipping: 

The cost of shipping is already calculated. The cost to ship a single book (hardcover or softcover) is $6US for the United States, $9US for Canada, EU, and UK, and $16US for all other nations.

.

Jerry Joe Seltzer, writer and illustrator

Jerry teaches art to students online through Outschool and other platforms. He has written and illustrated several books about drawing and others related to Dungeons and Dragons. Prior to this life as a teach and author, he was a children's book illustrator and ran a small children's book publishing company.

story:
Discover Sina Una...

Explore the seven isles in a brand new campaign setting for 5e, including options for players in game, terrifying monsters to encounter, and a world rich with stories and tradition.

Featuring an entire team of passionate writers, researchers, and artists all sharing their heritage to work on a project filled with passion and determination to share our culture. Sina Una will bring new ways to run or play in games, places to experience and creatures to encounter, and will be a missing link in a real-life history of inaccessible and lost mythology.

If you're new to Sina Una, you can learn more about the process of making it, as well as some of the lore involved in creating our book, you can check out the pinned tweet of our co-director here to learn more.

Barbarian - Oath of the Black River

You have drunk of the waters of the Black Rivers, and now you serve as one of its many avatars. While one day you will die and be called to cross it to the afterlifes, no one, neither living or dead, shall escape your grasp.

Bard - College of Siday

The Sidays of your people fuel your storytelling and enhance your songs. As a keeper of the legends who have come before, it is your duty to preserve them for future generations, and to make new ones with your allies as you face dangers worthy of song.

Cleric - Volcano Domain

The awe-inspiring power of the volcano fills you. Life granting. Land breaking. Whether you face heroes or villains, mortal race, land spirit or vicious monster, show them the wrath of the fiery mountains as you bring it crashing down on them.

Druid - Circle of Tides

The tide has called to you, and you have taken its teachings into you. Eternal, ceaseless rhythms crashing upon the shore are your symbol, and whether they bring loved ones home, or break the will of iron willed sailors, it matters not. Through the tide, all will know balance.

Fighter - Kawal

It is not enough to simply be hit once, but to stand strong against the second. It is not enough for you to simply be at the battle, but to drive all harm away from your allies. Your enemies are not enough to stop you. And through your discipline, they will not even slow you.

Monk - Way of Kaluluwa

If a mortal is made of spirit and body, to learn the art of one or the other leaves you half complete. To learn both would be hard, but would leave you whole. Fight not as one, but as two, as you rain the power of physical and spiritual might down upon your enemies.

Paladin - Oath of Blood

Blood is what binds one soul to another, what binds one soul to a purpose, what binds one soul to a people. To what ends, it matters not. To what justice or injustice it may bring, it matters not. It is through your sacrifice, through your blade, that will see your chosen loyalty bear the fruit of victory.

Ranger - Mangangayaw

In the open sea, you have trained to turn any misstep, any mistake, any flaw found in your opponent into your key to victory. An ambush is no stranger to your repetoire of tactics, but it is through the constant rhythm of the fight, and taking joy in the folly of your foes, where you find yourself most at home.

Rogue - Graverobber

You were warned plenty of times about the dangers of theft this vile, but you knew you had all the world to gain by ripping a necklace or a weapon from a corpse who could no longer use it. Bad luck on your part that the first few things came with curses. Even worse luck for others when those curses became your boons.

Sorcerer - Diwata Bloodline

Be it birth, blessing, or luck, you possess in you the lifeblood of nature, granting you extraordinary sorcerery. No matter the reason, you are marked as being one of the spirits who make up the world. And in time, perhaps you can command power that so many venerate and fear.

Warlock - Moon Eater Patron

You have taken a bargain of power with one of the five great and terrible monsters who inhabit this world. From them, you have found power in their great malice. And through them, you have gained access to power to destroy, kill, and rend the heavens themselves.

Wizard - Mentala

You have discovered newfound power in the language of magic. In those arcane sigils you have discovered greater steps of power, and have devoted yourself to mastering them. You seek not to master one school or another, but to master the act of containing great magic, and letting it loose in new and devastating ways.

Why fund Sina Una specifically?

Sina Una has been largely inspired by three main factors.

First, there has been a call for more diverse themes in tabletop gaming, which has only grown in recent years. By representing these cultures and mythos respectfully we can start to expand our idea of fantasy and what that word means when we create worlds and characters.

The second is to become an easy to access compendium for all of our research on precolonial Philippine mythology, as sourcebooks on the subject are few and far between. Not only will this allow TTRPG players to have a reference for another world to play in, but those interested in the concept of precolonial Philippine mythology will have a master list for every sourcebook we learned and took from.

Which brings us to our third and main inspiration: a connection for Filipinos to find themselves in a heritage somewhat lost to time, and to feel comfort in playing a character that reflects that discovery. This book creates a piece at tables that makes inclusivity in gaming more tangible.

Filipino mythology is largely forgotten, with it being mostly passed by oral tradition and then swept under the rug by colonization. Most sources for it are also easily accessible only in the Philippines and we’re trying to bring them all over the world. Sina Una means “those who came first,” a homage to the fact all sources from this book are pulled from precolonial Philippines, honoring the indigenous people of the islands and shining a spotlight on their beautiful tales.

Where is funding going?

Main amounts of funding will go to paying our writers and ourselves for the time and effort it takes to research the source material to then fuse with fantasy. This allows the book to continue being made in high morale, meaning content inside will be written with the best intentions. The rest of the funding will go to properly format pages for layout, and shipping and handling.

Dungeon Master Screen - $28

We're offering a custom GM screen, with art done by our cover artist Roxanne Sparks, which includes helpful rules when playing in Sina Una. Status and conditions, travel rules, new boat rules for combat, and more. This is printed at the standard size and quality you would come to expect from standard screens from other creators and companies.

Current art shown is a WIP of the GM screen art, and will be updated as we receive more updates from Roxy.

Cloth Printed Map - $33

We're offering a cloth map of our world's map. Currently in creation, we are estimating a size of 24 by 36 inches, but that may be subject to change. Regardless of final size, this price will remain the same.

Custom Character Art - $150

We are offering you the chance to create a character in our book. We have twelve subclasses present, and with this addon, we will work with you to create a new character to be the representative of the subclass of you acquire. We will take the time to teach you the cultural roots and inspiration that led to the creation of which subclass you have, and custom art will be done by Fethawit of your character.

When the campaign has finished funding, we will reach out to everyone with this addon and sort out who will get which subclass, and begin the labor of love of talking with each and every one of you the character you will create. This addon is first come first serve, and will not be expanded.

Monstrous Incantation Custom Dice - $200

Created by the director from her main business, Monstrous Incantation is offering a limited amount of slots for custom dice sets. You will be able to choose from her past catalog of all designs and they will be made with her custom font and symbols molds.

Once the campaign has finished funding, we will reach out to everyone with this addon and collect information on which set you'd like. They will be delivered alongside your book or bundle.

With our stretch goals, our primary concern has been to be able to pay our writers and artists more, while making it easier on us to focus solely on the production of this book. We don't want to bloat our workload, but we do want to include more content, which will come with more research and effort, as a thank you.

Any digital stretch goals are included in any hardcover or digital copy of the book.

$31000 - Initially Funded

With this, we are initially funded, and we can begin full production of The Islands of Sina Una. It will cover art for the book, paying our writers their fair pay, and handling the cost of printing and shipping the books to us.

$36000 - First Goal

With this, we are able to pay for more art to include in the book, and we will be including two more magic items in our book.

$41000 - Second Goal

With this, we will be increasing the pay of our writers, as well as pay for even more art to include in our book. Additionally, we will be adding in one more magic item and one more spell in our book.

$50000 - Third Goal

With this, we will be increasing the pay of our writers even further. We will also be paying for more art to be included in the book, and will be giving all current artists a tip in addition to the payment given for their previously done work. We will also be adding in one more magic item and one more spell in our book.

Further Stretch Goals...

We have further stretch goals in mind, but we want to be certain that we can reach these three goals before we reveal what we have in store.

    The Islands of Sina Una is a project spearheaded by Lucia Versprille, the founder of Monstrous Incantation (@M_Incantation). After discovering inspiration in old mythology from her heritage, she began to seek out more information about stories and mythos from the Philippines. Eventually leading to directing a team of other interested artists, writers, and players.

    Soon after Joshua Mendenhall or (@HTTPaladin) was sought out, beginning as the main graphic designer and layout artist for the book. Quickly though, his longtime passion for TTRPG shone through in his strength with mechanics and storytelling, and Lucia appointed him Co-Director.

    Others on the team have been an immense help in researching, writing, and adding artistic visuals to the book. 

    Research and Writing:
    Kenny Nacino (@lightninggayrow)
    Joaquin Saavedra (@liquorcanini)
    BJ Recio (@bjrecio)

    Art:
    Roxanne Sparks (@lailanihan) Cover Art & GM Screen
    Tsaa (@TsaaKolate) Spear Fishing
    Caleb (@persimmonwitch) Haliya & Bakunawa
    Anna (@nannapai) Bahay Kubo
    Rika Mae Paderes (@fethawitart) Headhunter & Babaylan
    Jennifer Peig (@jennpeig) Ibingan
    Merlin (@gecczilla) Mandarangkal

    • Our first challenge stems from the fact that this will be our first project of this undertaking. However with the faith of our backers and the determination to see a book like this on the market, our team plans to prevail by keeping backers updated often and keeping each other responsible for doing our part to create high quality in both our content and our product. We have also reached out to other industry professionals so that we may avoid some pitfalls that comes from creating a source book through crowdfunding.
    • Our second challenge comes from the mythology itself. Its not as popularized in media in any form as other mythologies, such as Norse or Greek, and we've found that while no one thus far has been opposed to learning more about it? Many people aren't even aware of its existence. However, our passion and interest in our culture has been shared with those introduced to the idea to an overwhelmingly positive reception and we plan to make it as engaging as possible newcomers to our project.
    • Our final hurdle being research, and why our book may take longer to write. Finding reliable, precolonial sources on the Philippine mythology costs money and time. We’ve done a considerable amount of combing already but there’s still plenty more to obtain.

    Our team appreciates you being able to pledge money towards the project and it means we can continue to share our history and spread our culture. However, we know not everyone can pledge money, so here's what you can do!

    • Share this campaign on social media! Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram are all massive marketing platforms that could help us succeed.
    • Tell your gaming group! Players that you already know could be interested too.
    • Your local gaming store is great place to help. Approaching people who are already interested in the hobby or asking them to carry our book in the future is a great way to support us!
    • Don't stop talking! The more we can positively spread the word and get people to notice, the more likely we are to be able to do great things with this book.

    We sincerely appreciate all the support already from the online TTRPG community and now it’s time to follow through. Mabuhay!

story:
Who Are Troublemaker Games?

We are an established wargames development company who supply plastic, metal and resin miniatures for wargames retail companies, whose sculptors also have experience doing freelance work for other companies such as Mantic Games (For whom we sculpted their range of 28mm scale plastic terrain kits).

We have previously run four other Crowdfunding Campaigns, raising a total of £42,500 to deliver plastic and metal models for the 6mm scale wargame, Defeat In Detail (1 2 3 4).

We have delivered all the plastic and metal kits from all four of our crowdfunding campaigns to our customers, and all models (other than campaign exclusive special edition pieces) are now available for retail purchase through Vanguard Miniatures as the "Defeat In Detail" range.

The plastic models element of Wave 1 was hit by several unexpected delays before we eventually delivered the models, and we subsequently changed tooling room to a more reliable company for subsequent plastics projects.

 

We have already tested the tooling company for this project by producing a prototype Mixed Theme Sprue.

 

Above: The Mixed Theme Sprue.

 

 

Above: The Mixed Theme Sprue production mould Bolster and Inserts.

 

 

Above: As we have already invested in creating the basic Bolster & Insert technology for this project,  by using a combination of Electrode Sparking and Drill Milling, we can now produce detailed plastic model buildings moulds at a fraction of traditional tooling costs.

Our plastics design & production services using our Bolster asset to reduce tooling cost are also available to supply other wargames companies - enquiries welcome.

 

 

 

 

 

Above: A sample set of 10x Mixed Theme Sprues, painted by Golem Painting Studio.

 

The panels are 5cm x 5cm in dimension, and are reversible so as to have "wall" details on the front sides, and "roof" details on the rear sides of the panels.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our plastic terrain kits in this funding campaign are intended to be compatible with a wide range of small scale Tabletop Wargames and Tabletop Roleplay games, primarily scales of between 6mm and 15mm.

At 6mm scale, the buildings that can be constructed represent grand cathedrals and awesome mega-arcologies, whilst at 15mm scale the buildings represent more conventional gothic style buildings and industrial units.

We have already created a prototype plastic mould to test the tooling company we intend to use to produce the rest of our plastic scenery range, and have established that they are capable of the quality we require, with a fast turnaround time (it took just 3 weeks to produce the prototype mould tool).

We have many designs for more plastic scenery pieces already sculpted, but without a crowdfunding campaign it would be too expensive for us to afford to put them all into production, so your interest and support at this stage means we can bring many more designs and themes to retail... and your gaming tables!


So, as we cross stretch goals, we'll be unlocking more models, some of which can be seen below...

 

The Terrain Kits


Note that we can still take feedback on the stretch goal scenery designs in this crowdfunding campaign, so we can (if customers request) modify the sculpts by adding different details (etc) before they are cast up and sent out.

Stretch Goal #4 also involves adding more details to the currently featureless sides of two of the panels on the Mixed Theme Sprue - again, the specific details put on those panels could be modified on requests from project backers.

 

 

 

Above: Ten Mixed Theme Sprues

 

 

Above: Scenery panels used with 15mm scale models.

 

Above: Scenery panels used with 6mm scale giant robot models.

 

Above: Scenery panels used with 6mm scale vehicle, aircraft and infantry models.

 

Above: Scenery panels chopped up to make ruins.

 

 

Initial Offering - The Mixed Theme Set:

This set contains a variety of "Urban Gothic" and "Cyberhive" theme wall panels.

The rear sides of some of the panel designs also contain "Roof" details.

You will note some of the rear sides of the panels are currently blank; We would like to add more variety of rear panel details to the rear sides of the Mixed Theme Sprue panels as stretch goals.

 

    

 

 

Also now available: The Roads Set:

This set contains a variety of Road panels.

The rear sides of some of the panel designs also contain "Roof" details (not shown).

    

 

Also now available: Resin Domes:

 

This set contains 4x resin domes that are sized to mate on top of the plastic building tiles.

 

 

 

Stretch Goal #1 - The Gothic Theme Set:

This set contains a variety of "Urban Gothic" theme wall panels.

The rear sides of some of the panel designs also contain roof details.

You will note some of the rear sides of the panels are currently blank; We would like to add more variety of rear panel details to the rear sides of the Gothic Theme Sprue panels as stretch goal #2...

  

 

 

 

Stretch Goal #2 - Upgraded Detail for the Gothic Theme Set:

The Gothic Theme Set that was made available as Stretch Goal #1, is now upgraded so that all panels have details on both sides.

 

 

    

 

 

 

Stretch Goal #2a - Upgraded Detail for the Gothic Theme Set:

The Gothic Theme Set that was made available as Stretch Goal #1, is now upgraded so that each sprue includes two buttresses.

 

 

Stretch Goal #3 - Upgraded Detail for the Mixed Theme Set:

 

The Mixed Theme Set will receive an upgrade to the details on the rear sides of the two industrial ladder panel designs.

 

 

Big Beast Backers' Boons:


For every £200 you spend (not including international postage top-ups), we will give you ten of our 6mm Scale Plastic Armies Sprues, absolutely free!

On previous crowdfunding campaigns we've been able to give away free exclusive crowdfunder-only character models to every contributor, and we'd like to do something similar this time around, if contributions are strong enough!

 

 

Funding Pathway:


£1500 - Initial "Mixed Styles" Plastic Terrain Kit Production Goal

£1600 - "Gothic Style" Plastic Terrain Kit Stretch Goal

£2000 - "Gothic Style" kit is Upgraded to include rear details.

£2600 - "Gothic Style" kit is Upgraded to include buttresses.

£3250 - Upgraded Details for the rear side of the Mixed Theme Sprue


 

 

Potential Risks?


We anticipate there being no special risks to the products in this crowdfunding campaign.

The prototype CAD designs for the terrain kits have already been sculpted, and we have recently tested the tooling company we intend to use to cut the production mould tools by having them cut a prototype mould, which has itself already been tested and is in working order.

We have estimated a November delivery date for the products in this crowdfunding campaign, and anticipate no problems in meeting this deadline.

The worst eventuality we envisage happening is a slight delay to our dispatches (perhaps caused by a greater than expected backing for our campaign, leading to a production bottleneck), leading to a December delivery date rather than November.

story:
Test your survival skills in the dark fantasy world of Unbroken. You are the only one left alive after your group was ambushed by monsters - now you must avenge your friends and reclaim your freedom. Quick to learn, easy to set up and playable in a brief 20-30 minutes, the game will challenge you to make the right decisions or fall victim to the many dangers of the monster-infested caverns.

Plan wisely and take calculated risks - you do not have much and must use every resource at your disposal to prevail. Each journey in the dark is unique as you play as one of four different characters and face a variety of monsters and encounters. Your character gets better with experience and so will you - Unbroken is a game that encourages and rewards repeated plays to refine your strategies. 

      

      

   

      

                  

 
            

Hanging on by a thread. You snuck past a giant spider along the way but now want to arm yourself, hearing monsters ahead. You need some wood for a sturdy club.

You could gather your strength at a shrine or distract the feasting goblinoids to steal their food. No wood that you wanted, but you’ll use the shrine – hunger isn’t the biggest threat to your survival now.

Still a bit of time left - you push on, looking for another encounter.

Finally, some wood! You could fashion a weapon from these branches. But you are weak – gathering the wood, then crafting the club would tire you out. Instead you decide to rest up and to face the upcoming monster with your bare hands.

You are short on time – another encounter could yield resources, but if time gets to 0 the monster would ambush you. You decide not to risk it and face the monster.

You face your foe. The unfortunate wretch trapped in these caverns has long gone mad with despair.

Your gamble not making a weapon paid off! The Survivor’s Special effect would disarm you, wasting all resources you would have spent on the weapon.

You didn’t have to go into the fight blindly – you could Scout the monster and knew what to expect. It would cost resources but would provide certainty.

In Combat you will spend effort to wound your enemy. Good thing you feel strong after stopping at that shrine!

You would be in trouble encountering an armoured monster - dealing with that using just your fists would lead to a quick defeat.

Your victory is rewarded! Which weapon upgrade tree will you choose? Which skills will aid your struggles? There are two more truly dangerous monsters to defeat before you are free of this accursed place!

Unbroken has been designed to be played regardless of how strapped for time or company you might be. All you need to get it to the table is a small space, 20-30 minutes of free time and just one player - YOU. 

Some games have add-on solo modes. Some allow you to play versus a virtual opponent. Unbroken doesn’t settle for the fact that you’re playing solo - it celebrates it. The survival story you’re telling is that of individual triumph in the face of adversity, and it has been crafted to be enjoyed in exactly this way.

Unbroken is won by careful planning and calculated risk. There are several strategies you can go for including a focus on skills, trickery or different weapon upgrade trees. Your approach will determine your success much more than the limited luck element. Every game you will learn how to best prepare for the challenges of the dungeon. Every next game you will be a little better at surviving. 

Do you spend your resources to find out more about the coming dangers or do you hedge your bets and go in blind? Do you risk looking for food to not starve even if you might be ambushed by a monster? There are many difficult decisions in Unbroken and these will keep you on the edge of your seat wondering if you made the right one. 

Unbroken is built on a flexible system that is centered around a variety of characters to play and monsters to combat. We already have great designs in mind for expansions that we will start working on in full after the campaign. We can’t wait to have the community’s input on the new content! 

We are so certain that you will like Unbroken that we are happy to offer an unconditional full refund (including shipping) within 30 days of you receiving the game. Go ahead, dive in. We know you will love it! 

 Full review from Moe’s Game Table is available here.

You can read a full review by Albin Chevrel, who has been deeply involved in testing and development Unbroken for over a year here (French).

Full review from Elizabeth at Beyond Solitaire is available here!

Read the full review from Giles at Both Sides of My Table here.

Read the full review from Wendy at Singlehandedly here.

Full review from the Lords of Tabletop is coming Apr 4!

Read the full What's Eric Playing review here.

                                                                                                                                                              

Check out the full review by the Geek Girl Project (great job of contrasting the art of Unbroken against that of our previous game, Cauldron).

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                

 "Quick setup, clever design and the mechanics merge really well with the theme. I anticipate many solo players willingly getting lost in the caverns of Unbroken!" - Rolling Solo

All of our shipping is going to be done from a central location located within the EU. We can guarantee no issues with VAT and offer affordable worldwide shipping.

Artem loves making and playing games that immerse you into a story that you can lose yourself in. Particularly passionate about the fantasy genre, Artem made Unbroken as a celebration of perseverance in the face of adversity. Unbroken is Artem’s second game design to be released on Kickstarter following the success of Cauldron in 2015.

Favourite monster: Ogre  // altemagames.com 

Alina is the mastermind who puts all the visuals together into the beautiful whole. She enjoys playing games as often as possible, staying active and doing DIY renovations in her house.

Favourite monster: Minotaur  //  alinamarch.com

Nikolai is a freelance illustrator from Germany. He loves working on fantasy projects and has huge passion for all kinds of games. His past work includes Pathfinder, The Dark Eye, various book covers and video games. In his free time Nikolai works on his own projects, walks his dog, spends time with his girlfriend and on rare occasions he can play games.

Favourite monster: Goblin //  instagram.com/nikolaiostertag

Dustin is a freelance writer and editor, working mostly on tabletop games and RPGs. Late-blooming geek who enjoys gaming in all its forms. Though he has contributed to nearly 100 games, Unbroken is the first solo-only game he has worked on. 

Favourite monster: Minotaur // therulesforge.com

The Golden Bell Studios team (including Marc, Rachel and Rob) will be our partners who can dedicate their full-time attention to arranging the production and fulfillment of Unbroken. I have been very impressed with the enthusiasm and commitment of this team and will stay closely involved in making sure that all backers received their games in a timely and efficient manner.  

Having successfully delivered campaigns from a few hundred to 8,000+ units such as Pretending to Grownup, Venture Party and Strawberry Ninja , Golden Bell Games is an award-winning publisher and a trusted partner that I enjoyed working with on Cauldron following its release. Their connections in the manufacturing and fulfillment industries will ensure a seamless delivery of Unbroken to backers.

  • Inclusion and openness. We’re here to make a great game for everyone to enjoy equally. We do not do early birds, we do not do KS exclusives. Our goal is to make a great game and allow everyone who wants to purchase it enjoy it to full extent. 
  • Participation. We’re proud of our game, and are happy to provide free, downloadable versions of the rulebook and the FULL pre-production print-and-play version of the game. You can also try the game on TableTop Simulator. We’d love to hear your thoughts, and promise to seriously consider all suggestions for improvement. We’re also excited at the prospect of hitting those stretch goals, to allow our backers to make small but neat contributions to the substance of the game. 
  • If we’ve made it, you get it. We offer one version of the game, and it includes everything needed for a complete gameplay experience. There is no additional content hiding behind stretch goals. Any upgrades unlocked won’t change the game by adding new major gameplay elements. They’ll be either aids to increase convenience, component improvements we couldn’t otherwise afford, or small additions that we welcome from our backer community. 
  • Ready to go. We’ve worked hard to bring the game’s graphic design to 99% completion. Every component and game piece is ready to be sent to our printer. The entire graphics package on our end will be ready to go within a month of funding. We hate waiting just as much as you do. 
  • Money-back guarantee. We are certain that you will love Unbroken. To put your mind at ease – if you are not happy with the game, you can return it within 30 days of receiving it, for a full refund, including shipping. We’re confident in our game, and want you to share that confidence before you offer your valuable support.

story:
Like roleplaying games? Like board games? Like computer games? Support the top independent tabletop roleplaying site on the internet with a membership! Not only will you help the site, but you'll also receive membership privileges and a bunch of great roleplaying PDFs!

RPGnet is the top independent web site for tabletop roleplaying games. The heart of our site is one of the most talked-about forums in the industry — with 12,000 active members and 19 million posts. We also publish several gaming reviews every week and a few columns. Finally, we maintain a constantly expanding catalog of roleplaying products that currently indexes 20,000 games and supplements, 2,000 magazines, and 36,000 articles.

All of this costs money, so in 2013 we decided to turn to crowdfunding to encourage readers to become members, to support the site. The drive was successful, so we've turned into a yearly tradition.

In years past, the membership drive has enabled us to restore the search function, move the machines to a cloud platform, revise our reviews system, improve review browsing, enhance mobile access, improve security, and upgrade column tagging.

This year, we've got a variety of awesome PDFs thanks to our generous product sponsors:

  • The Well, from Shoeless Pete Games.
  • They Came from Beneath the Sea! and Pugmire: Pan's Guide for New Pioneers from Onyx Path Publishing.
  • Princess of the Universe, from Fantasy Heartbreaker.
  • Colonial Gothic and Fairyland, from Rogue Games.
  • TimeWatch, from Pelgrane Press.
  • Novus, from Firehawk Games.

Though ads and affiliations pay some of our costs, we are picky about which ads and ad networks we use, so that we can maintain high-quality ads that are likely to be of interest and that won't distract (or annoy!) our readers. We've opted out of high-value ads that include audio, that expand, or that are placed as interstitials between pages. We forbid dating ads, gambling ads, gold-farming ads, political ads, and certain other categories of advertising. 

As a result, we occasionally ask RPGnet readers to become members, in order to help support the community. We hope that you'll join us and help to support the RPGnet community!

Our goal for this IndieGoGo crowdfunding is simple: we want you to become an RPGnet member. Every single reward other than the $5 support level will grant you a membership at RPGnet. Most of them provide membership for the next year, but we also offer Lifetime Memberships for Patrons and others who want to offer a higher level of support.

As a member, you'll receive a few benefits as thanks.

  • Ad Control. Turn ads on and off.
  • Cool PDFs. Becoming a member is how you get access to the PDFs our sponsors are providing.
  • Early Columns Access. You can read columns before they're posted.
  • Early Review Access. You can read reviews before they're posted.

Additionally, at checkout you can add on 1 month and 100k impressions of discounted ad space for your projects or products!

Hi, I'm Rose, editor-in-chief at RPGnet!

RPGnet is a part of my heart. I've been a reader and forum member for over 20 years, from looking for game reviews for my college group to cutting my professional teeth on forum design challenges. RPGnet is a friendly, inclusive, and above all creative community that's simply irreplaceable.

Curating the reviews, moderating the forums, and performing maintenance are labors of love. Your memberships give us the resources to continue that good work -- to provide an independent voice on games, to provide a space for thought-provoking discussion, and to keep the lights on in the internet's best virtual gaming cafe.

I love this site. Join me in keeping it an amazing place for the next 20 years!

--Rose
story_txt:
Like roleplaying games? Like board games? Like computer games? Support the top independent tabletop roleplaying site on the internet with a membership! Not only will you help the site, but you'll also receive membership privileges and a bunch of great roleplaying PDFs!RPGnet is the top independent web site for tabletop roleplaying games. The heart of our site is one of the most talked-about forums in the industry — with 12,000 active members and 19 million posts. We also publish several gaming reviews every week and a few columns. Finally, we maintain a constantly expanding catalog of roleplaying products that currently indexes 20,000 games and supplements, 2,000 magazines, and 36,000 articles.All of this costs money, so in 2013 we decided to turn to crowdfunding to encourage readers to become members, to support the site. The drive was successful, so we've turned into a yearly tradition.In years past, the membership drive has enabled us to restore the search function, move the machines to a cloud platform, revise our reviews system, improve review browsing, enhance mobile access, improve security, and upgrade column tagging.This year, we've got a variety of awesome PDFs thanks to our generous product sponsors:

The Well, from Shoeless Pete Games.

They Came from Beneath the Sea! and Pugmire: Pan's Guide for New Pioneers from Onyx Path Publishing.

Princess of the Universe, from Fantasy Heartbreaker.

Colonial Gothic and Fairyland, from Rogue Games.

TimeWatch, from Pelgrane Press.

Novus, from Firehawk Games.
Though ads and affiliations pay some of our costs, we are picky about which ads and ad networks we use, so that we can maintain high-quality ads that are likely to be of interest and that won't distract (or annoy!) our readers. We've opted out of high-value ads that include audio, that expand, or that are placed as interstitials between pages. We forbid dating ads, gambling ads, gold-farming ads, political ads, and certain other categories of advertising. As a result, we occasionally ask RPGnet readers to become members, in order to help support the community. story:
Tyrnador: Fate of Ventar

A land that survived an undead invasion

A kingdom destroyed and divided

Ancient forests, haunted castles

And dungeons, lots of dungeons.

A band of unlikely heroes will save the world

Or will die horribly trying.

Are you ready to venture into Tyrnador

And discover

The Fate of Ventar?

Tyrnador: Fate of Ventar

Return to the roots of Dungeon Crawling

where Old School Renaissance meets Savage Worlds

 

Tyrnador: Fate of Ventar is the first installment of the world of Tyrnador, GRAmel’s exciting new fantasy setting for Savage Worlds.

What is Tyrnador? Well, do you remember the old classics Dragonlance and Mystara? Tyrnador is a game in the same vein, a place of high fantasy, where heroic knights and mysterious mages battle dragons and other creatures of evil.

Tyrnador has a strong dungeon-crawling focus, which can give you and your players countless hours doing what you like most: entering the dens of monsters, beating them senseless and grabbing their loot of course!

But Tyrnador is much more than this, it is a game with a vibrant soul and sense of wonder, like those old fantasy books in the ’80s you loved so much…

The Fate of Ventar

Two hundred years ago, Prince Ventar, son of the Kalyrian Emperor, had a vision sent by god Kaavor, Lord of Pacts: the fate of the Empire lay in a distant land beyond the unexplored Kalyrian range, west of the Empire.

With a handful of followers and their families, Ventar crossed the mountains and found an enormous valley, devoid of human presence. He gave it his name, Ventar.

Terrible monsters like dragons, goblins and lizard men roamed the land, but also industrious dwarves and a short, peaceful people called hauflins.

But the greatest opponents to mankind’s presence in this land were the elves, immortal lords of the Tyrn Forest, powerful Fae who saw humans as invaders and defilers of their forest.

Ventar built a series of guard towers on the coastline, because Kaavor’s vision told him that the fate of the Empire would come from the sea, and then dedicated himself to conquering and taming his new kingdom, fighting bitterly with the elves.

Ventar’s successors continued their forefather’s task, and in their quarrels they forgot the real reason for their presence in the valley.

Then the Fate of Ventar suddenly came: one foggy night an enormous fleet of undead came from the Sleepless Sea. They were the vanguard of the Necromancer, herald of Thuul, God of Death, and the most powerful sorcerer ever seen. The enemy took the coastal towers completely off-guard and cut through the kingdom like a knife through butter.

Ventar City, capital of the kingdom, fell and the King’s son died.

All the free people of the land, men, elves and dwarves alike had to put aside their differences and fight together against the mortal threat. It was a long, harsh war, but in the end the forces of good repelled the Necromancer, forcing him to retreat beyond the mysterious Gates of Night, in the far north.

Ten years have passed since the end of the war, and Ventar is still a devastated land: once peaceful villages are reduced to crumbling ruins infested by undead, forests are overgrown with black brambles, and fields lie abandoned.

King Valeros of Ventar has issued an order: all must be reconquered and rebuilt, and you and your fellow adventurers are the only people who can do it. And you must be quick, because the Necromancer is stirring again, and the Fate of Ventar, the real one, is yet to come! 

An Old School Setting

Everything you’ll find in Tyrnador screams “old school”.

The latest iteration of the Savage Worlds rules were fine-tuned and adapted, where necessary, to give you the perfect high fantasy dungeon-crawling experience.

In this game you’ll find dozens of Edges, gear, spells and a handful of setting rules specifically tailored for this goal.

But Tyrnador isn’t just about dungeon crawling (or hex-crawling in the wilderness): the setting is very flexible and can be used for more narrative adventures and investigative scenarios if you want.

The setting is also designed to handle high-level games, with a simple but robust Stronghold management system, which begins to be useful very early in the adventurers’ lives, and extensive rules for crafting and magical research.

So… a lot of stuff packed into a few pages!

You can download a free Quickstart for Tyrnador here! 

This game references the Savage Worlds game system, available from Pinnacle Entertainment Group at www.peginc.com. Savage Worlds and all associated logos and trademarks are copyrights of Pinnacle Entertainment Group. Used with permission. Pinnacle makes no representation or warranty as to the quality, viability, or suitability for purpose of this product.

Player Guide Contents

This book contains:

  • A brief history of Ventar.
  • An extensive gazetteer of the lands, from the players’ perspective.
  • Character creation rules, including race descriptions and stats.
  • New Edges and Hindrances, including a brand new type of Edges: Faction Edges.
  • New Gear: from mage’s staves to war-horses and the essential cooking pot (after all, you’ll eat in dungeons, won’t you?).
  • Magic: a detailed description of the three arcane backgrounds of Tyrnador: magic, miracles and elven soul.
  • Setting Rules: from alternate Inventory to Resting rules.
  • Funnel Heroes generation table (we’ll talk about this later, don’t worry).

Game Master Guide Contents

This book contains:

  • Running Ventar: hints, tips and tricks.
  • Secrets of Ventar: a gazetteer expansion, including plot hooks and clues for every region of Ventar
  • Quest Generator: a random system to create quests for your players.
  • Dungeons of Ventar: a detailed guide to designing and building dungeons.
  • Strongholds: from humble taverns to castles and mages’ towers!
  • Treasures: from mundane richness to powerful magical items.
  • Bestiary: from Dire Wolves to Tower Guardians

 

You can download a free Quickstart for Tyrnador here! 

 

Components and Add Ons

  • Player Guide (about 150 pages, black and white, softcover + pdf),
  • Game Master Guide (about 150 pages, black and white, softcover + pdf),
  • GM Tables Brochure (print + pdf),
  • A3 Map (double-sided, print + pdf),
  • 2 Bookmarks (print + pdf),
  • 10 Character sheets  (print + pdf),
  • Character tokens (pdf)
  • 54 Tyrnador cards in pdf - Power Cards, Adventure Cards, Ritual Cards, Magic Items, etc. 
  • Funnel characters generator in excel
  • Rumor generator in excel 
  • Dungeon Generator  in excel

All digital rewards will be sent by DriveThruRpg

 

Pdf copy of the Tyrnador Fate of Ventar  Player Guide, GM Guide, game tables booklet, A3 map, figure tokens in pdf, and every stretch goal in pdf.

Print copy of the Tyrnador Fate of Ventar Player Guide, GM Guide, printed game tables booklet, A3 map, 10 character sheets, 2 bookmarks, character tokens (in pdf) and every stretch goal in pdf and print (if possible). 

Print copy of the TFV Player Guide, GM Guide, printed game tables booklet, A3 map, 10 character sheets, 2 bookmarks and character tokens (in pdf), plus every stretch goal in pdf and print (if possible), dice/token bag, 20 wooden bennies/tokens.

$4500 - Funded!

All the basics in print and/or pdf!

$6000 - Music for Tyrnador:

10 background “songs” illustrating different situations (caverns, taverns, dungeons, woods etc.)

$7500 – Dungeons set #1 (PDF)

Dungeon #1 – The Prison of the Mad Count [FUNNEL ADVENTURE!]

Count Grotho is mad as a hatter, and he enjoys capturing people to throw them in his dungeons, to torture them in every way you can think of. Nobody has ever escaped from that terrible prison. At least till now…

Dungeon #2 – The Crystal Caves.

Have you heard of the caves of the Island of Remastor? They are made of crystal, they say, and named after Remastor the Purple, a mage who disappeared while trying to explore them. His magical staff, the Hand of Remastor, must still be there…

Dungeon #3 – The Rusty Door Sewers.

Located in the lower levels of Bridgegate, there are rumors this place is the real cause of the strange disappearances and thefts now happening in the rich merchants’ city. Do you dare explore it?

Locations Set #2 (PDF)

Location #1 – The Tentacle Inn.

Bobo Finnelfinn is a hauflin, and a peculiar one. A former adventurer, he spent all the loot earned in his adventuring years (rumors say he killed all his comrades to get it) to buy this shabby-looking inn. The Tentacle Inn is specialized in one dish: tentacle of cave centipede, and Bobo knows every possible way to cook them. Are you ready to visit him?

Location #2 – Claguson’s Fantastic Airship!

 Claguson is a great dwarven mage, with a dream: create a device capable of flying. Now, after many years of hard work and failures, his airship, the Purple Dragon, is ready to fly! Aren’t you excited?

Location #3 – The Shrine of the Black Unicorn.

An ancient temple in the woods where the priestesses, all young beautiful women, worship this powerful, legendary Fae. Rumors say that inside it there is a secret gate to the Faerann.

$10500 - Stomper’s Diaries (PDF)

Stomper’s Diary #1 – The Bounty Hunters!

A new Faction, complete with Faction Edges, backstory and rules for randomly generating bounties!

Stomper’ Diary #2 – Henchmen!

When your party members are too few to face a particular mission, it’s time for them to hire some help. Six great (and not so great) henchmen to hire!

Stomper’s Diary #3 – The Wizard Test.

A guide to creating special faction quests tailored for mages, to test the novice’s mind, power and heart. Only the best will be admitted to the Order of Magicians…

 

Tyrnador and all other items will be published/produced by GRAmel Books Piotr Koryś, a Polish company known for Beasts and Barbarians Golden Edition, Adventurers!, Nemezis, and Polish editions of Savage Worlds and Deadlands. We have been in the market for more than 10 years and we have published almost 100 books or pdfs. We have access to all sorts of tabletop game accessories, and long experience in the international tabletop game market.

GRAmel Books have had 3 successful crowdfunding campaigns in Poland (Beszamel, Szare Szeregi and Savage Worlds Edycja Przygodowa – Polish version of Savage Worlds Adventure Edition), and delivered all rewards (SWAE is in development, but we have delivered a few things already); our Beasts of the Dominions and Adventurers! crowdfunding has also been delivered successfully. Even when Beasts and Barbarians Steel Edition, which was done with another publisher, had problems we stepped up and delivered everything we’d promised to our backers.

We’re gathering money mostly for print and, most of all, for great, new art for you. If the campaign is succesful, we will order art from our artists and then do final layout and send pdfs, then print books and other things.

Answering your questions: We will try to answer at least once a day. During weekends, it may be a bit longer between our answers. We hope that you will understand.

We plan to have everything ready around October/November (but it all depends on funded things and artists), and send the funded pdfs as soon as they are ready. Shipping may take time, though.  Please also be aware that there can be custom fees to be paid.

story:
Introducing Sip-To-Suit Cards About Coffee.  A deck of premium playing cards that breaks down coffee making and drink recipes into informative and thoughtful infographics.

The deck offers quick-draw access to brew ratios, grind size, temperatures, and durations for popular brew methods as commonly recommended and practiced by the coffee community. There are also educational coffee tips for beginners, and drink recipes for anyone who adores coffee.

 

 

 

 

 

Packaged as a deck of cards, Sip-To-Suit eliminates the hassle and time of sorting through online resources or piles of notes to find the right brewing parameters and drink recipes. 

The cards are compact enough to be stored away, yet easy to retrieve when needed, making it the perfect companion when you need quick reminders on those brew parameters.

Flipping through pages of notes or resorting to online resources to locate your brew preferences is slow and inconvenient, especially when you haven't had caffeine yet! 

The Sip-To-Suit Cards quickly provides the essential information you'd need to finish your ideal brew!

All Method Cards indicate common brew values as recommended and practiced in the coffee community around the world.

The Waterproof Edition deck is stored in a handy plastic hard case.  Designed for quick access to your brewing parameters, making it the perfect companion by your coffee station!

 

 

Whether you are a serious pour over fanatic or a curious coffee drinker who is interested in stepping into the world of craft coffee, Sip-To-Suit is your perfect partner.  Think of the cards as a time-saving quick-reference reminder to all the essential brewing information at your fingertips. The delightfully illustrated cards are also great fun for any card game players as well as coffee lovers to collect and admire!

 

 

 

 

Find it fast! Information is arranged and grouped by suits and color to ensure brew methods, drink formulas, and coffee fundamentals can be located quickly.  

PRO-TIP - The method cards are ordered by brew method involvement (that's preparing, brewing, and cleaning!) from a more complicated #10 card, like a vacuum pot, to a simpler #2 card, like a pour over cone.

The drink cards are ordered by their typical coffee drink strength, from a stronger, more intense #10 card, like an Espresso Romano, to a milder #2 card, like a milk-based Latte.

 

 

 

We've spent a tremendous amount of hours on validation research and development of these cards ensuring the information/data from the coffee community is accurately communicated. 

We've refined the artwork and design of each card for optimal usability and readability. Every card is meticulously designed, carefully illustrated, and packaged into a fun custom design tuck box.

Above picture shows a closeup of the 3 BREW METERS (left) and brew timeline (far right). And check out that glorious linen-finish on the card stock!

 

 

All artwork printed to very high standards on air-cushion linen-finish premium card stock. They look precise, clean, and crisp!

 

 

Learn more about our design journey through this series of short videos, covering the tuck box design, card back design, and the Waterproof Edition packaging.

 

TUCK BOX DESIGN JOURNEY (Duration: 3:00)

 

CARD BACK DESIGN JOURNEY (Duration: 2:45)

 

WATERPROOF EDITION PACKAGING (Duration: 2:24)

 

 

 

We've reached out to close friends who are coffee fanatics to find errors and mistakes. We got in touch with baristas/trainers, and even magicians/card collectors around the world for their thoughts on the Sip-To-Suit deck - and we've listened!!  

The feedback we received to date has been truly valuable and validating, resulting in many multiple-rounds of design and content refinements. We're very confident that you'll love how the deck has turned out!

Here's a couple of comments we've received about Sip-To-Suit:

 

 

 

 

Each edition features its own unique Joker card designs. Collect both editions and challenge your playing guests to spot the differences!

 

Card back design is specifically customized for each deck to ensure each edition is uniquely different in the family.  The iconic "Hexagon" in each theme color was inspired by the chemical structure of Caffeine.

 

 

 

To celebrate the beauty of a finely pulled espresso shot, we've selected the rich creamy Crema as the theme color for this Standard Edition deck.  This variant utilizes the Copper Crema color as an accent throughout the entire deck, including the unique custom tuck box with a matching color print motif inside it!

 

 

 

The Waterproof Edition deck was created for daily use by your coffee station to ensure cards are easy to wash and clean in the unfortunate event of a spill.  All 56 cards in this edition are made of a matte-finish synthetic PVC material for durability, longevity, and are 100% waterproof!

Other unique design touches that are exclusive to the Waterproof Edition includes:

Waterproof cards are made out of thin but durable synthetic PVC material, and are completely washable under running water!

Matching front and back brand labels for the plastic clear case on the Waterproof Edition deck. Label material will be water-resistant, making it easier to wash the plastic case when needed.

 

 

We are excited to announce the offer of STANDARD EDITION uncut sheets to everyone. Uncut sheets are printed sheets of playing cards pulled straight off the factory press at USPCC (The United States Playing Card Company) prior to being cut and boxed. These are great for collecting and perfect for displaying on your coffee bar wall!

  • Limited availability: 10 sheets 
  • Price per sheet: $35
  • US shipping: $10
  • International shipping: $23
  • Ships in a mailing tube

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We ship to the U.S, the U.K, Europe, Asia, Australia, and many other countries around the world with tracking information. Please note that door-to-door tracking for international shipments may be unavailable in some countries or very limited once the package leaves U.S. borders.

The standard price for shipping depends on which reward you have selected and which country we are shipping to.  Note that international backers are responsible for any potential customs duties and taxes, but we will work with our fulfillment partner early on to ensure the transit journey is as smooth as it can be.

Please also know that there are always potential shipping and delivery delays during the global pandemic. We truly appreciate your patience. We are committed to working towards our promised shipping schedule, and we guarantee that you will receive your reward.

For added peace of mind, we have Backerkit already setup to take care of our surveys (final order and shipping address confirmation) at the end of the campaign. We also have Gambler's Warehouse here in Texas standing by as our order fulfillment partner. Both companies have years of experience and a renowned reputation in crowdfunding. You are in great hands!

Feel free to reach out if you have any questions regarding shipping to your designated country. We'll absolutely do what we can to get you answers!

NOTE: Please understand that we do not ship to the following countries due to shipping service limitations during COVID-19:

 

 

Art of Caffeination was founded by Vincent Lam, a coffee enthusiast and a professional industrial designer with 20 years’ experience in consumer and medical product design. He is the recipient of multiple design awards, including Red Dot (German international design prize awarded by Red Dot GmbH), iF (International Forum Design GmbH in Germany), and IDEA (International Design Excellence Award, held by IDSA - Industrial Designers Society of America) Awards.

 

A special thanks to Alexandru Miclea (Instagram handle @m.alekz) and Simon Gautherin (Instagram handle @simon_barista) for their extra thoughtful feedback on the design and coffee content on the cards! And Giles Dawe from Hyperstarter for guiding us early on this project!

 

 

A little more about how the Sip-To-Suit Cards came about.

 

 

 

Our high-level schedule plan. We just need your backing to get to print production.
story_txt:
Introducing Sip-To-Suit Cards About Coffee.  A deck of premium playing cards that breaks down coffee making and drink recipes into informative and thoughtful infographics.The deck offers quick-draw access to brew ratios, grind size, temperatures, and durations for popular brew methods as commonly recommended and practiced by the coffee community. There are also educational coffee tips for beginners, and drink recipes for anyone who adores coffee.     Packaged as a deck of cards, Sip-To-Suit eliminates the hassle and time of sorting through online resources or piles of notes to find the right brewing parameters and drink recipes. The cards are compact enough to be stored away, yet easy to retrieve when needed, making it the perfect companion when you need quick reminders on those brew parameters.Flipping through pages of notes or resorting to online resources to locate your brew preferences is slow and inconvenient, especially when you haven't had caffeine yet! The Sip-To-Suit Cards quickly provides the essential information you'd need to finish your ideal brew!All Method Cards indicate common brew values as recommended and practiced in the coffee community around the world.The Waterproof Edition deck is stored in a handy plastic hard case.  Designed for quick access to your brewing parameters, making it the perfect companion by your coffee station!  Whether you are a serious pour over fanatic or a curious coffee drinker who is interested in stepping into the world of craft coffee, Sip-To-Suit is your perfect partner.  Think of the cards as a time-saving quick-reference reminder to all the essential brewing information at your fingertips. The delightfully illustrated cards are also great fun for any card game players as well as coffee lovers to collect and admire!    Find it fast! Information is arranged and grouped by suits and color to ensure brew methods, drink formulas, and coffee fundamentals can be located quickly.  PRO-TIP - The method cards are ordered by brew method involvement (that's preparing, brewing, and cleaning!) from a more complicated #10 card, like a vacuum pot, to a simpler #2 card, like a pour over cone.The drink cards are ordered by their typical coffee drink strength, from a stronger, more intense #10 card, like an Espresso Romano, to a milder #2 card, like a milk-based Latte.   We've spent a tremendous amount of hours on validation research and development of these cards ensuring the information/data from the coffee community is accurately communicated. We've refined the artwork and design of each card for optimal usability and readability. Every card is meticulously designed, carefully illustrated, and packaged into a fun custom design tuck box.Above picture shows a closeup of the 3 BREW METERS (left) and brew timeline (far right). And check out that glorious linen-finish on the card stock!  All artwork printed to very high standards on air-cushion linen-finish premium card stock. They look precise, clean, and crisp!  Learn more about our design journey through this series of short videos, covering the tuck box design, card back design, and the Waterproof Edition packaging. TUCK BOX DESIGN JOURNEY (Duration: 3:00)

 
CARD BACK DESIGN JOURNEY (Duration: 2:45) WATERPROOF EDITION PACKAGING (Duration: 2:24)   We've reached out to close friends who are coffee fanatics to find errors and mistakes. We got in touch with baristas/trainers, and even magicians/card collectors around the world for their thoughts on the Sip-To-Suit deck - and we've listened!!  The feedback we received to date has been truly valuable and validating, resulting in many multiple-rounds of design and content refinements. story:
The missing treasure of New York City beer baron Dutch Schultz has captivated countless treasure hunters. On his deathbed in 1935, the infamous mobster rambled on incoherently for hours, possibly revealing the location of his hidden millions. The cache has never been recovered. This legend inspired William S. Burroughs to write a screenplay titled “The Last Words of Dutch Schultz”. Could the information in Mob Treasure contain new clues to finding the final resting place?

 

"Journal 29 is the golden standard for these books. . . THIS might rival it."

-Watch It Paint It

 

"The design complements the puzzles really, really well."

-The Escape Room Guys

 

"One minute, you could be in a tunnel and the next, in a secret area behind a poker room."

-ESCAPETHEROOMers

 

     

     Mob Treasure is a new puzzle book based on the legendary treasure of mobster Dutch Schultz. The adventure will take you to many locations, from backroom poker hangouts to secret beer baron tunnels. 

     Players of all skill levels will be challenged and rewarded by tackling over 75 unique puzzles. Each of the 15 chapters play like an escape room ending with a meta puzzle you must solve to continue. Carefully examine the images and text on each page and bend your mind to crack the codes.

 

"an enjoyable experience and a really good way to spend a full day inside."

-Opinionated Gamer 

 

 

•Fully tested range of puzzle difficulties from beginner to expert.

•Puzzles created by escape game designers.

•A rich and compelling story that engages from chapter to chapter.

•Innovative experiences including visual, spatial, logic, relational and word puzzles.

•Eclectic art design inspired by vintage games of the 30’s and 40’s.

•Staggered hint system and explanations of solutions.

•Solution checker on website

•Puzzle boss battle!?

 

     

     Hello there! I’m Jan Van Damme, the creator of Mob Treasure. Making this book allowed me to combine my love of treasure hunts, history, mythology, interactive narratives and mysteries. The idea came from a rare treasure hunters journal that I was lucky to get a hold of. The manuscript contained maps, letters and descriptions of “visions” the author had about the lost money of Dutch Schultz. As many before me, I caught the treasure hunting bug. I searched for clues in newspaper microfilms from 1935 at a library. 

     For Mob Treasure, I captured the gritty look and feel of the historical ephemera. The puzzles and story convey the excitement I felt during my personal hunt. With seasoned escape room designers and talented artists on board, we're bringing this legend back to life in puzzle book form. I'm proud of what we've created, and are excited to bring you the thrills that Mob Treasure has to offer. Your contribution will fund the changes, updates and tweaks needed for completion. 

     Please share this project with your friends on your socials. Thanks!
