story:
But this is the second edition! 

Modular LED System: Yes! Now, it is possible to illuminate AdapTableTop ABOVE and BELOW!

This will bring even more benefits to your gaming nights:

  • you can easily read any player sheet, manual or cards without having to move it constantly. 
  • Light up the playing surface if you are in a tavern or pub or even in a dark environment!
  • The LED system is supported by an application (IOS -Android) that gives the possibility to remotely modify any parameter, lighting styles, saturation, effects. Every game will have the atmosphere that you consider most evocative. 

 

Addons will be available for purchase after the campaign ends, on the Pledge Manager platform

(see FAQs for more details)

 

Risks & Challenges

We believe that continually informing and supporting our backers in every phase of the project (presentation - production - shipping - customer support) is the best form of respect: this is our philosophy. Aware that there may be delays that do not depend on us, we considered delivering this project by August 2022. Due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others. The mission is to present products of the highest quality, and that can improve your gaming experiences, giving you hours of fun. All components will be produced in China and respect the best quality standards that we always guarantee for our products. To follow our latest news or information, please visit our website: www.gamestartstudio.com

REFUND POLICY

We can repay 100% of the pledge within ten days of the campaign's end. After this deadline, we can make refunds net of taxes and expenses already incurred. If we started packing for shipping (usually 3 to 5 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refund is possible. This project is financed in EUR, and any refund paid will be in EUR for the exact amount received in EUR, excluding any applicable fees based on the current currency.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the crowdfunding campaign was active. Suppose you do not log in and confirm your pledge within six months of our notification via email to confirm your pledge: in that case, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the six months window has elapsed. Unconfirmed pledges make it difficult for us to plan production and logistics, and in the past have led to project delays. We do not intend to allow this to happen for this project, which may mean if you confirm your pledge too late, exclusive items may not be produced in sufficient quantity for your pledge. Suppose you confirm your pledge within six months of our notification via email: in that case, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by standard methods. Shipping costs may vary from what is indicated in the "Shipping" section, as they will be applied next year and therefore may be subject to increases. Also, the number of unlocked stretch goals could influence the final product's weight range, increasing shipping costs. If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge to this project.

Giuliano & Mario @Game Start Team

story:
The MapForge map-making software continues to evolve. What initially began as a tool for making quick and easy top-down tactical-scale maps for tabletop RPGs has gradually grown to also support hex-tile-based area/regional mapping, edit Donjon-generated maps to customize them to your exact needs (or create your own custom dungeons from scratch), and more recently (thanks to a Kickstarter campaign) to allow the creation of isometric maps.

Now I'd like to offer mapping content tailored specifically for the oft-ignored Post-Apocalyptic genre, because GMs of post-apocalyptic tabletop RPG games need maps, too! Unfortunately, quality Post-Apocalyptic mapping content is very hard to find.

You should be interested in this campaign if you're a Game Master (or plan to be) for any of the following RPGs:

  • Deadlands: Hell on Earth
  • Darwin's World
  • Exodus
  • Morrow Project
  • RIFTS
  • Aftermath!
  • Twilight: 2000
  • Broken Earth
  • GURPS After the End (Wastelanders)
  • or other Fallout-like RPGs

Isometric, A Primer

Isometric maps were made popular by many computer RPGs and strategy games. A lot of people, however, might be familiar with the map style but not necessarily with the technical term "isometric". Maps made with with isometric graphics can create spectacular, richly detailed visuals.

For GMs of pen-and-paper RPGs, such maps are often more useful as visual aids than as tactical battlemaps that you would move tokens around on. However, some virtual tabletop programs (aka VTTs) now support isometric maps, and that number should gradually increase.

MapForge is map-making software that was successfully funded on Kickstarter in 2017. Version 1.0 of MapForge was released in 2018, along with an incredible 50 content Add-Ons available for it from leading content providers. Since then, the number of content Add-Ons for MapForge has more than doubled.

Those of you who are new to MapForge should please visit the above links for more information about the software (it's simply too much information to repeat here). The FAQ for the original campaign is also a useful source of information.

The TL:DR version

  • MapForge is easy-to-use software for Windows and Mac OS that makes high-quality maps for printing or for use in virtual tabletop software (e.g., Roll20, Fantasy Grounds, etc.).
  • Can be used for free (no license is required for low resolution output).
  • Comes with 28 free content Add-Ons, providing a total of over 5300 assets to get you started (that's over 2.5 GBs!).
  • In addition to using content from pre-packaged Add-Ons, MapForge also allows you to use your own artwork (either created by you, or downloaded from elsewhere, such as the Dundjinni user forums or rpgmapshare.com).
  • You can download and try the software out for yourself, to evaluate it and see if the program is what you want/expect it to be.
  • If you choose to purchase a license, it is only a one-time fee, not a recurring monthly subscription.

The content Add-Ons that will be produced by this campaign

During this campaign you may pledge for any or all of the following additional items, regardless of which pledge level you selected. Click on each Add-On link below to see a preview of what it will contain and for additional product details.

  • "Post-Apocalypse Tiles" Add-On ($9.00)
  • "Post-Apoc City/Town" Add-On ($6.00)
  • "PA Vehicles & Shantytown" Add-On ($7.00)
  • A MapForge software license ($33; this can be for yourself, or it can be a gift for someone else)

IMPORTANT! All content Add-Ons that will be developed by this campaign are strictly for "Personal Use Only". Publishing or commercial use of this content is not allowed.

All MapForge Add-Ons are in a closed/proprietary format, and the content cannot be accessed outside of the MapForge software. MapForge v1.1.6 or higher (due to be released in April 2020) will be required to use the Add-Ons produced by this Kickstarter campaign.

Gifting a MapForge license to a friend:

After the campaign  has ended, you will need to provide me your friend's email address so that I can get them their license code. Note that any content Add-Ons that you get for yourself will not also be applied to your friend's license.

Other Things to Cover

  • Funds raised by this campaign will be used by Battlegrounds Games to cover the cost of developing/porting the Add-Ons, and paying the necessary art licensing fees.
  • If this campaign is successful, I will be working on fulfilling the Rewards as soon as possible. If there is significant overfunding, I will use it to develop MapForge further, in order to add additional capabilities and features that have been requested.
  • If you want any content Add-Ons produce prior to this campaign, you can order them from the MapForge web store, and receive them right away (no need to wait for this campaign to end).

While the majority of potential backers of this project will likely be tabletop RPG gamers, isometric mapping is something that non-gamers can really enjoy, too. Creating isometric maps/illustrations is a fun, creative, and rewarding activity that anyone, regardless of drawing skill (or lack thereof) can enjoy.

Whether or not you choose to make a pledge to this campaign, I would greatly appreciate it if you could mention this project to friends or family members who might be interested. I've made it easy to do so; just click on one of the buttons below to help spread the word.

Last but not least, I'd love it if you would follow Battlegrounds Games on any or all of these social media sites, so you can stay apprised of all the latest news and developments. And consider signing up to the MapForge mailing list.

Follow Battlegrounds on                      Facebook            Twitter               Pinterest

Thank you for checking out this campaign!

Risks & Challenges

All rewards for this project are digital downloads, so shipping is neither a factor nor an added expense. Battlegrounds Games has over a decade of experience distributing software and content packs.

All of the third-party content being ported to MapForge's Add-On format already exists, so there won't be any delay in getting that content from each provider.

Now that I've already produced well over 100 MapForge content Add-Ons, I have a very solid grasp of how long porting content to MapForge format takes, and I continually strive to further streamline the process, for faster turnaround.

In short, this is an extremely low risk campaign, and one with a quick delivery date. Please be sure to try out the free version of the software prior to pledging.

story:
In English - En français - Auf Deutsch
На русском - Po polsku - Suomeksi

 

Dized is an app that will teach you games, set up game nights, and keep track of your library.
It’s your new friend at the table.

Our smart tutorials and game setups will have you playing board games right out of the box.

Pick your game and Dized takes you through it step by step. You get just the information you need to start playing right away. You learn all you need to know about the game– but at a better pace. No info dump, no rules you can’t use yet.

 

 

That means you can go to your friendly local game store, buy a new title, and start playing immediately.


 

Forgot something or need to look something up? Enter the Rule Lookup Tool. We digitize and cross-reference rule books into small, manageable chunks. We’re also working on a powerful search tool which can answer your questions with a few taps. The content will always be up to date and publisher approved.

Our first batch of titles includes something classic, something aimed at families, and a couple of titles for the more demanding hobby gamers. We have plans for hundreds of games, but filling our library in a reasonable time frame is a resource-heavy process: that’s why we need your help to make it happen!

King of Tokyo Tutorial sneak peek!

Blood Rage Tutorial sneak peek!

7 Wonders Tutorial sneak peek!

Scythe Tutorial sneak peek!

We want to make your game nights unforgettable, easy to organize and help you connect with gamers around the globe. Not only are we making learning easier, we’re building a community with these additional tools, available with Full Access:

 

Read more about the Extended Profile!

We want to make board games available to everyone, so we’re offering multiple ways to access Dized. Our credits system allows for more user choice and versatility.

 

 
 
We want everyone to enjoy board games. Free accounts include limited access to Dized features. Free users can access our Core Library of Games, and gain access to 1 game title of their choice for 1 month. After one month is up, users can choose to gain access to another, or the same, game title.
 
 

 

 

Back before we hit a Prize Draw Stretch Goal to make sure you're included in that draw: pledge early and you get to enter them all! Our first giveaway will include these awesome prizes:

Bluetooth speaker, portable powerbank for your smart device, stand for smart device, 2 Ikea Kallax shelves, Gift card to CoolStuff, Card game playmats, Screenwipes, Card sleeves, Miniature painting kit with magnifying glass, Miniature set, Dized coasters and of course dice from Chessex!

Sounds too good to be true? 
Check out what happened at Gen Con 2017...
 

 

 

A Stretch Goal is something extra we can develop or make happen when hitting certain funding goals.

All perk levels will get access to every Stretch Goal we can unlock. Take a look at what we have planned, and stay tuned for more reveals during the campaign!

A bigger, richer and prettier User Profile. Read more about it in Update #6!

One lucky winner will take home 100+ board games, a Geeknson table, a tablet device and much more! Follow the Live Stream on our Facebook page on September 27 at 7 PM Helsinki time (EEST), which translates into 9 AM PDT, 12 PM EDT

Five soundtracks of games you will pick through Vote Tokens, accessible outside Tutorials, that will include ambient music fitting the game and its phases, and SFX that can be used to taunt your opponents or cheer together when the situation grants it.

Extra features for the message boards. Read more about them in UPDATE #9.

Even MOAR features for message boards! Read about them in Update #10.

There’s strength in numbers, be it total dollars raised or backers happy to join us for the ride and make board games a more approachable hobby. Why not have some fun while we’re at it? Enter the Social Achievements or the “things you can do to unlock more credits without paying a dime.”

Every time 4 of these Achievements are unlocked, every backer gets an extra free credit on Dized. Ready? Steady? Go!

FACEBOOK LIKES

Like our page on Facebook!

TWITTER FOLLOWERS

Follow either @getDized, @getDizedFR, @getDizedDE, @getDizedPL or @getDizedRU. All followers contribute to the unlocking of this achievement!

CAMPAIGN SHARES

Share the campaign on Facebook! (you can use the link next to the ‘Back It’ button on the top of the campaign)

We want Dized to happen now. We can build the platform, tools, and library in a year (with your help), or in ten, without it. And nobody wants to wait ten years!

Creating Tutorials, Setups, and Rule Lookup Tools is a process that can only be scaled by scaling the number of designers, artists and industry professionals we employ. The success of this campaign will allow us to grow at the necessary pace to keep churning out more and more material for your favorite games and make sure our tools will be easy to use for third parties, including publishers and designers, too.

 

The Dized team is a passionate team of board gamers, developers and artists, now 20 strong. Based in Helsinki, Finland, but international at heart, collectively we’ve been working on several cool projects like Lords of Hellas, Nostalgia, MONAD System, Geek and Sundry, The Dice Tower etc.

Several of us have worked for different publishers like Wizards of the Coast, Paizo, IELLO, Blue Orange Games, Pegasus Spiele etc.

Our network is extensive not forgetting that we have quite a few successful people as shareholders as well. Here's one of them!

 

RETAILERS: Are you a board game industry operator? Click here to find out what Dized can do for you!

DESIGNERS/PUBLISHERS: Do you want your games on Dized? Go here to let us know!

1. How fast will games be released?

The bigger the campaign gets, the faster we will be able to hire professionals to process Tutorials, Rule Lookup Tools, and other features. We are currently working on software tools that will eventually open to third parties, like publishers and individual designers. Those tools will streamline the process of creating content for Dized to the extreme. Our goal is to build a platform to allow hundreds of games to be published on Dized every year!

2. But how can you possibly get EVERY GAME EVER?

Every game EVER? Might not happen next year. But the more games we make, the more tools we develop to make our library of games grow exponentially. And as you can tell, we dream exponentially big ;)

3. Okay fine, but what about XXX game? Can that at least be on there?

Thanks for letting us know your wish list! The more you reach out and tell us what you, the community, want to see, the more we can work to make it happen. In fact, we have a Facebook group for just that purpose. And in response to this demand, we’re including vote tokens in every single one of our perk levels. See description above for more details!

4. I’m super into it. When and where do I use these vote tokens?

Polls will open when we setup the backer accounts, after the campaign. 

5.  If we can play on one device, why should I get my own account?

Dized will have features that are unique to you. Just like Netflix will recommend movies based on what you watched, Dized will recommend games to you based on what you’ve played. We’re working to make more features that will let you customize the app, and eventually connect to your friends as well. Plus, you’ll want to be able to use your vote tokens, tied to your account for your vote :)

6. Will you ever have a tool for me to make a tutorial for my game?

We’d love that! We’re starting off building a consistent and reliable software of the industry’s top rated games, and have plans in the future of building tools for 3rd party publishers to develop their own. For now, you can submit your game for Dized developed consideration here. Stay tuned!

7.  Are the Custom Dized dice set a physical reward?

Yes.

8. When will our Full Access start?

After the app is officially launched (August 2018), you’ll be able to start your Full Access at any time. Before the launch, you’ll still be able to access the app's features with a Free account.

9. When can I start using credits?

After the app is officially launched (August 2018), you’ll be able to start using your credits at any time. Before the launch, you’ll still be able to access the app's features with a Free account.

10. Is shipping of physical items included in the perk’s price?

Yes.

11. Which devices will Dized be available on? 

Dized will first be released for iOS and Android. We also want to bring Dized to other platforms – this is potentially something we will let our backers decide with their votes.

12. Where can I read the terms of the prize draw in full?

Here.

13. I have a reference (or referral) code, where do I put it?

Here.

14. What languages will Dized support?

Many! Our goal is that eventually every language will be supported. When launched next year Dized will support at least English, German, French, Russian, Italian, Spanish, Polish and Finnish.

Software development is tricky

Our development team is comprised of seasoned professionals and has over a hundred combined years of experience in software development. We are based in Helsinki, Finland, the hotbed for mobile app and game development (Rovio, Supercell, ring any bells?) Dized is developed with Unity 3D, and Unity Finland’s offices are just one floor below ours, which is pretty handy when you need to ask them a question.

Getting everyone on board is a challenge

In the past three years, we’ve managed to get several big industry names on board, as reflected from our first game announcements. Being actively present at industry events and communicating with all the key operators has given us plenty of confidence on how valuable Dized will be for publishers, distributors, retailers, board game cafes and, of course, gamers. The goal of this campaign is to show that there is enough interest for this product for even the biggest industry operators to hop on board with their catalog of games.

Unexpected problems

The greater the challenge, the greater the satisfaction of conquering it! Several members of our team come from entrepreneurial backgrounds, and solving problems is our daily bread. We don’t rest until things look awesome.

 

 

If you’ve read this far, we must have done something to intrigue you. And we have to say, we’re flattered. Thank you so much for your interest, and if in even the smallest way, being a part of this adventure. Our ultimate goal is to make Dized not about us and our ambitions, but about the board game community as a whole. Together, we can make board gaming a common language by boosting the industry, empowering retailers, and bringing gaming groups together more often. Let’s make some noise!
story_txt:
In English - En français - Auf DeutschНа русском - Po polsku - Suomeksi Dized is an app that will teach you games, set up game nights, and keep track of your library.It’s your new friend at the table.Our smart tutorials and game setups will have you playing board games right out of the box.


Pick your game and Dized takes you through it step by step. You get just the information you need to start playing right away. You learn all you need to know about the game– but at a better pace. No info dump, no rules you can’t use yet.
 

 
That means you can go to your friendly local game store, buy a new title, and start playing immediately.


 

Forgot something or need to look something up? Enter the Rule Lookup Tool. We digitize and cross-reference rule books into small, manageable chunks. We’re also working on a powerful search tool which can answer your questions with a few taps. The content will always be up to date and publisher approved.


Our first batch of titles includes something classic, something aimed at families, and a couple of titles for the more demanding hobby gamers. We have plans for hundreds of games, but filling our library in a reasonable time frame is a resource-heavy process: that’s why we need your help to make it happen!
King of Tokyo Tutorial sneak peek!

Blood Rage Tutorial sneak peek!

7 Wonders Tutorial sneak peek!

Scythe Tutorial sneak peek!




We want to make your game nights unforgettable, easy to organize and help you connect with gamers around the globe. Not only are we making learning easier, we’re building a community with these additional tools, available with Full Access:


 

Read more about the Extended Profile!




We want to make board games available to everyone, so we’re offering multiple ways to access Dized. Our credits system allows for more user choice and versatility.
 


 

 

We want everyone to enjoy board games. Free accounts include limited access to Dized features. story:
This game is a culmination of the love that I have for card games, role playing games, true crime and horror. My interest in killers, of all kinds, started at a young age. I grew up just outside Philadelphia and my dad had so many stories to tell. His dealings with Angelo Bruno (head of the Philly Mob), meeting Charles Manson, to leading us to believe that my childhood home was owned by Jeffrey Dahmer's uncle. There has always been one question that I have always wanted to understand: What is the one thing that causes someone to cross the line and become a killer? Many of us fit the common classification, but never cross the line...why? So as I have dug in and really researched these horrific stories I found the passion to create this game.

It is not only a card game, but a compendium of killers that you may/may not know. This has always driven my own curiosity to learn and discover more. As we continue to create expansions and grow the list of killers included it becomes a collectible trading card game.

     

                             

Killers - the card game is a collectible card game currently featuring 25 unique killer cards, 25 victim cards, and 4 unique scenario cards for the base game. The Organized Crime Expansion adds an additional 70 killers, 20 weapons, and 10 scenario cards.

The base game is for 2-5 players, but will increase with expansions.

To win the game be the player that reaches 10 kills first or has the last killer standing.

We are looking to hit our funding goal of $3000 to fulfill the quality manufacturing and production of new cards. This will also enable us the ability to have some stock so we can start sharing the fun at some of the local horror expos that we will be attending.

In addition to the perks that we are already offering we will have some amazing stretch goals:

  • $5,000 - World of Serial Killers Booster Packs unlocked 
  • $7,500 - World of Serial Killers expansion pack unlocked - 20 additional killers, 10 weapons, 5 scenarios
  • $10,000 - Custom evidence dice unlocked     

Estimated shipping costs for Base Game, Add-ons, and Stretch Goals (up to 10lb package)

United States - $10 - 18 (most states) $20 - 25 (Hawaii & Alaska)

Rest of the World - $29 - 40 (estimated)

NOTE these are rough estimated and accurate costs will be calculated after the campaign judging by your actual address.

NOTE we DO NOT cover customs or taxes

       

                         

Since we have the option of a "Flexible" campaign we will be able to fulfill any orders that come in. So if you are a backer and are generous enough to support our amazing campaign, we will have the funds to fulfill any orders that are placed and the included perks. 

                     

                         

  • Shuffle & Deal 5 Killer cards to each player or choose what 5 killers you want to play with (only one of each unique killer can be used each game)
  • Shuffle Victim & Scenario Cards and place in the middle of the play area
  • Decide who will be rolling for the Police (or share the responsibility)
  • Roll to see who goes first
  • That player will draw a Victim Card
    • Victim Card: place it in middle of the play area (Killers that kill within their specialty get a bonus point for each roll)
    • Scenario Card: follow directions on card
  • Choose which killer will attempt an abduction and if it will be a charisma or brutality abduction. Roll Dice and add your charisma or brutality points. 
    • Victim will either be abducted or get away, you may leave evidence
    • If evidence is left, complete an evidence rolI.
  • If Victim is abducted attempt a kill. Roll Dice and add brutality points.
    • Victim with either be killed or get away, you may leave evidence
    • If evidence is left, complete an evidence roll
    • If Victim is killed, place that Victim under that killer
  • Next person takes their turn
  • When all the turns are completed the Police have the chance to search for evidence or apprehend a killer who has 3 pieces of evidence against them found.
    • Searching for evidence: Dice roll minus killers intelligence points determines if evidence is found
    • Apprehending a killer: 3 evidence tokens must be found - Dice roll minus Elusive points determine if killer is apprehended. If killer is apprehended you lose all kills that killer has accrued. 
  • First player to 10 kills or the player who has the last killer standing wins.

Specialty - Charisma/Brutality/Intelligence/Elusive

 

                         

We know that not everyone can contribute, however we appreciate all the support, help, and love from this amazing community. Here is how you can still help:

  • Follow us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/killerstcg
  • Follow us on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/killerstcg/
  • Share this campaign everywhere using "Share This Project"

story:
What's Cartoon Club?

This is a drawing game designed by me, artist Sarah Jane Vickery. Inspired by my online art classes, I designed it as a fun way to bring friends and family together through the ageless art of cartooning.

Who's it for?

This is a game for kids and BIG Kids (that's you adults!) who like to doodle and get creative. You can play on your own, or together with friends and family.

I wanted to give more people the chance to experience my fun approach to being creative!  Whether you're a young artist, a keen doodler or perhaps haven't drawn in a long time... the game is designed to spark and inspire your imagination!

 

You don't have to be an artist!

This is about using your imagination and making simple drawings to create some serious cartoon laughs.

I've taken the best Topics from my weekly Cartoon Club classes, plus the funniest Ideas for characters, captions and crazy objects and put them together in the game for you.  The game rules are even illustrated to make it easy for people who are visual learners like me.

 

 

1. The goal

Your aim is to draw the most fun and creative scene on a single sheet of paper. A picture filled with characters, captions and crazy objects telling a story based on a Topic.


 

2. Get Set Up

It's easy to set up: grab a sheet of paper and a pen or pencil for each player. You'll also need a timer (like on your phone). Use any other pens, markers or colours you like.

3. Choose Game Type

Decide on the type of game you'll play. You can play a quick, standard or long game. The more rounds you play, the more challenging the game! Feel free to change the time per round if all players agree.

4. Select a Topic card

Select a Topic card and read it out loud for the table. Each player will draw their scene based on this Topic for the entire game. These are the best topics from my online class with images to inspire and questions to get your creative juices flowing! 

5. Pick an Idea card

Turn over one Idea card for the table. You can use this as inspiration for drawing on your Topic. Interpret the Idea card as freely as you like. Expand on it as much as you like. You’ll turn over a new Idea card with each drawing round to spark your imagination.

6. Choose your Creative Challenge

Before drawing the round, each player must choose to do one of the following:

a) Use the Idea card

b) Steal an idea (you’ve seen someone else draw after round one)

c) Get creative (and use your imagination!)

7. Time to Draw

Start the timer and begin drawing. Draw as much as you like in the time allowed. 

8. Vote for your Favourite

Stop and look at everyone’s picture. Each player casts one vote for the picture they think is the most fun and creative for that round. You'll claim Creative Challenge points every time someone votes for your picture.

9. Add to your picture

Grab a new Idea card for the table and repeat the same steps with every round. Keep adding more characters, captions and crazy objects to your picture until you’ve completed all drawing rounds. Don't forget your Topic! The more you draw the funnier your picture becomes!

10. The Winner!

By the end you'll have a picture filled with characters, captions and crazy objects telling your very own story on the Topic. The most creative picture wins as voted by you and your fellow Cartoon Clubbers!

More Ways to use the Game...

The game's super fun to play even if you don't keep score. There are lots of ways to use it whether as a game or drawing activity - you'll spark limitless new creations!

✔️ Family games night or Party game

✔️ Play online with friends

✔️ Get inspired to doodle on your own                               

✔️  Homeschooling creative activity                             

✔️ Challenge yourself with a daily doodle      

✔️ Start your own Cartoon Club!

 

I promise you're going to be surprised at just how creative you can be!

Don't think you can draw? ....

Try my Introduction to Cartooning Online Course! It's the perfect way to discover your inner cartoonist. If you want to not only improve your drawing skills but also create your own cool characters and draw fantastic cartoon scenes, this is the course for you! The course will be available in July 2021 - in time for summer - so if you want to spend some time getting creative over the holidays, now's your chance!

 

 

 

Who's the online course for?

The course is aimed at both beginners, who have not done a lot of cartooning before, as well as keen doodlers who want to develop their own style. The course is based on my Cartoon Club for Kids class (ages 8-12) and Discover Your Inner Cartoonist (adult) class. So no matter your age, if you enjoy putting pen to paper, you're going to be surprised at just how creative you can be!

 

What will you learn?

✔️ The fun way to be drawing simple cartoons in no time 

✔️ How to capture great expressions on faces                                 

✔️ Show action and motion in your characters                                 

✔️ Use lettering, bubbles and shapes to draw words                                 

✔️  Design your own cool characters                                 

✔️  Create a fun, fulled cartoon scene                                 

✔️  Make your characters pop with colour

 

Course Content 

How's it different?

This cartooning course is more than just a step-by-step instruction on how to draw cartoons. I’ll explain how I approach each drawing, how I play with ideas to design interesting characters, and the types of questions I ask myself when my drawing isn't quite working out how I want. My goal is to give you the skills to be creative with your drawing and build confidence to solve challenges when you’re working on your own.

 

Wondering if the course is right for you? Try the FREE Course Taster! 

If you want to see what the course is like, grab your pencil and try the Course Taster. It's one full cartooning exercise from the section on Capturing Expression.  It's about 20 minutes long and all you need is a pencil and paper. I promise it’s fun - I think you’ll be surprised at what you'll produce!

 

What are people saying about Cartoon Club?

What do you learn by cartooning? How can you help children get off screens? What's it like learning to draw as an adult? How can kids build a creative mindset? How can you nurture young artists? Check out what other parents and students are saying about Cartoon Club:

 

 

 

The following is a list of the shipping prices. Note for our USA backers we can only ship to the contiguous USA (we cannot ship to Alaska, Puerto Rico, Hawaii, American Samoa, Guam, the Northern Mariana Islands and the U.S. Virgin Islands).  Unfortunately we cannot ship to P.O. boxes as the packages are too large and there is too great a risk of them being bounced back.

The chart below reflects the cost to send 1, 2 or 3 copies of a Cartoon Club Original Game.  Note if you buy additional add-on items then your shipping cost will rise according to the number of copies you buy. 

We’re happy to be working with our partners in Canada who will be manufacturing our game. Me and the Team want to do a great job delivering you, our backers, a fantastic quality product! Plus by manufacturing in North America we’ll significantly decrease our lead-time and your game won’t have to travel half way around the world to reach you. That means great quality, less risk, friendly for the environment and more doodling time for you!

The conservative estimated delivery date for the Game is December 2021 but we think that date will be moved up to be sooner (we'll keep you posted if you'll get your games sooner!).  The Online Course will be available in July 2021.  Due to logistics some backers may receive their games before others depending on their location. 

Terms & Conditions

By pledging to this project you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards are subject to change and may differ from what is presented in the project. We will always do our best to provide exactly what was pictured, but sometimes details change or a card is removed and replaced with another.

We will be using Indiegogo after the campaign has ended to manage shipping information and collect any required local taxes. If you do not log into confirm your pledge in the system within 3 weeks of our notification by email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for the payment or donations received. If you confirm your pledge after the deadline has elapsed then it will be at our discretion as to whether or not we refund or ship your pledge. Unconfirmed pledges make it difficult to plan production and logistics so if you confirm your pledge after the deadline then some items may not be available.

All backers who have selected “No Reward” on the campaign who wish to receive a reward for this campaign must make sure to confirm their order by the deadline. All “No Reward” pledges will be treated as donations once the deadline has passed. If you confirm your pledge before the deadline, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our system. You agree that the title and risk passes to you upon delivery to the carrier for the shipment. You are responsible for any duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, for providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We are unable to ship to PO boxes.

If you do not accept these terms please do not pledge on the Indiegogo project but instead you can wait for the retail release of the game or purchase the online course through our website.

Refund Policy

We will happily refund your pledges minus a 18% cancellation fee which represents the Indiegogo fees, our administration time and payment processing fees up until 3 weeks after the close of the Indiegogo campaign. After that date we will not be able to process refunds. Any "no reward" pledges will not be refunded. We are always happy to refund pledges if for some totally unforeseen reason the game or course can't be delivered at all. Please note that if you do not complete your information by the required deadline, you will not be eligible for a refund. This project is being funded in GBP and any refunds processed will be in GBP for the exact amount received in GBP excluding any applicable fees and depending on the time of the refund being processed. We want you to be a happy Cartoon Clubber! If you have any questions please comment on the campaign or email us at cartoonclub@sarahjanevickery.com and we will get back to you as soon as we can.

 

Share your creations & get inspired!

Thanks for helping us to share the ageless art of cartooning. Me and the Team would love it if you'd share your creations in our Facebook Group and email this campaign to a friend. And I promise... you're going to be surprised at just how creative you can be!
story_txt:
What's Cartoon Club?This is a drawing game designed by me, artist Sarah Jane Vickery. Inspired by my online art classes, I designed it as a fun way to bring friends and family together through the ageless art of cartooning.Who's it for?This is a game for kids and BIG Kids (that's you adults!) who like to doodle and get creative. You can play on your own, or together with friends and family.I wanted to give more people the chance to experience my fun approach to being creative!  Whether you're a young artist, a keen doodler or perhaps haven't drawn in a long time... the game is designed to spark and inspire your imagination! You don't have to be an artist!This is about using your imagination and making simple drawings to create some serious cartoon laughs.I've taken the best Topics from my weekly Cartoon Club classes, plus the funniest Ideas for characters, captions and crazy objects and put them together in the game for you.  The game rules are even illustrated to make it easy for people who are visual learners like me.  
1. The goal
Your aim is to draw the most fun and creative scene on a single sheet of paper. A picture filled with characters, captions and crazy objects telling a story based on a Topic.
 2. Get Set UpIt's easy to set up: grab a sheet of paper and a pen or pencil for each player. You'll also need a timer (like on your phone). Use any other pens, markers or colours you like.3. Choose Game TypeDecide on the type of game you'll play. You can play a quick, standard or long game. The more rounds you play, the more challenging the game! Feel free to change the time per round if all players agree.4. Select a Topic cardSelect a Topic card and read it out loud for the table. Each player will draw their scene based on this Topic for the entire game. These are the best topics from my online class with images to inspire and questions to get your creative juices flowing! 5. Pick an Idea cardTurn over one Idea card for the table. You can use this as inspiration for drawing on your Topic. Interpret the Idea card as freely as you like. Expand on it as much as you like. You’ll turn over a new Idea card with each drawing round to spark your imagination.6. Choose your Creative ChallengeBefore drawing the round, each player must choose to do one of the following:a) Use the Idea cardb) Steal an idea (you’ve seen someone else draw after round one)c) Get creative (and use your imagination!)7. Time to DrawStart the timer and begin drawing. Draw as much as you like in the time allowed. 8. Vote for your FavouriteStop and look at everyone’s picture. Each player casts one vote for the picture they think is the most fun and creative for that round. You'll claim Creative Challenge points every time someone votes for your picture.9. Add to your pictureGrab a new Idea card for the table and repeat the same steps with every round. Keep adding more characters, captions and crazy objects to your picture until you’ve completed all drawing rounds. Don't forget your Topic! The more you draw the funnier your picture becomes!10. The Winner!By the end you'll have a picture filled with characters, captions and crazy objects telling your very own story on the Topic. The most creative picture wins as voted by you and your fellow Cartoon Clubbers!More Ways to use the Game...The game's super fun to play even if you don't keep score. There are lots of ways to use it whether as a game or drawing activity - you'll spark limitless new creations!✔️ Family games night or Party game✔️ Play online with friends✔️ Get inspired to doodle on your own                               ✔️  Homeschooling creative activity                             ✔️ Challenge yourself with a daily doodle      ✔️ Start your own Cartoon Club! I promise you're going to be surprised at just how creative you can be!Don't think you can draw? ....Try my Introduction to Cartooning Online Course! I’ll explain how I approach each drawing, how I play with ideas to design interesting characters, and the types of questions I ask myself when my drawing isn't quite working out how I want. My goal is to give you the skills to be creative with your drawing and build confidence to solve challenges when you’re working on your own. Wondering if the course is right for you? Try the FREE Course Taster! If you want to see what the course is like, grab your pencil and try the Course Taster. It's one full cartooning exercise from the section on Capturing Expression.  It's about 20 minutes long and all you need is a pencil and paper. I promise it’s fun - I think you’ll be surprised at what you'll produce! What are people saying about Cartoon Club?What do you learn by cartooning? How can you help children get off screens? What's it like learning to draw as an adult? How can kids build a creative mindset? How can you nurture young artists? story:
Don't want to scroll down but just want to play card games? In short, King Fridge is a fun, fast & strategic card game. Back it now and get an early version. More backers means more upgrades for everyone!

If you experience any difficulties in the payment process, perhaps because you don't have a credit card, then let us know by sending an email to info@kingfridgegame.com. Of course you can also contact Koen, Niels, Dennis or Sjoerd directly. We will make sure King Fridge safely gets to you!

Before you start reading our game manual, just watch our 3 minute explainer video. It will explain all elements you need to know to play your first game of King Fridge.

 

 

The goal is to get the lowest score. Every player starts the game with four fridge cards face-down in front of them. Check and remember the nearest two fridge cards. Now, play the game by taking turns drawing a fridge card. Swap it for one of the fridge cards in front of you or discard it. Your cards will remain face-down during the game. The options when taking your turn: 

Be on edge to dump one of your fridge cards when someone discards a card with the same dish/number as your own. Only one card may be dumped in each turn, so be quick. You snooze, you lose. 

All fridge cards carry a number, ranging from -2 to 30. Collect the lowest numbers to win! Watch out for the Fatal Fruit...

Some fridge cards state an action. When you discard a fridge card, you must use its action. Use actions to check out other players’ cards and improve your own. Always remember your allergies, and play special cards to further spice up the game!

Are you confident enough that you have the lowest number of points? Claim King Fridge to try to improve your score even further and to initiate the end of the round. For more details regarding the scoring of each round, the unique actions of the fridge cards and the disrupting effects of the special cards, have a look at our user guide!

Back our project by choosing one of the reward levels! We have tried to keep prices as low as possible. Larger reward packages are priced even more attractively.

*All prices exclude shipping costs, which may apply. We keep these costs as low as possible, and specify them below on this page. 

For more reviews of King Fridge, visit our Instagram page!

After the campaign ends, we will request your shipping preferences and if applicable charge a shipping fee. The final shipping fees will be calculated by our logistic provider at the end of the campaign - we try to keep shipping fees as low as possible. Moreover, if you use pick-up to get your reward, no shipping fee will be charged. 

*Pick-up will only be available in/near the Dutch cities of Breda, Delft, Eindhoven & Nijmegen, and Basel (Switzerland). 

Thanks for checking out King Fridge and backing our Indiegogo! 

We are Dennis, Sjoerd, Niels and Koen, four friends from the Netherlands. Whenever we can, we like to set out on hiking trips in the mountains. At night, we rest our feet, take a cold beer, and play all kinds of card games. Last summer, we started experimenting with playing cards and ended up with a surprisingly fun game. We played all night long. Not too long after, one of us uttered the magic words: everyone should know this game. Now, 9 months later, we can finally present our baby - the card game - to you. 

We are ready... We just need your help to cover the costs of mass production! We will begin production as soon as our Indiegogo campaign ends. Fulfilment will happen as soon as the production is completed. 

July - September: Indiegogo & collect backer information

August - September: Prepare for production, and start production queue time

October: Production begins by our partner & prepare fulfilment with logistic partner 

November: Production completes & ships to fulfilment centers

December - January: King Fridge is on (its way to) your doorstep

We are allowing ourselves a bit of extra time to take into account any production or fulfilment delays. Although we work with respective partners with a lot of experience in the industry, we just want to make sure that we meet your expectations. If we are able to get the game to you earlier than outlined above, we will most definitely!

July 2015 - A quantum physicist, a mechanical engineer, a technical engineer and an econometrician walk into an office in Hong Kong. It sounds like the start of a bad joke, but in reality it was the start of a close friendship. Guess what? We had a shared passion for hiking, exploring cultures and most importantly card games. And so the story began.

August 2020 - Yes, not a typo, we just leaped forward in time as 5 years after our first hike together we decided to go on a hiking trip like we did each year. We’d always liked to play card games and talked before about creating one together. During the period when the European borders were open for a while, we went on a hiking trip in Switzerland. One evening, with our feet up and a beer in hand, we decided to ‘walk the talk’ and come up with our own card game. We had thought about it for a while and many ideas and game mechanisms did pass the table that night. At the end of the brainstorm we felt we were onto something. The days after we started playing in the mountain cottage where we slept and the game started to become more exciting. On the last night we decided: everyone should get to know this game!

October 2020 - And so the process began. Although it was our first game to create, we were committed and went to work in our evening hours. It was a challenging process which required a lot of imagination but the interesting part was that hidden talents surfaced. Koen turned out to be quite skilled at drawing so he was promoted to chief design officer. After two months, we were quite satisfied with the game mechanism and initial designs. We created an initial prototype and we started to play with dozens of friends to test our game. Looking back, this is the best thing we could have done as they gave us a lot of new input to digest. At this point, we were still very much focused on the game mechanism rather than the design itself. And as you can see below… quite lame, right? Still, the play testers seemed to like it so it gave us confidence to sail ahead and focus on the design itself!

During these months, our designer Koen started to draw and digitalise the first designs. And the rise of King Fridge, First of His Name, The Cool King of Food, Sir of the Spoiled and the Fresh... Allright, let's stick with King Fridge.  

February 2020 - A few months passed playing the game over and over again with different prototypes. The largest part of our time was focused on creating the unique designs and to make sure the rules were written as simple and clearly as possible (which turned out to be quite a challenge…). Each iteration we took the opportunity to test the game with a different group of play-testers and so the cycle repeated. Slowly but steadily, the game came to life…

June 2021 - Who could have imagined!? Almost 6 six years after our first hike together, we have a card game in our own hands and ready to share with you. We have poured a lot of time and energy into this project and we are super excited to now finally share this game with you. With your support, we can realise this dream and give you an early copy of our first ever card game called King Fridge. We are committed to bring you many more card games in the future as we fell in love with the game creation process. Thank you for reading, your support and considering to add us to your game collection!

Greetings from the Kingdom of the Netherlands - Koen, Niels, Sjoerd & Dennis

All cards in the Kingdom of King Fridge, stretch goal additions still excluded

story:
The Folio: Black Label series are fantasy adventure modules that are compatible with BOTH classic Advanced Dungeons & Dragons and 5th Edition D&D formats.  Each adventure combines what I enjoyed most from the heady days of of the late 1970s and the 1980s swords & sorcery storytelling. 

The Folio: Black Label #5 continues an adventure path pitting the characters against a demonic slaving nation bound to a cursed ruin called The Burning City.  In this adventure the characters will continue to try to retrieve a stolen noble before she is taken too deep into the demon insect infested 'ash lands' that surround The Burning City for hundreds of miles.  They must brave a slaver camp and then enter the old Temple of the Moon, a long abandoned religious structure that now houses demon insects, fell shaman, and wasteland raiders.

Taking a page from the previous Black Label Trilogy, this one is going to have an even more adult edge than can found in the standard Folio, and yes, there might be some nudity, and maybe some horror, and maybe a twisted quality here or there, but at the base its really just about the unfettered fun of hacking and slashing your way through a pulp style adventure with blatant evil doers, magical treasures, and exposed flesh.  

So, I'm throwing out the standard politically correct playbook, and turning the flux capacitor back to the early days of gaming.  I hope some of you will join me. 

Who is this adventure for?: It will be based around  classic AD&D gaming mechanics, while also have 'grey' stat and  treasure blocks for 5th Edition D&D,  so it is easily playable in  BOTH formats.  It has been designed for  6-8 characters, roughly 2nd  through 4th, and will include incredible maps and artwork that will get your creative juices flowing!   Just check out some of the maps below for what will be awaiting you.

What does the adventure Dagger, Venom, Throne revolve around? Well, this will be a standard swords & sorcery based adventure that deals with the lair you see above, located in the deadly 'ash lands'.  Characters will be required by an outside contract to return the daughter of a noble that fell victim to the roving slavers, bound for The Burning City.  The question will be, can the characters get in and out before the entire land rises up against them?

Is there any other background on the setting? Yes, we here at Art of the Genre produced a 544 page novel with attached setting gazetteer in the back.  If you like dark (and erotic) fully illustrated fantasy, then The Burning City will put you on the right path to fully enjoy the setting we are creating in this new adventure module trilogy.

What are all the other Folio products? The bulk of the Folio adventure series has  been in physical form and can be found at artofthegenre.com.   For the  purposes of some of the upper pledge levels, these previously  produced  adventures are offered.  Thus far, there  have been  26 Folio standard removable cover adventures, and 7 hardcover Folio books  (4 compile and reprint the Folio campaigns, and 2 are gaming supplements).

What are the 'Orange Spine' books?: These 'Complete' volumes include not only all the information from 6 Folio adventure modules, but also 6 or more 'mini-adventure' supplements  added for extra content, iconic character cards that are playable, and a  gazetteer supplement that defines the world the adventure takes place  in.   These compiled volumes include:

The Complete Roslof Keep Campaign (Folio #1-#6)

The Cities of Sorcery (Folio #8-#13)

The Complete White Ship (Folio #14-#19)

The Complete Curse of Roslof Keep (Folio #20-#25, which is a high level campaign)

Also included is the Storyteller's Arcana, a 128 page DM & Player guide of my own tips and experiences in 30 years of gaming, and the Folio of Fiendish Monsters with 115 new monsters.  ALL these books are in in both AD&D and 5th Edition D&D formats. 

 

*TRADEMARK DISCLAIMER

"D&D" and "AD&D" are trademarks of Wizards of the Coast, LLC. Art of the Genre is not affiliated with Wizards of the Coast LLC. We make no claim to, or challenge to, such trademarks

story:
The fishing town of Ostin on the south shores of Kadalon Bay is under attack! A massive tentacled beast, a mighty kraken even, has been attacking the fishing boats. Can a band of heroes arrive to save them from this threat? 

Let's Get Kraken is an adventure for 2-6 characters levels 5-7 that pits them against a kraken ... no, really: they go up against a monster so powerful our heroes are mere fleas. There is hope, for a mad sorcerer bent on revenge is controlling the kraken. Stop him, stop the kraken. The kraken is not the only great beast in the sea, and the massive Island that Dreams can be awakened, if the characters can find the right ritual and perform it. Summon your own gargantuan beast, battle a mad sorcerer, explore the Wievin Strip and the town of Ostin. Sounds like … an adventure! 

Time to get started: Let's Get Kraken!

Contents

Let's Get Kraken contains:

  • Four new monsters
  • Detailed NPCs
  • Seven full-color maps
  • A kraken

The Project 

Necromancer Games projects on Indiegogo are simple, focused, and short.

  • Short in duration (2-3 weeks)
  • Fast delivery of PDF once funding is completed
  • Limited to a single title
  • Have options priced between $5-$30
  • Stretch goals and project bonuses (if any) affect the principle reward only (usually both the PDF and the softcover).
  • Are the only guaranteed method to get the premium* print copy (NOTE: the softcover versions  in this printing will not be sold on our website: see FAQ for explanation).
  • Have a simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit

 

*Premium means heavyweight glossy interior pages enhancing the art and color elements. The  thick, glossy cardstock brings out the vibrant color of the cover illustration. These are the nicest softcover books we have ever sold and we only print a title this way once.

Any reprint would use print on demand service that, although nice, do not approach the quality of our INDIEGOGO funded books.

Why the Tiny Print Run?

Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.

This has resulted in Kickstarter's with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive to buy for customers like you because they are very expensive to make for publishers like us.

Why not use Kickstarter?

We will still be using Kickstarter, frequently, for our large-scale projects, but we hear the request for less expensive options for our products all the time, especially smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions.

Product enhancements tied to project success 

During the funding period for Let's Get Kraken and after the funding goal is met we will  improve the delivered product based on additional sales. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases, the better the final product will be for everybody.

Examples of improvements made to earlier products:

  • Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure. 
  • The previous Indiegogo project added 2 interior art pieces and 3 extra creature illustrations for its appendix.
  • Downloadable Options designed for popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Christmas! and In Vino Gigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 
  • High-resolution files of illustrations to share with players at the table.

Project Delivery

PDF Perks

We will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing PDF items. The PDF files are distributed using Constant Contact service and our web store. You will need to have a customer account on the Frog God Games website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access by you to your reward.

The Indiegogo perk PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by supporters (as they are paid for during the Indiegogo promotion) at our web store using a coupon code. That code we will be sent via Constant Contact to the address provided by Indiegogo. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.

Softcover Perks

Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 

 

Overseas Shipping

For the last several months, as those of you who follow us on Discord know, we have been grappling with the issue of high costs on shipping to locations outside the USA. We have decided that the most cost-effective way for our overseas customers to get books is by printing the books in print-on-demand format. This does not affect the USA, where we will continue ordinary printing and shipping.

The print-on-demand books international customers will be receiving are high quality, but please be aware that they are different fromÂ the premium-quality books we are advertising for sale in the USA.

We have tremendous love and respect for our international customers, and this is the most workable way we have been able to find to keep you supplied with books with reliable delivery times at a reasonable price.

story:
A Quick Content-Warning On This One: The Fiend of Turlin’s Well is a psychological horror adventure in a swords & sorcery setting. It contains numerous gory descriptions and situations that go beyond the ordinary style of swords & sorcery fiction and are more what one would expect in horror fiction. There is a dark element in most sword & sorcery fiction, which we embrace as a part of that literary genre, but The Fiend of Turlin’s Well unquestionably crosses over from the swords & sorcery approach of “dark-by-implication” into the horror genre of “look-into-the-dark.” Many of our fans have asked for adventures like this one, but by the same token we don’t want to surprise or ambush fans who expect a pure swords & sorcery genre adventure. If you’re interested so far, then by all means, please read on …

The Basics

The Fiend of Turlin’s Well seems like an ordinary city adventure at the beginning, set in the Turlin’s Well District of the City of Bard’s Gate, but gets darker and stranger as events move on. An unknown troublemaker is progressing from vandalism to kidnapping to murder, and the district’s civil order starts to come unraveled as the city watch remains helpless to stop the very visible crimes. The adventure is for introductory-level characters (level 1-2), but the players should be experienced; the courses of action aren't obvious enough for beginning players.

Spoiler Alert: For the GM Only

Torad Yarog, the Fiend, is not only a doppelganger with multiple personalities, he is also the captain of an inter-dimensional ship and a favored cultist of the Demon-Princess Teratashia, Mistress of the Gaps between realities. Hunting him down leads the characters to an old manor house in the city filled with gruesome evidence of the Fiend’s crimes, and clues that allow them to pursue the truth onward to the Death-Ship of the Roach Princess (soon to be released via Indiegogo).

 

About Pathfinder

We are not publishing a full Pathfinder version of The Fiend of Turlin's Well. However, we have given permission for Michael Russell's patreon to prepare a set of conversion notes for the adventure after the Indiegogo. If you plan on running the adventure for Pathfinder using these notes, you will need a copy of the adventure itself (in either version) to refer to.

Death-Ship of the Roach Princess

The Fiend of Turlin's Well has a companion adventure by Matt Finch that can be used as either the prequel or sequel. There are two interrelated things happening, and the order in which the characters encounter them isn't vital. If you would like to sign up to receive a notification when we launch the Indiegogo for Death-Ship of the Roach Princess, click here.

The Project 

Frog God Games projects on Indiegogo are simple, focused, and short.

  • Short in duration (2-3 weeks)
  • Fast delivery of PDF once funding is completed
  • Limited to a single title
  • Have options priced between $5-$30
  • Stretch goals and project bonuses (if any) affect the principle reward only (usually both the PDF and the softcover).
  • Are the only guaranteed method to get the premium* print copy (NOTE: the softcover versions  in this printing will not be sold on our website: see FAQ for explanation).
  • Have a simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit

*Premium means heavyweight glossy interior pages enhancing the art and color elements. The  thick, glossy cardstock brings out the vibrant color of the cover illustration. These are the nicest softcover books we have ever sold and we only print a title this way once.

Any reprint would use print on demand service that, although nice, do not approach the quality of our INDIEGOGO funded books.

Why the Tiny Print Run?

Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.

This has resulted in Kickstarter's with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive to buy for customers like you because they are very expensive to make for publishers like us.

Why not use Kickstarter?

We will still be using Kickstarter, frequently, for our large-scale projects, but we hear the request for less expensive options for our products all the time, especially smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions.

Product enhancements tied to project success 

During the funding period for The Fiend of Turlin's Well and after the funding goal is met we will  improve the delivered product based on additional sales. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases, the better the final product will be for everybody.

Examples of improvements made to earlier products:

  • Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure. 
  • The previous Indiegogo project added 2 interior art pieces and 3 extra creature illustrations for its appendix.
  • Downloadable Options designed for popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Christmas! and In Vino Gigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 
  • High-resolution files of illustrations to share with players at the table.

Project Delivery

PDF Perks

We will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing PDF items. The PDF files are distributed using Constant Contact service and our web store. You will need to have a customer account on the Frog God Games website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access by you to your reward.

The Indiegogo perk PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by supporters (as they are paid for during the Indiegogo promotion) at the Frog God Games web store using a coupon code. That code we will be sent via Constant Contact to the address provided by Indiegogo. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.

After the project ends a second coupon is provided allowing supporters' digital rewards to be included in their DriveThruRPG.com PDF library.

Softcover Perks

Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 

Overseas Shipping

For the last several months, as those of you who follow us on Discord know, we have been grappling with the issue of high costs on shipping to locations outside the USA. We have decided that the most cost-effective way for our overseas customers to get books is by printing the books in print-on-demand format. This does not affect the USA, where we will continue ordinary printing and shipping.

The print-on-demand books international customers will be receiving are high quality, but please be aware that they are different from the premium-quality books we are advertising for sale in the USA.

We have tremendous love and respect for our international customers, and this is the most workable way we have been able to find to keep you supplied with books with reliable delivery times at a reasonable price.

story:
JOIN US & CONTRIBUTE to the Production of the FIRST FULL LINE of Very Good Puzzles!

The Very Good Puzzle Story

Our hometown of Athens, Georgia is a beautiful small community with broad, diverse sensibilities. Art is everywhere here. We love puzzling, and we love art so we make jigsaw puzzles featuring art and artists we love.

We have always believed in the goodness of puzzles and we like puzzling for a lot of reasons...

  • quality family time
  • promotes teamwork and better communication
  • meditative practice from a distraction-heavy culture
  • brain exercise
  • it’s fun!  

But we also wanted something new and different, puzzles featuring beautiful art that we love. Puzzles we couldn’t wait to put together. Puzzles that made people really appreciate, and become intimate with, the artwork while putting it together.

Us...

We operate from our hometown of Athens, Georgia. It’s a wonderful small community with broad, diverse sensibilities. Since we love art and puzzling, and art is everywhere here, we combined these two passions. Our designs and photos are chosen from captivating artists that really capture the spirit of Athens. Our hope is to share their perspective to a broad audience through the practice of puzzling!

Our puzzles are:

  • printed in Athens, GA
  • made in the USA
  • printed with soy-based inks
  • made from recycled cardboard
  • made with durable, double-thick puzzle board resulting in fully interlocking pieces
  • finished with a matte coating to reduce glare and complement the art

Gratitude

We’d like to give a very special thank you to Lou Kregel.  From the minute we approached her with our “grand” idea, she was all in.  No hesitations, just pure excitement and gave much needed advice and enthusiasm along the way.  And Athens, as usual, has been completely supportive. We’d like to express our gratitude to Gary Schechterle, Carla Malcom, Misty Turbeville, Fauna Hartley, Pixel & Ink Studio, Avid Bookshop, Frontier Gift Shop, Treehouse Kid & Craft, Ruth Allen, Marilyn Estes, John Lukas for helping us create a stellar video!, Satisfactory Printing, Greater GA Printers, Reign Streiter, Marion Montgomery, Rook & Pawn, Paige Cole, Jessica Greene, Will Eskridge, John Cleaveland, Lisa Freeman, Jill Carnes, Vernon Thornsberry, Eleanor Davis, Sara Machen Fogle, Susan Pelham, David Hale and Jason Thrasher.  And this magical town for inspiring it all.

Very Good Communities

 

The Art & the Artists

story_txt:
JOIN US & CONTRIBUTE to the Production of the FIRST FULL LINE of Very Good Puzzles!

The Very Good Puzzle Story
Our hometown of Athens, Georgia is a beautiful small community with broad, diverse sensibilities. Art is everywhere here. We love puzzling, and we love art so we make jigsaw puzzles featuring art and artists we love.
We have always believed in the goodness of puzzles and we like puzzling for a lot of reasons...

quality family time
promotes teamwork and better communication
meditative practice from a distraction-heavy culture
brain exercise
it’s fun!  

But we also wanted something new and different, puzzles featuring beautiful art that we love. Puzzles we couldn’t wait to put together. Puzzles that made people really appreciate, and become intimate with, the artwork while putting it together.
Us...

finished with a matte coating to reduce glare and complement the art
